Because the heating season is starting very soon, Venera decided to request a loan in order to purchase coal for the winter. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of new bedding assortment to expand selection and attract more customers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old and married to Cristomae, who is 42 years old and works as a vegetable farmer.  They have two children, Jervish John, a second-year college student, and Imee Flor, who is in her first year of high school.  

Imelda has been a vegetable vendor for 14 years.  Her business has been helped her earn the money needed to send her children to school and to provide them with a school allowance.  

She wants to expand her vegetable farm but she needs additional resources to buy seeds for planting so she can increase their harvest and earn more income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 for this purpose.  This way their family income will improve and also their way of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly E.’s business is not only supporting and sustaining the needs of her family but also her fellow small entrepreneurs in their village in a very remote municipality of Libertad in Antique province. Through a loan and the proceeds from her hog (pig) fattening business, she has been able to buy native mats manufactured in their village and bring them to market for sale. If she is not contented with her daily sales turnover in the market, she goes to other municipalities on their scheduled market day to sell.

Without much training, Sherly has able to develop an entrepreneurial skill and attitude within herself through practical experience, just like other poor women. She is determined to change their standard of living so that her 17-year-old only child can graduate from college. She will never surrender to the challenges poverty will bring her. Through loans she can access from ASHI and KIVA, she will be have an opportunity to grow and expand her hog fattening business until she has a piggery.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase piglets and food for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charcoal

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es: Marlene Elizabeth G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Izalco en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, los cuales los comercializa de manera ambulante. Así también vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y dos años de edad. Marlene posee una venta de muchos productos como baterías, peines, ganchos para el cabello y otros más. Actualmente ella junto a su esposo están atravesando por un momento muy difícil ya que no cuenta con algunos de los servicios básicos en el hogar como el agua y la luz, debido a que no cuentan con el capital necesario para poder costearlos. Es por esto que Marlene solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar su inventario con productos como lámparas, calculadoras, radios y más. Todo esto con el fin de poder contar con ellos en esta época navideña de manera que sus ventas puedan ser muy buenas y así aumentar sus ganancias, lo cual lo desea mucho ya que espera poder mejorar su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Marlene Elizabeth G. is 23 years of age and lives in Izalco in the Sonsonate Department. She lives together with her husband, who works as a trader for various products, which he markets door to door. She also lives together with her two small children, 3 and 2 years of age. Marlene sells many products such as batteries, combs, hair clips and other things. She and her husband are actually passing through a difficult moment as they don't have some basic home services such as water and light, owing to the fact that they don't have the necessary capital to buy them. It is for this reason that Marlene is seeking a loan, with which she can expand her inventory with products such as lamps, calculators, radios and more. These will help them during the Christmas period as their sales can be very good and they can augment their earnings, which she greatly desires and hopes to be able to improve her family situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lamps, calculators and radios

loans.name: Ahotefo Group

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently all her children are in the junior and the primary school level. She has been a local manufacturer of soap called Azuma Blows for five years now. Her soap is named after a former international boxer who is a Ghanaian with the name of Azuma Nelson. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She also sells local and rich kente cloth. She takes stock of kente from suppliers from Bonwire,  a home of kente. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahotefo’, which literally means Saints. She is the one standing third from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food vendors respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 21 years old, is single, and he lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately two hours drive from the capital city of Kigali. His village is called Gakenke.

Samuel is a farmer of fruit. He is now requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business and satisfy his customers needs. He has an experience of five years in this field and starts his business activities from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. every day except on weekends.

After accessing this loan, Samuel will be able to change his business situation, which will allow him to earn more profits. With the extra profits, Samuel expects to get married.
 
By the way, Samuel has the will to succeed in his business, which is proof that he will progress in his activities.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Freria

texts.en:
Freria N. Simiyu is a 50-year-old widow living in Kwirare in Busia District with her five (5) children. Being a sole bread winner for her family, Freria abandoned farming, venturing into fish sales in 1990, which, according to her, generates more income than farming.

Just like any other business person, Freria would like to see her business expand so as to ensure economic stability for her family. This, and the knowledge she got from KMET on economic development, made her think of the possibility of financial assistance in the form of a loan. She would like to acquire a KES 20,000 loan that would be used to increase her stock so that she will earn more revenue.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 41-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children.

Yousef has been working as a car electrician since 1996. He is speciA. in his work because of his clean and clear work. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and also thanks to his experience. However, when he first started his business he passed through some financiA. issues. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

Yousef requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es:
Lindaura tiene 40 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de su hermana localizada en el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito cuya población se encuentra en su mayoria en zonas rurales y que está ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus menores hijos hizo que hace un año empezara un negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, Lindaura los cría en jaulas, las cuales tiene instaladas en la parte posterior de la vivienda en donde vive y los vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. 

Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como obrera agrícola, pero la necesidad de obtener una fuente estable de ingresos ha hecho que poco a poco le brinde mas tiempo a la crianza de sus cuyes, es así que en un año su cría ha aumentado considerablemente y ha tenido que invertir las ganancias de su negocio en la construcción de nuevas javas.

Lindaura desea comprar más alimento para mejorar la calidad de sus animales, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Lindaura es una mujer responsable y muy luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos profesionales de éxito. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lindaura is 40 years old, separated, and has two children. She lives at her sister’s house, which is located in the District of Mórrope. The inhabitants of this district mostly live in rural areas and can be found in the Province of Lambayeque, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Lindaura needed for her children to get ahead, so she started a business a year ago of raising and selling guinea pigs. She keeps them in cages that she stores at the back of her home and sells them to dealers who frequent the area. Prior to this business, she worked as a farm laborer but the need to obtain a stable source of income made her gradually devote more to time to raising guinea pigs. Within a year, her business has grown considerably and she has plans to invest the earnings into building new cages.

Lindaura wants to buy more feed to improve the quality of her animals. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpymne Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to meet this objective. Lindaura is a responsible and determined woman. Her greatest wish is to see her children become successful professionals. She has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Good People Group

texts.en:
Mai F. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Good People. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children aged 4 to 27. Mai did not have the opportunity to go to school.
For the past 25 years, Mai has been running her restaurant at the Red Light community in Paynesville, Liberia. She prepares her food very well and talks to customers in a nice manner, which keeps them returning. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 26,000 LRD group loan to purchase additional food for her restaurant. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mai is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional food for her restaurant

loans.name: Shittu

texts.en: Shittu, residing with her family in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, is very hardworking and makes sure that she has food on the table everyday through her work selling clothing and school cardigans. In this business for over 15 years, she sells to many schools.  Shittu is 33 years old, married, and has two children, both doing well in school. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to help her make the business more profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Srina's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srina C. is 30 years old. She is a widow with two children who are both too young to study or work. Mrs. Srina C. is the leader of group loan. She has been selected by 5-members, located in Rovieng village, in Takeo province. With the loans, they hope to increase income to improve their family living. Mrs. Srina C. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farming, she decided to ask for a loan to hire farming laborers. Aside from farmer, she is a pig breeder and can earn a small income to support her family's cost of living.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire farming laborers.

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Progresistas  está ubicado en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  capital de la provincia del Azuay, está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999. En esta ocasion nos acompaña la niña de una de nuestras socias del banco.

La señora  Trancito Domínguez   tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos  que  se encuentran de 15, 13, 5 años, su primer hijo cursa la secundaria,  su segunda hija en la escuela y su último hijo esta en el jardín de infantes de la ciudad,  no recibe ningún apoyo por parte del padre de sus hijos y tampoco cuenta con  casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Trancito se dedica hace 5 años a realizar rehabilitaciones físicas, aprendió realizando tres años de cursos y también ha trabajado con un doctor especialista en traumatología, ahora labora desde su casa de 9 a.m. a 5 p.m. todos los días y también vende productos naturales para sus pacientes,  este es su primer crédito  en la fundación invitada por una amiga que ya pertenecía del bankito y con el comprará vitaminas, suplementos, proteínas, etc.

Su meta es de tener un centro naturista.

La  señora  María Juana  C.  tiene 70 años de edad, enviudó hace 35 años ya que a su difunto esposo le dio pulmonía, concibió cuatro hijos tres de ellos son casados  y viven en diferentes  partes de la ciudad, su otra hija falleció a causa   de una meningitis bacteriana dejando en la orfandad a dos niñas con quienes vive  en una casa arrendada en el sector  Yanuncay.

Doña Maria Juana  es negociante de ganado vacuno, cuyes y pollos   hace  ya 20 años y solo vende los días miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos,  se     encuentra en su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el   crédito anterior montó su negocio de animales y  ahora con su nuevo préstamo comprará crías de pollos, cuyes y alimento para incrementar su criadero hasta que dios le permita seguir con sus fuerzas.

Su mayor sueño es de tener una casa propia para su tranquilidad y de sus nietas.
texts.en:
The “Las Progresistas” (The Progressive Ones) communal bank is located in greater Cuenca, Azuay province capital, located in the southern part of the Ecuadorean Andes. It is Ecuador’s third most important city and noted for its tranquility and old city charm. Its historic city center was declared Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. (On this occasion the daughter of one of our members accompanies us). Trancito Domínguez, 32, is a single mother of three children who are 15, 13 and 5 years old. Her oldest son is in middle school, her second daughter is in elementary school and her last son is in the city’s kindergarten. The children’s father does not provide any support and she also does not own her own home; she rents. She has been a physical therapist for the last five years; she took three year’s worth of course work and has also worked with a doctor who specializes in traumatology. Now, she works from home from 9am until 5pm every day and also sells natural products to her patients. This is her 1st loan with the foundation; she was invited to join by a girl friend who was already a member of the communal bank. She will use the funds to buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, proteins, etc. Her goal is to have a health spa. María Juana C., 70, was widowed 35 years ago; her husband died of pneumonia. She had four children, three of whom are married and live in other parts of the city. Her other daughter died due to bacterial meningitis leaving two orphaned daughters with whom she lives in a rented house in the Yanuncay neighborhood. María Juana has been a cattle, guinea-pig and chicken merchant for the last 20 years; she only sells on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays. This is her 2nd cycle with her communal bank. She used her previous loan to set up her animal business and will use this new loan to buy chicks, guinea-pigs and feed so that her animal nursery will continue growing as long as God gives her the strength to continue. Her greatest dream is to own her own house for her own and her granddaughters’ peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vitamins, proteins, nutritional supplements, chicks, guinea-pigs and feed.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar B. est un habitant du quartier de Daroukhane. Il est âgé  de 34 ans et est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mai 2008. Il a déjà rembourse 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 7 ans. Monsieur B. est un électromécanique qui exerce aussi l’activité  de vente d’appareils portables. Après une formation théorique il a été embauche dans une entreprise de traitement de matière  plastique depuis 2008. Son salaire ne lui permettant pas de régler l’intégralité de ses charges familiales il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de portables qu’il va placer au niveau de ses collègues. Ces derniers   vont le payer a la fin du mois. Son financement va l’aider à renforcer son fond et avoir la capacité  de diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar B. is a resident of the Daroukhane district. He is 34 years old and has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2008. He has already repaid two previous loans. He is married and the father of two children, who are 4 and 7 years of age. Mr. B. is an electronics repairman who also has a business selling mobile phones. After some theoretical training, he was hired in 2008 by a company that processes plastics. His salary is not sufficient for covering all family expenses. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for buying mobile phones. He will deliver these phones to his colleagues, who are going to pay him at the end of the month. His financing will help him to boost his capital and to have the ability to diversify his commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting his capital

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita A., 48, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Enrique A., a driver, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Amelita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

To ensure the success of her business, Amelita would like to apply for a PHP 39,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages to replenish and maintain her current inventory.

Amelita dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to replenish and maintain her current inventory

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has been operating his retail business for the last three years. Previously he was working as a truck driver. The photo was taken at the main entrance of his shop. He sells retail in his community. The major challenge in his business is seasonality. Martin has another source of income from a side job driving commercial vehicles. He is a married man with a one year old child. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, Martin wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and a sack of rice and to expand his business. Martin hopes that in future he will sell wholesale and cover a larger market. He decided to work with Yehu because of the accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase three bundles of  wheat flour, maize flour and a sack of rice

loans.name: María Jovita

texts.es:
María Jovita tiene 50 años D. edad, es separada, no cuenta con carga familiar y resiD. en el distrito D. La Victoria, un distrito que durante los ultimos meses ha experimentado un considerable crecimiento urbano, es un distrito que limita con la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María se dedida al comercio mayorista D. verduras en el mercado Los Pathos, un mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, allí, ella va desD. muy tempranas horas a adquirir verduras D. temporada a los distribuidores que traen sus productos en camiones para luego ofrecérselas durante la mañana a los comerciantes minoristas D. la región. Ella tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio, lo que le ha permitido hacerse conocida en el rubro.

María desea realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura D. su vivienda D. modo que pueda mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.	

Ella es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Jovita is 50 years old, separated and lives by herself in La Victoria, a district that has experienced considerable urban growth over the past months. The district borders the city of Chiclayo, Peru. María makes a living as a wholesale merchant selling vegetables in the Los Pathos market, a wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. She goes there very early in the morning to acquire her seasonal vegetables from the distributors who bring the products in trucks, and then offers the products throughout the morning to the retail merchants of the region. She has a good amount of experience in the business, which has allowed her to become known in the traD.. María wishes to carry out some improvements to her home's infrastructure to improve her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to achieve this objective. She is a hard-working and responsible person who has taken out loans in the past and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her home's infrastructure

loans.name: Gladys Azucena

texts.es:
Gladys Azucena Z. V., tiene 38 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Catherine y Gabriel. 

Gladys es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños sacar adelante a los hijos y comprar un  terreno. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como gusano, y otras enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los niños.
texts.en:
Gladys Azucena Z. V. is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, Catherine and Gabriel. They live in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Gladys is a partner in the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 23 partners most of whom work in agriculture. This is the second loan that they are applying for with the San Jose Cooperative. Gladys works growing corn and beans. She makes her purchases once a month in Vnetanas and sells her produce there too. She will use the loan to purchase seeds to grow corn and beans. She believes that the loan is a great opportunity to improve her life. Her dreams are to help her children succeed and to purchase a plot of land. Her business faces challenges like infestations and plant diseases such as worms. In her spare time she likes to play sports with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and beans for planting

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Turduhan's Group

texts.en:
Turduhan D. is the leader of this group. She is sixty and married. She has seven children: her sons are forty-one, thirty-nine, thirty-seven, thirty-two, twenty-eight, twenty-two and her daughter is thirty-three. All her children work as sellers at “Dordoi” market in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and each of them sends their mother 6,000 soms monthly. Her husband is farmer, and she breeds cattle. Twenty years ago, she started to breed livestock with initial investment of 1000 soms. Now, reselling some livestock after fattening and at a higher price, she makes 3,000 soms per month. She is applying for a loan in order to buy four sheep and increase her turnover and as a result her profits. In the future, she is planning to celebrate the marriage of one of her sons. 

Group members:

Zymyrat K. is treasurer of the group. She is forty-six and married. She has four children: her sons are twenty-three and twenty-one, and her daughters are twenty-three and twenty-one. Her sons works as builders in Russia and their monthly income is 25,000 soms. Her husband is a taxi driver. Zymyrat breeds cattle and sews traditional clothing. She started twenty-four years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 soms. Now, cattle breeding and sewing traditional clothing brings her 1,500 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan to buy more cattle and increase her turnover. With the profits from cattle breeding, she is planning to help her sons enter institutions of higher education.
 
Nurzhamal T. is forty-eight and married. She has five children: her sons are eighteen, thirteen, and nineteen, and her daughters are twenty-four and twenty-two years old. Her daughters work in a sewing workshop, while Nurzhamal breeds cattle. She started cattle breeding twenty-eight years ago with initial investment of 1,000 soms. With the help of cattle breeding, she earns 1,500 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan to buy more cattle. In the future, she is planning to help her sons establish themselves in life.

Narynbek I. is twenty-two and single. He lives with his mother who is a farmer. He breeds cattle. Two years ago, he started with a purchase of cattle for 1,000 soms. Monthly, he now earns 1,500 soms from cattle breeding. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle to raise. In the future, with the help of profits from cattle breeding, he plans to marry. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Leidy Soledad

texts.es:
Leidy tiene 20 años, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona cuya economía gira principalmente en torno al cultivo de frutas, las cuales se exportan a diversos países del exterior. Pertene a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la region del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella es una joven emprendedora y que desea valerse de si misma para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a su familia, por ello decidió iniciar un negocio de venta de bebidas en su domicilio, ella cuenta con un stock fijo de cervezas y bebidas gaseosas que ofrece a sus clientes durante todo el dia. Debido al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.

Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza solventando sus gastos personales y ayudando a su familia en el sostenimiento de la economía diaria. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas bebidas de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas. Para lograr esta acción ha creído conveniene solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Leidy es una mujer tranquila y responsable, su mas grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria hasta llegar a convertirse en distribuidora. Las personas que le conocen la consideran una muchacha alegre y activa.
texts.en:
Leidy is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the Tambogrande district, an area whose economy revolves mostly around fruit growing. These are exported to various foreign countries. It belongs to the province of Piura and it is located in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital Lambayeque region. She is an enterprising young woman who wants to make something of herself in order to pay expenses and support her family. That is why she decided to start a business selling beverages from her home. She has a fixed stock of beer and soft drinks that she offers her customers all day. Due to the good service that she offers her customers, her business is very popular. She uses the income that she receives from this activity to pay for her personal expenses and to help her family with its daily budget. At present, she wishes to enlarge her business by buying more beverages so that she can increase her sales. To achive this, she had decided that it is in her interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles. Leidy is a calm and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a business woman until she can become a distributor. The people who know her consider her to be a cheerful and active girl.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and soft drinks to enlarge her business selling from her house.

loans.name: Isolda Elena

texts.es: Isolda Elena tiene 22 años su actividad económica es una miscelánea. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Sus clientes llegan a comprar sus diferentes productos, pues ella además ofrece un  buen servicio pues ella es una mujer muy responsable. Atiende junto a su esposo desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ropa, calzado, perfumes, cremas, bolsos entre otras cosas así que necesita mantener bien surtido su negocio para que este le genere las ganancias suficientes para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Isolda Elena, 22, works in a small general store. She has had this business for more than 12 years. Her customers come to buy various products, as she also provides good service because she is a very responsible woman. She and her husband work together from 7:00 a.m. - 9:00 p.m. each day. The loan will be used to buy products such as clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, bags, and other things to keep the business well-stocked and thus generate enough money to support her family.

loans.use: to by clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, bags, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan U. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Susan is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 3 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is from the village of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Ruth is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising goats for sale. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goats to raise. This will be the third loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional goats to sell

loans.name: Kayi Mawuto

texts.fr: Kayi  a 44 ans.  Elle est revendeuse de produits  d’alimentations générales. Elle est née à Aného  et habite quartier Ahligo où elle a le siège de son Ets principal.  Elle s’approvisionne habituellement  au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle sollicite un prêt  au près de WAGES pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huiles et 10 cartons de vins pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Kayi is 44 years old. She sells general food products. She is born in Aného and lives in the Ahligo district, where her main business is also located. She usually stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bags of rice, 10 jugs of oil and ten boxes of wine in order to be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and running water, and her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a movie shop and her major customers are local residents. She also operates a tailoring shop which contributes as another source of income. Pauline's business is seasonal, which is a major challenge. She hopes to expand in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of movie tapes and DVDs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of movie tapes and DVDs.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie A. is from the village of Mitugas,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector offering transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a transport business. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es:
La señora María Delia A. Álvarez, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, vive en  unión libre con el señor Isidro Velázquez Velázquez, en  donde procrearon una hija de nombre María de los Ángeles de cuatro años de edad y es su motivo de salir adelante.
     
         Ella ha estado trabajando en la venta de pollos aliñado y en pie en donde lleva dos años y cuatro  meses practicando esta actividad, y comenta que le ha ido bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar.

         Se animo a realizar esta actividad ya que una de su vecina la animo y solicito el préstamo para apoyarse comprando  los pollos por reja para que su clientela le compre agusto su mercancía que consumen varia veces a la semana.

       De la  ganancia que obtiene lo invierte en lo mismo  pues le da poco cuando menos para cubrir sus gasto pequeños que se generan en su familia, pero aun así sigue trabajando y ver un mejor resultado.

       El sueño más grande que quiere realizar es que pueda guardar un dinero y así construir una casa de donde vivan cómodamente con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
María Delia A. Álvarez lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas in Mexico.  She is in a common-law marriage with Isidro Velázquez Velázquez.  They have one daughter, four year old María de los Ángeles.  Her daughter is her motivation to get ahead.

She has been working selling dressed chickens and chickens by the piece.  She has been doing this business activity for two years and four months.  She says that it has gone well for her because it has given her good income for her household.

She started this business activity because her neighbor encouraged her.  She is requesting the loan to help her buy chickens by the crate so that her customers can easily buy her merchandise, which they eat several times a week.  

She puts the earnings that she gets back into the business.  That gives her little when the small amount of expenses the family generates is subtracted.  However, she continues working and seeing a better result.

Her biggest dream is that she is able to save money to build a house where her little family can live comfortably.

loans.use: To buy chickens by the crate in order to sell them

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man from Nabatiehj.  He has been the owner of a shoes and clothes retail shop since 2005, with 11 years of experience in this field. Mohamad is well known in his region because of his ambitions and hard work.  He has a good reputation and most of his clients say that one day he will be a successful businessman.

Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new collections of clothes for the coming season.  He hopes to grow his business to wholesale, then expand aggressively in the clothing industry. He is would like to have a small family when his financial and social situation improves more.

loans.use: To buy new season clothes collection

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a farmer from the town of Litein in in the Rift Valley in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and currently employs two farmhands. His farm produces milk and tea, which are all sold locally.   Joel is 53 years old and married.  He has 5 school-aged children who all attend school.  He depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

Joel has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay the school fees for his children and expand his business. 

His major business challenges have been the lack of adequate animal feed and the unreliable artificial insemination services. He would like to increase the number of his dairy cows to fifteen and build a zero grazing unit in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a widow from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has 6 children to support. Rosemarie does her best to provide for her family's needs.

Rosemarie is engaged in farming. She primarily plants and harvests rice crops. She starts work early in the morning to ensure her rice crops are growing healthily. She keeps her farm free of weeds and pests. Rosemarie sells her harvest to rice traders.

Rosemarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and brothers. He is from Lebanon. He started to work in the mechanics field at a very young age. This talented young man opened his own car repair shop and started to offer his clients good-quality services. This resulted in his getting a large number of customers among those passing by his garage.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. mechanic's tools in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. He is very positive about his future plans. His income is needed to help support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional mechanic's tools

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong T. T.  is 39 years old with two children who are in high school. She has a shop in a local market that sells aquatic products such as fish, snails, and crabs. Her business has been running for 3 years, ever since she first received loans in 2007. It  creates considerabL. income for her to use to support her family. 

Regarding to her participatory attitude to our credit program, she has a good repayment record and has invested effectively in expanding her business.  In this new loan cycL., she wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

Mien T. N. is 46 years old with two children. Her earning activities are growing rice and raising pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy feed for  the pigs.

Nu T. L. is 47 years old with two children. She is running a small restaurant in her village. She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy more tables and desks.

 Bich  N.  T. N. is  42 years old with three children . She grows rice, corn, and tomatoes in  paddies of 4,700 square meters. She wants to  have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy   fertilizer.

 Tuan T. N. is 45 years old with three children . She has run a grocery shop for 4 years. She wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

 Hao T. N. is 48 years. She lives with  her family in Laida village.  Running a fashion shop  for five years, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy  more  new styles of trousers and shirts.

loans.use: to buy more products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Hilton

texts.en:
Hilton T. T. is a 23-year-old single man from the Vikwatani area. He owns a retail shop and has been in this business for the last two years getting good profits.  

This marks Hilton’s first loan from KADET after he recently joined another group. He plans to use the loan  to purchase sugar, tea leaves and soft drinks to resell. He anticipates reinvesting his profits into the repayment of the loan and expansion of the business.

His dream is to own a bigger shop and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and the father of three children who are still attending school. He has been working as a mechanic for 18 years, and in 2000 he established his own car repair shop. He fixes specific types of vehicles.  He used to work in the Lebanese army, but because of health problems he had to retire. This man represents the only income source of the family. 

He has taken out three Kiva loans and has been a trusty client, repaying on time. Today he is requesting to borrow $ 2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanicA. materials and supplies in order to develop his workshop and attract more customers. He hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth and increased income.

loans.use: to buy new mechanical materials and supplies.

loans.name: Kalnisa

texts.en:
Kalnisa N. is 53 years old, widowed, and has four children.  She works as a nurse at the local hospital and is known as an open hearted and responsible person.  In order to find the means to cover all the household expenses of her family, she started her business in cattle breeding and land cultivating.  With the start-up capital of 5,000 KGS, she managed to develop a farm with three milk cows and three calves.  Also she was able to buy one milk cow through selling her harvest of raspberries, apples and pears.  

Now, Kalnisa plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase cattle as well as fertilizers to manure her land. With the revenues, she plans further broadening of her business activities.  


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fidelite Group

texts.fr: FIDELITE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier à Habitat à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin). La représentante du groupe, Akossiwa (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 17 Mai 1966 à Lomé au Togo. Akossiwa est mariée à un revendeur du  nom de Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Il y a près de seize ans que Akossiwa vit au quartier Habitat avec sa famille. Akossiwa a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Akossiwa mène comme activité la vente de sacs et de chaussures, par le système de distribution. C’est à Lomé au Togo que Akossiwa s’approvisionne. Akossiwa exerce cette activité depuis six ans. C’est la première fois que Akossiwa et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: Fidelite (Faithfulness) is a group composed of three persons, whose members live together in the same Habitat neighborhood of Cotonou (Benin's economic capital). The group's leader, Akossiwa (whose hand is raised on the photo) is born on May 17th, 1966, in Lome, Togo. Akossiwa is married to a reseller named Joseph. The couple has three children, who all go to school and depend on them. Akowissa has been living with her family in the Habitat neighborhood for about 16 years. Akossiwa did not go to school much. To provide for her children's needs, Akossiwa is active in the sale of bags and shoes through the distribution system. She procures her products in Lome, Togo. Akossiwa has worked in this profession for six years. This is the first time that Akossiwa and her group are requesting the financial support of ALIDe in order to strengthen their activity and to better answer the demands from their customers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and bags.

loans.name: Ambrosia Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos (2 independientes). La señora  estudio educación superior. 
Nicolasa, así le gusta que la llamen, se dedicaba a la venta de frutas, actualmente se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza de la marca Unique, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años.  El primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, comprará colonias, joyas y zapatos.  La señora trabaja sola, su esposo es empleada publico. 
Piensa abrir una pollería junto con su hermana, lo está planificando desde algún tiempo.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión entre las socias y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a member of the “Uniòn Arco Deustua” communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She is 55 years old, married and has four children (2 independent).  She studied higher education.

Nicolasa, that’s how she likes to be called, used to sell fruit.  Currently she sells clothes and Unique brand beauty products.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last five years.  She invested her first, 300 new sol, loan in her business.  She will use this new, 700 new sol, loan to buy cologne, jewelry and shoes.  She works alone; her husband is a public employee.  She plans to open a chicken shop with her sister; she’s been planning this for quite some time.

What she likes about the communal bank is the unity among the members and the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy cologne, jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and has been farming for the last ten years. Irene sells her produce locally.

Irene is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into the poultry business as well as construct a dairy. She notes that Juhudi loans have been of great help to farmers but laments the high costs of animal disease.

In the future, Irene hopes to use her income from her two new businesses to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and construct a dairy

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours. In addition, she also sells clothes from door to door, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers. Aida dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 48 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more feed for her pigs.

Josie has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns an additional income from her fruit vending business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
Angélica es una joven emprendedora que debido a la falta de oportunidades para continuar con sus estudios universitarios aprendió al lado de una amiga de su madre el oficio de la peluquería canina, el cual convirtió en su propio negocio. Desde su casa Angélica ofrece sus servicios a sus vecinos, amigos y conocidos. 

Tener un local propio en el que pueda tener su peluquería canina es el sueño de Angélica quien para caminar hacia su meta, necesita por ahora de un préstamo para comprar medicamentos para mascotas, así como utensilios para su peluquería.
texts.en:
Angélica is a young entrepreneur who, due to a lack of opportunities to continue her university studies, learned pet grooming from a friend of her mother. She has turned this into her own business. Angélica works from home, offering her grooming services to neighbors, friends, and the people she knows.
She dreams of having her own store where she can groom dogs. As a step towards reaching this goal, right now she needs a loan to buy pet medication and also grooming tools.

loans.use: To buy pet medication and grooming tools

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34-year-old young man, who is married and has two sons and three daughters. Rami works as a taxi driver and owns the taxi he drives. He earns a decent income which is the only source of income for the family and so he doesn't have enough cash money to pay for the taxi repairs, insurance and licensing. He needs to take a loan from FATEN to help in paying these expenses.

As soon as Rami gets FATEN's loan and can cover the taxi expenses he will resume driving passengers, feeling safe and working for longer hours to generate a better income and let his family live in better conditions.

Rami is photographed beside the taxi he owns.


About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. 

The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for repairing, licensing and insuring his taxi.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, de 21 años, es una luchadora madre soltera. Ella vive con su hija, en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como mujer y madre, joven, ella tiene muchas ambiciones. Hace 2 años su padre le heredó un terreno agrícola, con el que comenzó a sembrar café, ahora ella tiene unos cafetales jóvenes, que le proporcionan buenos granos. Aprovechando esa ventaja, manda a procesar el grano, vendiendo el café natural en grandes cantidades, a las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de La Merced, donde tiene clientes fijos. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder ser independiente y tener oportunidad de crecer, pues a pesar de sus limitaciones y responsabilidades, ella no se amilana, por el contrario; tiene deseos de estudiar, y poder tener una empresa exportadora de café. Sabe que el camino es largo, pero está dispuesta a pasarlo y salir exitosa para brindarle a su hija un futuro diferente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la unión palomar”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde encontró el apoyo que tanto necesitaba. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Milka de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para continuar con el mejoramiento de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Milka, 21, is a struggling single mother. She lives with her daughter in her parents' home, located in the community of Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). As a young woman and mother, she has many ambitions.  Two years ago she inherited her father's agricultural land, with which she began to grow coffee.  She now has several young coffee plantations, which provide good kernels. Leveraging this advantage, she is processing the grain and selling natural coffee in large quantities to the various shops in the city of La Merced, where she has regular customers. 

What Milka likes most is to be independent and have a chance to grow.  In spite of her limitations and responsibilities, she is undaunted, however, she has a desire to study and to have a coffee exporting company. She knows that the road is long, but she is ready to pass through successfully and give her daughter a different future. Milka belongs to the communal bank "Prestatarios de la unión palomar," and this is her second loan with MFP, where she found the support she needed.  This is the reason why she promises to be punctual in her payments. Upon receiving your support, Milka will invest the requested loan to buy bags of natural fertilizers to continue improving her coffee plantations.

loans.use: to buy several bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Félix se dedica a brindar el servicio de soldadura y pintura. Hace más de 9 años que tiene esta actividad el posee un negocio en donde brinda el servicio de pinturas y soldaduras, pues también brinda el servicio a domicilio, tiene ciertos clientes que le realizan diferentes pedidos y Félix se encarga de realizar muy buenos servicios. El crédito es para la compra de herramienta, pinturas, spray, guantes, lentes entre otros.
texts.en: Félix provides welding and painting services.  He’s been in this line of work for over 9 years.  He has a business where he provides welding and painting services but he also does work in customers’ homes.  He has certain customers that place various orders with him and Félix makes sure to do very good jobs.  The loan is to purchase tools, paint, spray paint, gloves and goggles, among others.

loans.use: to buy tools, paint, spray paint, gloves and goggles, amont others.

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
La señora Nisida nació en la ciudad de Grau - Progreso del departamento de Apurímac, Actualmenrte, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco. (En la fotografía la señora Nisida está levantando la mano). 

La señora Nisida tiene una relación de libre unión de la cual está esperando un bebe y tiene 8 meses de embarazo, ella es joven  trabajadora y responsable que va sacar adelante a su familia, ella por el momento no está trabajando pues está esperando a su bebe, pero ella antes trabajaba en una tienda de venta de golosinas. Su esposo Darwin la apoya a la cañasta familiar trabajando como albañil. 

La señora Nisida pertenece al banco comunal “Qochasaywas” y en esta oportunidad Nisida requiere el préstamo para abrir una granja de crianza de pollos y cuyes.  

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Qochasaywas” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de animales menores como cuyes, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de golosinas y venta de artesanía. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (Los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegarón tarde a la reunión.)
texts.en:
Nisida was born in the city of Grau - Progreso, in the department of Apurímac. At present, she lives in the city of Cuzco (in the photograph, Nisida is raising her hand).

Nisida is in a common law marriage and is expecting a baby. She is eight months pregnant. She is young, hardworking and responsible and is going to get her family ahead. At the moment, she is not working because she is expecting, but before she worked in a store selling candies. Her husband Darwin supports the family working as a bricklayer. 

Nisida belongs to the “Qochasaywas” communal bank and at this time she requires the loan to start a farm to raise chickens and guinea pigs. 

The members of the “Qochasaywas” communal bank meet every month in the city of Cuzco. The bank is made up of hardworking, enterprising people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead with their daily hard work and give their children a better future. Most of the members live in Cuzco and the economic activities of the other members are, for example, selling small animals such as guinea pigs, food, cosmetics, candies and artisanal crafts.    

Cuzco is known for tourism, trade, and its traditional Inti Raymi festival. In addition, it has one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu (the members who are in the bottom of the picture came late to the meeting).

loans.use: to start a farm to raise chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sreyveoun

texts.en:
Sreyveoun, 25, resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sreyveoun is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of $4 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. 
Each month, the family has to spend $30 USD on food and $30 USD on other necessary expenses. Sreyveoun is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work at the garment factory. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.ru:
Siyavush yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Araz Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Yemu 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. 
Siyavush seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta. On uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov dlya proizvodstva molochnix produktov. On prodayot molchniye produkti v magazini. Tak kak yego produkciya xoroshaya v nem imeyetsya mnogo zaprosov sredi pokupateley.
texts.en: Siyavush is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Araz Dilagarda village of the Fuzuli region together with his family.He is 32 years old, married and has one child.  Siyavush currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase the amount of produced milk products.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years and breeds cattle for production of milk products.  He sells milk products to stores.  Siyavush has many orders among customers because he has quality products.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa D. 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Rosa desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción D. leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores D. la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado D. TambogranD., con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y realizar arreglos en su corral, para que se incremente la producción D. la leche D. vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  Rosa es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio salga adelante para que su hijo tengan otras oportunidades D. estudio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old and lives with her children in her own home where they only have electricity (no running water).  Their home is located in the TambogranD. district, which is part of Piura department.  This area is characterized by its farming, livestock, and handicrafts activities.

For the last three years, Rosa has been working raising and selling sheep (she has 10 head of sheep), pigs (8 pigs) and farmyard poultry.  Her corrals are outsiD. her home, and are appropriate for her needs.  She feeds her animals with a balanced animal feed, grass, and natural grains so that her animals will reach an optimum size for her to offer for sale in the different markets in the area, and she can generate good earnings to cover her daily household expenses.

She has requested a loan of 1,500 New Soles form Edpyme Alternativa for purchasing more balanced animal feed for her animals and also to make improvements to her corrals.  With the income that she will earn, she will be able to cover her loan repayments and improve her family's quality of life.  

Rosa is a hard-working woman who is very responsible.  The only thing she wants is for her children to succeed in life and to have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more balanced animal feed and to make several repairs to her animals' corrals.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 21-year-old young lady who used to buy and re-sell birds with her brother FaisA. when they needed money as kids.  A few years ago, after having a good experience in the trading system and learning about birds and how to breed them, both of them officially started a bird sale business on their house roof.

And through the years, they were able to buy some rare birds and sell them for a very good price. Now Alia wants to add new types of birds and pigeons to what they sell so they can make more money in order to build a new birds' house, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

Because Alia is a conservative person, her brother FaisA. has agreed to appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more birds and build a new birds' house

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last nine months.  She is 34 years old, married to James and they have three school going children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of its field officers and this will be her first loan.  Anne plans to use the loan to buy more clothes for sell.

In future, Anne hopes to expand her business to import and export cloths and become one the leading clothes dealers in Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 41-year-old woman. She has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business selling second-hand clothing for 10 years. 

Hue would like to take loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aaed

texts.en: Aaed is 20 years old, a single man, from Gaza.  He would now like to open his own business.  So he thought of opening a store for renting chairs and tents for special occasions.  He hopes that with this loan he will be able to buy all the chairs and tents needed in order to start his business.

loans.use: to buy tents and chairs.

loans.name: Akur

texts.en:
Akur is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. Four of them are in the school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akur requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: María Agusta

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 36 años, es casada y su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Ella es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos por catalogo, trabaja sin horario fijo de lunes a sábados. También labora como secretaria hace 14 años.
 
Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Morlaquitas communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca. Since 1999, this city has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a place of great beauty and natural and cultural riches. Its people are kind and cordial, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

María is 36 years old. She is married, and her husband is an automotive mechanic by trade. She does not have her own house, since she rents.

She sells clothing and cosmetics from a catalogue. She works without a fixed schedule from Monday to Saturday. She has also been a secretary for 14 years.

This is her fourth loan with the communal bank, and she will use it to buy cosmetics and clothing.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his only parent and three working siblings. They are all cooperating together in order to satisfy the family needs. Despite his young age, he was capable to start his own work as a farmer in 2007, and has already seven years of experience in this domain. 

Today, he’s in need of $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies. This loan will improve his productivity, and therefore his revenues and his way of living. In the future, he plans to open his own fruits and vegetables shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 30-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three working siblings in addition to seven relatives. Her siblings are working really hard to cover their heavy costs especially because they are a big family. As for her, she has been working as a tailor for the past fifteen years to help her relative with his education. For this reason, she has the intention today to take a youth loan of $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay the education fees of her relative until he graduates. In the future, she plans to develop her work and provide more support for her siblings.

loans.use: to pay the education fees for her relative.

loans.name: Luz Marivi

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su mamá y hermanas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia Luz se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Minas, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trabaja como secretaria en una empresa minera de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y buen desempeño.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tratamiento médico que se realizará su madre, ya que lastimosamente padece una penosa enfermedad; de esta manera Luz espera poder mejorar la salud de su madre y aliviar sus dolencias, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz, 20, lives in the city of Nazca with her mother and sisters who she loves and are her main reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong wish for self-improvement.   Thanks to her effort and family support, Luz is studying Mining Engineering.  She likes to relax watching television in her free time and sometimes cooks a delicious “Tallarines Verdes” to share with her family.

With much effort and dedication, Luz works as a secretary in a mining firm in her city.  She starts work every day very early in the morning and works about 8 hours; she believes she does well because of her responsibility and the good ways he does her work.

Luz is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to cover her mother’s medical treatment because sadly she suffers from a grievous illness.  In this way, Luz will be able to improve her mother’s health and ease her pain and she will continue working and striving towards reaching her great dream of being a good professional and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Saharatou

texts.en:
Ms Saharatou Y. was born in Sokodé in 1978. She currently lives in Tsévié and runs a teddy-bear business. Married with one child, she has to meet nearly 80% of all household expenses, since her husband has been unemployed for more than two years. With only a fourth-grade education, she is doing the best she can, with help and advice from the authorities. Ms Y. is a trustworthy woman who has successfully handled and repaid two previous loans.
