She is now facing a need for expansion, which will require more working capital. She is therefore looking for a loan of $750 in order to purchase teddy-bear supplies. If her efforts are successful, the additional income will enable her to do more for her child and her entire family, of which she is now the main support.

Mlle Y. Saharatou est née en 1978 à Sokodé. Elle réside actuellement à Tsévié où elle fait le commerce des nounours. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, presque 80% des charges du foyer lui reviennent car son mari est en chômage depuis plus de deux ans. Avec son niveau de la classe de 4ème du secondaire, elle essaie de gérer au mieux ses affaires grâce aux appuis conseils des agents. Mlle Y. Saharatou est une femme de confiance qui a su bien gérer et rembourser ses deux crédits obtenus. Elle fait face aujourd’hui à un problème de croissance qui nécessite un renforcement de ses fonds roulement. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $750 pour acheter des balles de nounours. La parfaite réalisation de ses activités renforcera ses revenus lui permettant de mieux s’occuper de son enfant et des besoins de toute la famille qui reposent aujourd’hui sur elle.

loans.use: to buy teddy-bear supplies

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mr. G. has a great deal of experience in this line of work, as he has done it for over 30 years. His intention is to buy modern, high-tech equipment.

"I have been trying for a while to get up-to-date with the most modern equipment, but I have not succeeded. Sometimes I have to tell my customers that I don't have the necessary equipment to be able to fix their vehicle, which makes a bad impression and they won't recommend me. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to buy the equipment that I need."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor G. tiene una amplia experiencia en este oficio mas de 30 años lo respaldan su intencion es comprar equipo moderno y con alta tecnología. "Llevo tiempo tratando de ponerme al dia con los equipos mas modernos pero no lo he logrado, hay ocasiones que tengo que decirles a mis clientes que no cuento con el equipo indispensable para poder arreglar su vehiculo y eso me produce una perdida sobre todo porque se mal interpreta y ya no me recomiendan. Solicito $1,200.00 dlls para comprar el equipo que necesito.

loans.use: To buy high-tech equipment. / Comprar equipo con alta tecnología.

loans.name: Rashid Munyekenye

texts.en: Rashid is married with seven children, some in college and others in university.  He has not undertaken any formal training.  He is a dedicated Muslim leader at the local mosque. He owns three estates and the fourth one is under construction.  He manages his business on a personal basis. Through his business, he has been able to educate his children and improve his living standards. He has also brought services to the community. With a loan from PEMCI, he plans to pay for his university children’s tuition fees and also complete his fourth building.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es:
I have a small business selling tortillas out of my home. I've been doing this for about 1 1/2 years. I'm able to help my husband pay for the family monthly expenses. I currently need to buy more cornflour, salt, firewood and I want to make improvements to my kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas en mi casa. Este negocio lo tengo hace un año imedio, con el cual ayudo mucho a mi esposo para los gastos familiares mensuales.Ahora necesito comprar mas maiz, sal, leña y mejorar mi cocina.

loans.use: Cornflour, salt, firewood and coal

loans.name: Alasa

texts.en: Alasa, 37 years old, of Manunu, (pictured above) has a sewing business. She sews for her family and also gets sewing jobs from a number of families in her village. At times, she gets sewing jobs from neighbouring villages and from these sewing jobs, she now has her own income. She is seen here happily applying her skills and doing what she does best to earn a living. According to Alasa, the help of SPBD has really made a difference for her and her family as not only does she have an income, she is now able to save a lot of money from not having to buy ready made clothes for her family, and also from having to pay someone to sew her children’s school uniforms. She is very happy with her small business and she will continue to use the assistance from SPBD in the future.

loans.use: For sewing machine, school fees, and home improvement

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia and Percy is a young enterprising couple willing to accomplish many things. Since the beginning of their marriage they decided to make a living making ceramic and clay figurines and pottery. Each object they create is of the highest quality, beautifully finished, and original; that is why their articles are in high demand in many places in Peru. This activity is very rewarding for Patricia and Percy, and has allowed them to support themselves and give their little daughter the best within their reach. She has been the guiding light for them.

The couple wishes to make their business grow, and maybe one day export their products to other places in the world. To keep going with their projects Patricia and Percy need a loan to get more materials. Your help can make possible that this hard-working and enthusiastic couple see their goals accomplished.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia y Percy forman una joven pareja emprendedora que atesora dentro de su corazón muchas ganas de superación; desde que formaron su hogar decidieron dedicarse a la fabricación de objetos cerámicos (floreros, figuras ornamentales, etc.); cada una de las obras que realizan son de excelentes acabados y alta calidad, creativos, novedosos y muy cotizados en los mercados de las diferentes ciudades de su país, esta actividad los llena de satisfacción y les permite sostener con eficacia las demandas de su hogar y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña niña quién desde que los acompaña se ha convertido en la luz de sus sueños. Ambos están deseosos de seguir expandiendo su negocio hasta llegar a exportarlos a diferentes ciudades del planeta y para lograr cada uno de sus objetivos requieren obtener un préstamo de dinero que les será muy beneficioso y útil para el crecimiento de su negocio.“En vuestras manos está la posibilidad de que esta joven pareja cumpla cada uno de sus sueños con el importante ingrediente de su diligencia y entusiasmo”

loans.use: To buy raw materials and step-up production.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
In spite of living in very difficult times, we can find very enterprising women who, in spite of evil, offer a smile to progress and proceed ahead. Such a one is Adela, who, with her daughter in her arms, leaves daily to work and care for her orange grove. There she makes her living with great care and happiness since she was married. She has great hopes to improve her home and to give her small daughter the best and not leave her in hardship and deprivation. She is motivated to spend her time forging a prominent future for her little girl.

Without a doubt, at some time or other everyone needs a hand. Today she turns to us to request a loan with which she can increase the production of her orange grove in the next year. We can make it possible for this diligent mother to achieve all that she has dreamed of.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Aún a pesar de vivir en tiempos muy difíciles, podemos encontrar mujeres muy emprendedoras, que a pesar del mal tiempo pueden brindarle una sonrisa al progreso y salir adelante, como lo hace Adela, quien con su hija en brazos sale a diario a trabajar y cuidar su terreno de naranjales al cual se dedica con gran esmero y alegría desde que contrajo matrimonio.Ella tiene grandes anhelos de ambientar su hogar y ofrecer a su pequeña hija lo mejor y no dejarla pasar privaciones y carencias, motivo por el cual dedica su tiempo en forjar un futuro prominente para su pequeña.

Sin duda toda persona requiere en algunos momentos de otra que le tienda la mano y hoy recurre a vosotros para solicitar un préstamo con los que podrá aumentar su producción de naranjales para el próximo año.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta diligente madre cumpla todo lo que se ha planteado.

loans.use: To increase the production of oranges

loans.name: Ocheng B (Iii) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Annet is a single mother of three children. She has a poultry farm. With the extra business profits, she intends to construct rental houses so that she can have a monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
T. Baroat is 47 years old, and she has raised two children, both of whom are students now.

Baroat sells women's clothing and handbags. She has been in this business for 23 years. Her trading place is located in the center of the local market, and so she has lots of clients. She tries to have a wide range of goods available to keep her clientele satisfied. The clothing and handbags she buys in the city of Bishkek, located in the neighboring country, Kyrgyzstan. Baroat is the main bread-winner in the family and is working hard in order to generate sufficient income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

Baroat has proved herself to be a reliable client over for the years of cooperation with IMON. Today she is requesting 900.00 US Dollars for the term of 8 months. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing women's clothing and handbags in order to enlarge the range of goods for sale. Baroat thanks everyonel for their support.

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Petalo De Rosa, Group 1

texts.en:
Francisco (pictured far right) is a lovely 53-year-old man who lives with his wife and five children in the suburb of Los Alcarrizzos, which is on the outskirts of the capital, Santo Domingo. He is the director of a local high school that he founded, and has requested this loan so that he can add more books and supplies to his school thereby creating a better learning environment for his students. With a better reputation, he knows that he can attract more students, and consequently increase his profit margin.

His dream is to continue “developing and amplifying the school in all senses,” to enable his children to become professionals in the future, and to improve his quality of life. In his free time he loves to take pictures.

On behalf of Francisco and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of Francisco’s high school!

loans.use: Purchase school supplies and books

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and is a married woman. Elizabeth is a food seller and she started her business in 2007. Everyday she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $15 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en: Johannes is a 44 year old resident of Dar Es Salaam. He runs a pig husbandry from his home. His business is one of the most challenging but pays well, considering the fact that half the population of Dar Es Salaam is Muslim. Johannes wants to transform his small farm into a bigger one to accommodate other animals, like goats and chicken. He is in need of a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his pig husbandry business

loans.name: Ugiljon

texts.en: Ugiljon T. lives in  Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with three children.  Her husband works in Russia, and so Ugiljon works alone in the family business of livestock trading.  With five years of experience in this field, she is able to support her family and also manage their collective farm.  Ugiljon is now applying for a loan of $625 for six months to purchase a milk cow and thereby begin to take part in the milk production business.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Mevla

texts.en:
Mevla is a 42-year-old woman living in Binjezevu, right outside Sarajevo. She is divorced and living with her only child. Mevla has worked selling clothes, which gave her a monthly income of about 300BAM ($240 USD). However she recently started to grow mushrooms in her basement, and has found she is able to earn more in this line of work.

This 600 BAM loan is her first loan from Zene za Zene. She will use this to buy fungicide and pesticide treatments for her mushrooms to prevent any crop losses for the season. Mevla is excited to focus more on her mushroom business and hopes this will be a good move for her. With her one child in school, she will need to earn more money to pay for schooling and supplies, and she believes this will be the best way to ensure her income growth.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to protect her mushrooms

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
The R. family has already had a previous housing loan from FVP, Kiva's partner organization in Nuevo Laredo, which they paid back punctually. Their plan now is to finish the roof of their house and begin construction of the second floor to create more space for the family of two adults and three children

Mr. R. is requesting a Kiva loan of $1,000 in order to complete this work.

Mr. R. works in a maquiladora (a factory located in a special border free trade zone) that manufactures heating equipment, and his wife, Belia, takes care of their children.

loans.use: Construct part of roof and second floor of family home

loans.name: Salama's Twende Na Wakati Group

texts.en:
Salama is 28 years old. She is divorced with 1 child aged 8 years old. She has been a firewood and shoe seller since 2006. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood and shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Bisiti and Afia.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti P., 33, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Koreti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business and her husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a wife of M. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 4 years. She has no children. Sugran baji’s husband is a tailor who has been sewing clothes for the past 10 years. Sugran baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy chickens in order to sell chicken meat. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Mamlakatjon

texts.en:
R. Mamlakatjon is 51 years old and lives in the town of Isfara. She is married and has an adult son. Mamlakatjon is processing and selling dried apricots at the central local market. She is experienced in the business of making the dried apricot. 

Ms. Mamlakatjon is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and educate her only son, who is a hard-working adult - thanks to her good example. Because she buys apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. 

She offers a wide assortment of dried apricots for clients. All this allows Mamlakatjon to make her business quite successful and it brings a consistently stable income for her family. Today, Mamlakatjon requests 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of eight months. She is going to spend the loan to purchase dried apricots and to process them and to sell. Mamlakatjon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots in order to increase her food sales business inventory

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hiền 30 tuổi, chị tham  gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, sau khi tham gia Quỹ được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển cho thu nhập ổn định  giúp cho cuộc sống gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện hơn
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người đân đại phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi H. is 30 years old. She has joined TYM Fund since 2002. Before joining the fund, her family's income depended mainly on livestock raising and farming. After joining TYM, her family has borrowed loans to invest in a grocery store. Her business is expanding and giving her family a more stable and improved living standard. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in more supplies for her store to meet the needs of her local customers for the incoming New Year celebration.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Hedayatullah

texts.en:
Hedayatullah is married. He lives with his own family. He is working in agriculture. He has been involved in this business for a long time. He got his first-cycle loan and used it for his business and until now he is furthering his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business. He wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 40,000 Afghanis with a term of 25 months to enlarge his business and complete his stock and buy some seeds for his land. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future. He is happy. Hedayatullah plans to open a retail food shop in Jalalabad city in the next 5 years. He tries his best to open a shop with his income. He wants to say that without this loan it would be impossible to get his business to be its best and he hopes that he is going to be the best in the future.

loans.use: buying seeds and necessary things for his land

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He was born in 1970 and is married with two children. He has been in the produce-selling business for six years, and he is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables improve his stock. In the future, Vugar plans to build a shop from which to sell his produce.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian, vive en la calle Sargento Carrasco de la zona Ballivian, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El es un joven emprendedor ya que con el primer crédito que le concedimos en Abril del año pasado adquirió una computadora y ahora el nuevo crédito que solicita será utilizado en la ampliación de su oficina, donde se dedica a la intermediación de puestos de trabajo, entre personas que buscan un empleo y personas que requieren empleados de distinto rubro, generalmente mano de obra.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una computadora y así mejorar la enseñanza en sus alumnos.
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristian lives on Sargento Carrasco street in the neighbourhood of Ballivian, in the city of El Alto. He is a young entrepreneur who used his first loan, which we granted him in April of last year, to buy a computer. He will use this new loan to expand his business, an employment agency where he is the intermediary between people looking for work and people needing employees in different areas, usually labourers. He will use the loan to buy a computer and in this way improve his students' education. This is his second loan with Impro; our evaluation determined that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer for his employment agency

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes y también es un pequeño bar, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Norma son tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is an associate of the New Era Communal Bank. Norma lives in a shared home. She is 29 years old and has 3 children. Norma has a store in a rented location where she sells groceries and also tends a small bar; an activity that she carries out every day. Norm needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of beer, rice and sugar. Norma's dreams are to have her own home and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, rice and sugar for her grocery store.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is a 28 year old trader. She is single with three children. She is still searching for her better half. She lives at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana. She sells used clothes in the local market of Twifo. With income from her business, Adwoa is supporting all her kids in school.

Selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has been in this business for the past two years. She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business.

She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids' education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced and lives with her son. She sells food at the market in the city of Stryi and has been in this business for nine years. Good prices and location help her to win her clients.

There are many various celebrations in the spring in Ukraine and people spend more money on food. Lubov needs to increase her inventory and to do this she would like to get a loan of 6,500 UAH.

Additional income would help Lubov to pay her winter utility bills. Lubov's goal in life is to help her son to start off in life.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of food

loans.name: Suraj

texts.en:
Suraj A. is 28 years old and married with two adorable daughters. From the time he was young, Suraj has been learning to work in a small business breeding cattle. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the it grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progress more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business in order to offer a better future for his children and see them as professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $1500. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Suraj’s business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely S. is from the village of Biasong. She is 63 years old, married, and has six adult children. Fely owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Fely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty O. started her fish selling business a year ago at Adawso a Suburb of Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She also sells food stuffs like spices, onions, pepper etc. by hawking. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and has a large customer base. She will hawk everywhere as long as she finds customers.

She is 30 years old, widowed and the mother of two children. Her husband died some years ago but says she is strong and moving on with life. Currently, her children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more fish and food stuffs to increase sales and income to support her children's education and fuel business growth. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Yehowa neme whefo’ which means God is my keeper.

loans.use: Buy more smoked and dried fish, pepper, onions, spices etc.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos en su casa propia, donde está instalada su tienda de comestibles. Desde hace más de 6 años vende diferentes productos alimenticios para saciar la demanda de su vecindario, la cual es bastante, ya que es la tienda más cercana en toda su cuadra. Usualmente Liz trabaja sola, pero las veces que tiene que salir a comprar más mercadería la apoyan sus hijos en la atención. Su trabajo le gusta mucho, ya que puede realizarlo en su propia casa y se siente cómoda vendiendo desde ahí, lamentablemente a veces le resulta cansado ya que tiene que abrir desde las 6 de la mañana y quedarse hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, siendo una larga la jornada. Sin embargo, gracias a sus vecinas y vecinos que siempre visitan su tienda, puede conversar y muy amablemente realizar su trabajo. Liz espera seguir expandiendo su negocio y comprando cada vez más mercadería. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 16 préstamos y todos le han servido para progresar poco a poco, además el trabajo en su banco comunal siempre ha sido muy bueno, sintiéndose satisfecha de ser parte de su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Liz is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the home they own, where they have a small convenience store. For the past 6 years she has sold different products to meet the demand in her neighborhood, which is heavy since her store is the closest one in the area. Liz usually works alone, but when she has to go our to buy more goods her children help out. She likes her work because she can do it from home and she is comfortable selling there. Unfortunately sometimes it is tiring as she has to open at 6 in the morning and stay open until 9 or 10 at night, which makes for a long day. However, thanks to her neighbors who always visit the store, she can chat with them while she works. Liz hopes to expand her business and to keep buying more goods. She has had 16 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA and each loan has helped to to get ahead bit by bit. Also, working with her communal bank has been good and she is pleased to be part of the group. With the money she is now requesting, she will buy a larger quantity of products with which to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en: This group’s leader, Zamira, is 28. She earns her living by milking her cows and selling 15 liters of milk daily. Her husband, apart from helping her look after cows, works as a plumber. She has two children, a little son and a daughter. Six years ago, Zamira and her husband started dealing with real estate. After successfully selling some of their property, they bought a cow and a calf. They took a risk to put in $625, which was quite a large sum of money at that time. Now, they have turned it into a monthly income of $100. By means of saving money, they have obtained some necessary equipment for her husband’s work and a car. Zamira and her husband need a loan to buy another cow. This would enable them breed their cattle and increase its population. "Everything we do, we do for the sake of our children. Our son is growing up. Very soon, he will be going to school. So we need to purchase everything needed for his education, including stationary and (a) school uniform," says Zamira. Taalaibek, Suyorbubu and Kayir are in the same group with Zamira. Taalaibek is 40. He is married and has three children. Taalaibek provides for his family by collecting milk from local villagers and producing milk products. He sells these products in the city of Alma Ata. He needs a loan to purchase sheep and cows and to increase turnover. Kayir is 44. She sells yogurt that she produces from her cow’s milk, or from milk that she buys from other villagers. She urgently needs a new fridge to put the milk products in since the old one cannot contain all of her products. She cannot buy a fridge unless she obtains a loan. Suyorbubu is a housewife. She keeps a cow and sells milk. Some years ago she obtained a loan and bought a car. Since then, by selling milk she has managed to save enough money to buy new furniture for her son. She wants to obtain a loan to purchase calves and feed for them. After fattening them up, she is going to resell them. "Even though raising livestock requires certain amount of efforts, it is not that troublesome. In a rural area like ours, it is the most convenient business," says Suyorbubu with enthusiasm. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the three Ps concept: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit Partner 135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cows, calves, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es: El señor Manuel González  42 años de edad, vive municipio de Villa el Carmen, soltero, vive en casa propia, su casa necesita unos retoques y es de primordial necesidad. Trabaja en la Alcaldía Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses, con dificultades ha podido construir poco a poco su vivienda. Agradece a ala Institución por el préstamo será invertido en la realizarle mejoras a la casa comprando materiales de construcción como: cemento, piso, piedrines y zinc. Para comenzar a realizar a construir, se siente sastifecho por los logros adquirido.

loans.use: Comprar materiales  de construccion para hacer mejoras a su casa

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: three sons and one daughter. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Janet is a food vendor. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi and prepares and sells kenkey which is produced from corn dough. She sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. Janet has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to expand her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith, 30, sells women's clothes of various sizes and colors.  This married mother of three children hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Filo

texts.en:
Filo A. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Leusoalii. She is married and has three school-aged children. For over 17 years, Filo has been growing and selling taro for a living. She earns approximately 550 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Filo joined SPBD to access their financial services with the intention of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filo has successfully repaid a previous SPBD loan in the amount of 1750 WST, which she had used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She is now requesting 2500 WST as her fourth SPBD loan, which she will use to purchase harvesting equipment. Filo plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve or expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 69 years old, widowed and has five adult children. She is from the village of Pwerta, Lurugan, Valencia City. Norma has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 pesos from HSPFI. Norma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen N. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Helen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philipppine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is oe of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for making mats.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Todas estas  mujeres forman parte de un programa de desarrollo social y económico denominado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras impulsado por la Fundación Paraguaya, ofreciendo a las involucradas una gama de capacitaciones por ciclo de vida del comité, y un apoyo financiero para que las mismas cuenten con un capital operativo que netamente invierten en sus respectivos negocios.
Por este hecho el Comité Kuña aty, agradece  a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en personas de status relativamente baja que son discriminados en el mundo de las oportunidades hasta la actualidad.
Solo dos señoras se dedican a actividades  diferentes a las demás que son chiperas, este negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo más aún para las mujeres, ya que el proceso de producción inicia generalmente a las 03:30 entre las 04:00 horas de la madrugada, preparando el horno a leña, más conocido como tatacua en la que posteriormente se introduce la masa de la chipa moldeada, esto implica soportar un alto grado de calor manipulando el proceso de cocción  del producto mencionado  durante varias horas.
Una vez terminada el producto queda la ardua tarea de venderlas en su totalidad para que de esta única forma sea compensada el tan forzoso trabajo de ser chiperas
texts.en:
All these women are a part of a social and economic development program called Committee of Enterprising Women. This program is supported by the Paraguayan Foundation and offers their members a range of training by committee cycle. It also offers them financial support so that they are able to use the operational capital to invest in their respective businesses. Because of this the Kuna Aty Committee thanks the Paraguayan Foundation for the trust they put in people with a relatively humble status who are even now discriminated against in the world of opportunities. Only two women work in different activities. The rest are.”chiperas” breadbakers.. This business requires a lot of strength, more so for women, since the production process generally begins between 3:30 and 4:00 am, by preparing the oven with wood. It is a brick oven (tatacua) in which they later put the shaped bread dough. The bread needs to be baked for several hours at a high temperature while adjusting the heat. Once finished they have the arduous task of selling all of the bread because that is the only way they are compensated for the hard work of being “chiperas” (breadbakers).

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: All the women use their loans to support their commercial activities to that they can get small  profit margins to help pay for food, their children's education, health expenses, and to reinvest in their businesses

loans.name: Cristóbal Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Cristóbal Evaristo M. A. tiene 40 años de edad es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ellos tienen tres hijos de las edades  de 18, 16 y 10 años de edad el mayor trabaja y apoya a la economía del hogar y los otros dos pequeños estudia la secundaria, ellos se dedican a la agricultura al cultivo de la piña, con este préstamo podrán comprar fertilizantes que le brinden  a la siembra un mejor mantenimiento y que la cosecha sea de primera calidad pudiendo aumentar las ganancias  y ofrecerles mejores niveles de vida, esto a largo plazo les significaría el poder realizar cambios significativos en la estructura del hogar pudiendo brindarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones y un lugar más seguro que convidar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristobal Evaristo M. A. is 40 years old and married. His wife works selling fruits and vegetables. They have three children; ages 18, 16, and 10. Their oldest son works and helps support the household, and the two younger children are in secondary school. The family works in agriculture, cultivating pineapple. With this loan, they will be able to purchase fertilizers that will provide better maintenance to their crop, and therefore their harvest will be of the highest quality. In this way, they will be able to increase their earnings, which will offer them a better living standard. In the long run, this would mean being able to realize significant changes in the structure of their home, which would provide their children with better living conditions and a safer place to offer their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural materials to help maintain the harvest

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 18 Novembre 1979 à Sikasso, Monsieur Ousmane Samaké  est marié  et réside avec son épouse à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S.après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce notamment à l’achat vente des matériels d’électricité il y a maintenant sept ans. Il dispose actuellement d’une quincaillerie il y a environ deux ans, auparavant il menait l’activité de façon ambulante avec une clientèle composée généralement d’entrepreneurs et surtout d’électriciens. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt  et le premier a été correctement remboursé. 
 Il compte acheter  avec ce  deuxième prêt, 25 cartons de contacteurs, 30 cartons d’ampoules de différentes sortes, 35 paires de réglettes, 15 paquets de disjoncteurs, des câbles etc. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso, Koumassi et Abidjan (respectivement au Mali, en Burkina Faso, au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire) avant de les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit.
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on 18th November 1979 in Sikasso, Mr. Ousmane S.is married and lives with his wife in Mamassoni, one of the outer neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having run several unsuccessful businesses, Mr. S.began trading, principally in the purchase and sale of electrical materials, seven years ago. He has had a hardware store for two years now; before that he ran his business on a door-to-door basis with a customer base composed generally of entrepreneurs, and above all electricians. He is in much demand from his customers because of the quality of his products. In order to satisfy the ever increasing number of customers, he decided to join the micro-finance company, Soro Yiriwaso, and he is now on his second loan, the first having been repaid without incident. With this second loan he is planning to buy 25 boxes of contactors (or circuit protection devices), 30 boxes of different types of bulbs, 35 pairs of rails, 15 packets of circuit breakers, cables etc. He stocks up in Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso, Koumassi and Abidjan (respectively in Mali, Burkina Faso, Ghana and the Ivory Coast) before retailing them for cash or credit. He intends with this loan to make a monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA, which will be used principally to increase his working capital, to contribute to family expenses and to pay the interest on his loan; he will invest the remainder in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware materials

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is a 25-year-old married woman and mother of one child. Graduating from university with a major in photography, she opened a photography shop in her town in 2008, after seeing a need for such services in the region. She photographs speciA. events like weddings and she's happy with her work. Today, Heba is requesting to borrow US$ 700 in order to purchase an additionA. camera because she's planning to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase an additional camera

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: B. Rachelle est née vers 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, mais vit depuis 6 ans au quartier Dodji Dangban à Allada, ville dans le département de l’Atlantique.  Mariée à SONON Antoine, un maçon, Rachelle est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés.  Rachelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Rachelle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Rachelle vend des plastiques au marché de Sèkou.  Rachelle exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans et s’approvisionne à Cotonou.  Rachelle a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Rachelle désire élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, mais elle manque suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver.  C’est la raison pour laquelle Rachelle sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Rachelle was born around 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, but has been living for six years in the Dodji Dangban district in Allada, a city in Atlantique County. Married to SONON Antoine, a mason, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Rachelle never attended school. To meet her needs, she sells plastic ware at the Sèkou market. She has been in this business for six years and gets her supplies in Cotonou. She has already had an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid. She would like to raise her level of business in order to satisfy her customers more, but she lacks sufficient funds to do so. This is why Rachelle is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 24 dozen pieces of plastic ware

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 33 años y su pequeña hija Rosali, con quien posa alegremente en la foto.

Desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y ahora tiene sus propios sembríos, en los cuales tiene papa, choclos y alverjas, los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus campos, ya que así tendrá productos para vender dentro de 6 meses. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos. 
Con el tiempo, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 

Este es el sexto préstamo de Mercedes con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso y poco a poco podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de sus pagos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que este producto tiene gran demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 33-year-old unassuming and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Hector (age 33), and their young daughter Rosali, with whom she is so cheerfully posing in this photo.

At a very young age, she learned how to cultivate the land because her family has been in agriculture for many generations. She learned this skill from her parents, and now she has her own crop fields where she grows potatoes, corn, and peas. She sells her produce at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she likes most about her job is planting the seeds because she knows that she will have produce within 6 months. She has been in business for 10 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is having to protect her crops from any invading pests. In the future, she would like to have her own produce stand at the city's wholesale market, so that she can increase her income.

This is Mercedes' sixth loan with MFP. She feels that the loan money will be of great benefit to her because little by little, it will help her improve her quality of life. She is a very responsible client who is always current with her payments at the communal bank. With the 1,500.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed because peas are in high demand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Antoinette Clémence

texts.fr: D. M. Antoinette Clémence est née le 12 Octobre 1963 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Antoinette Clémence est mère D. six enfants qui sont tous scolarisés, mais un des enfants n'est plus à sa charge. Antoinette Clémence ne vit plus avec son mari ; elle vit donc seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les différentes charges D. la famille. Antoinette Clémence s'est installée depuis six ans environs à Fidjrossè Kpota à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Depuis une trentaine d'année, en vue d'assurer un bien être à ses enfants et D. subvenir à ses besoins, Antoinette Clémence vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, sucre, savons, papiers hygiéniques, lait, etc.) à son domicile. Antoinette Clémence s'approvisionne à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente D. ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Antoinette Clémence désire renforcer un peu plus son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter auprès D. ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Antoinette Clémence D. M. was born 12 October 1963 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin. She is the mother of six children, all of whom have had schooling, but one of the children is no longer under her care. Antoinette Clémence lives no longer with her husband; she lives alone with her children and is their sole support for family expenses. She settled six years ago in the Fidjrossè Kpota borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For the last thirty years, seeking to ensure the well-being of her children and meet her own needs, Antoinette Clémence has been retailing various products from her home (pasta, canned goods, sugar, soap, toilet paper, milk, etc.). She gets her supplies from Cotonou. Antoinette Clémence is a regular client of ALIDé, and reimburses correctly her loans. She wants to bolster her business and increase customer satisfaction, which is why she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, canned goods, sugar, soap, toilet paper, milk, etc.).

loans.name: Sa Ben Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Sa Ben group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group in order to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy more goods to add to their stock, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu K. was born in Magburaka town 30 ago. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. Three of her children are in secondary school, one in primary school and the last is not of school-going age. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells jewelry, toiletries and cosmetics. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, toiletries and cosmetics

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.en:
Lutfullo is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He is married, has two children and he and his family live in Isfara, Tajikistan. Lutfullo works in the central city market where he has been working for six years selling men’s clothing. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. Once a month, he travels to the neighboring city to purchase new goods. Lutfullo likes working for himself and his business has been the main source of income for his whole family.

Today, he would like to ask for a loan of 3000 USD to purchase new clothing to resell. We believe Lutfullo’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of his business's growth. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON International's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to resell

loans.name: Washington William

texts.es:
Washington  de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es soltero pero tiene tres hijos jovenes que viven con el. El trabajaba en un taller de enderezadora pero por los pocos ingresos que le generaba tuvo que retirarse y empezar en otra actividad.

Comenzó alquilando un carro para ser taxista hace 14 años atrás, empezo a ahorrar y hace dos años atras compro su propio carro,  no tiene horario fijo para trabajar, en ocasiones trabaja en la madrugada. Gasta un aproximado de gasolina diario de $ 40.00 y tiene una ganancia de $ 100.00.  El vehiculo de Washington es un poco viejo y se le ha estado dañando. 

Con el préstamo quiere hacer el mantenimiento al motor de su vehiculo para que trabaje mas tiempo. En el futuro quiere tener una cooperativa de taxis.
texts.en:
Washington is 34 years old and lives in the urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil; he is single but has three young children that live with him. He used to work in a car repair shop but since he earned very little money, he had to quit and look for something else. He started renting a taxi 14 years ago and began saving his money; 2 years ago he was able to buy his own car. He doesn't have a fixed work schedule but sometimes he works in the early mornings. He spends about $40 per day in gas and earns about $100. His car is a little old and has various things that need to be fixed. He will use the loan to fix the motor so it will last longer. In the future he would like to run a taxi co-op.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi maintenance

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es oriunda de la provincia de Loja desde hace 25 años, se radicó en la provincia de Manabí, actualmente está formando parte del banco comunal Los Corrales situado en una localidad a las afuera de la ciudad de Montecristi.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad está casada tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, se dedica al comercio informal de ropa y zapatos para damas y caballeros, con los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación ha podido incrementar su negocio, nos comentó que  junto a su hija la señora Magdalena sale a recorrer por el sector donde viven, mientras que el esposo tiene otra actividad relacionada con la venta de productos lácteos, con los ahorros de toda la vida han podido comprarse tres vacas y son las que producen, ellos se encargan de preparar el queso y los demás derivados de la leche, para luego llevar a entregar a despensas y demás clientes.

La señora Magdalena invertirá su crédito en surtir su negocio viajara hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil donde están situado los grandes almacenes de ropa, el viaje lo realiza  cada cierto tiempo o por lo menos cuando tiene bastante pedidos, está muy agradecida con su amiga quien la motivo para que ingrese a las ventas, con el negocio la señora Magdalena está muy contenta porque ha podido ayudar con sus ganancias a su esposo en el hogar, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en pantalones, blusas, y zapatos la forma de vender es salir a visitar a sus clientes  les deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, una vez que recupera el capital vuelve a invertir en mercadería.
texts.en:
Magdalena came from the province of Loja 25 years ago. She moved to the province of Manabí and at present is a member of the communal bank Los Corrales, located in a community on the outskirts of the city of Montecristi. Our member is 43 years old, is married and has four children who are all adults. She is an informal vendor of clothes and shoes for women and men. With the loans she has recieved from the Foundation, she has been able to grow her business. She informed us that with her daughter, Magdalena goes out to travel the sector where they live, while her husband has another activity related to selling dairy products. With their life savings, they have been able to buy three cows and they are producing. They make the cheese and the other milk products and later deliver them to stores and other clients. Magdalena will invest her loan in diversifying her business. She will travel to Guayaquil where the big clothing stores are. She makes the trip periodically or at least when there are a lot of orders. She is very grateful to her friend who motivated her to get into sales. Magdalena is very happy with the business because she has been able to help her husband at home with her earnings. With this new loan she will invest in pants, blouses and shoes. She sells by going to visit her customers' houses. She sells on credit and collects every two weeks. Once she recovers the capital, she re-invests in merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shoes, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Munhjav

texts.en:
Munhjav G. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

Munhjav currently operates a clothing trade business in her town to support her family. She started her business in 2009 and since then it has become stable. Her husband runs a transportation service throughout the province.

Munhjav has found success in her new trade and attributes this to her good business knowledge and selling skills. She is very hardworking and optimistic and is very persistent in achieving her goals. She says, "My business is continuing quite well. I run it with my friends, but I want to purchase a container where I will sell the products and work separately and independently from my friends someday."

Munhjav is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import more clothes for her business from Erlian, a city of China. Munhjav is in the middle of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is married and has a grown son. She lives in Mukachevo.

Natasha runs a small retail store called "Scarlett" located in downtown Mukachevo. In her little store she sells items such as purses, umbrellas, and wallets. She opened her retail store eight years ago. Her enterprise is popular among customers, as it has a favorable location and her merchandise is offered at affordable prices.

Natasha would like to receive a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She works hard to balance her profits and expenses. The loan would remove the need for her to use money from her family budget to make purchases for her business.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Monasterios Callizaya

texts.es: El joven J. C. se dedica a la venta de balones desde hace dos años,  tiene clientes fijos que le hacen pedidos de Provincias de la ciudad de Cochabamba  y también en la ciudad, le va muy bien con la venta de sus productos que son balones futbol, también balones para piscinas,  este crédito es para la compra de variedad de tamaños de balones, el trabaja ya con un banco de emprendimiento  Villa Paraíso, esta en su tercer ciclo, también saca créditos oportunos, donde ha demostrado ser muy cumplido es sus pagos. El Joven  vive en alquiler, en la casa de su tía, es soltero, con muchas ganas de superación, también tiene deseos de terminar sus estudios y ser profesional para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
J. C. has been selling balls for the past two years. He has steady customers who send him orders from the Cochabamba provinces and also from within the city itself. Sales of his products are doing well. They include soccer balls, and balls for swimming pools. He will use the money from this loan to buy balls of different sizes. He works with an entrepreneurial bank (communal bank) called “Villa Paraíso” (Paradise Way). It’s in its third cycle and he has also obtained loans of opportunity, for which he has established a good repayment record. This young man lives in his aunt’s house, for which he pays rent. He is single and has lots of ambition to succeed. He also wants to complete his studies and establish a professional career in order to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales aún viven con ella, reside junto a su familia en el caserío San Martín, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por su abundante producción de frutas las cuales suelen ser exportadas a diversos países, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en la vivienda donde reside, ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrian que dirigirse hacia el pueblo de Tambogrande para poder adquirirlos. Este establecimiento es importante para su familia ya que gracias a el pueden sostenerse y salir adelante, durante el tiempo que lleva funcionando, Eulalia ha trabajado arduamente para poder mantenerlo y actualmente lo ha ampliado poco a poco.

Debido al buen trato que ofrece su negocio siempre cuenta con buena acogida, Eulalia desea adquirir mas productos de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Eulalia es una mujer bastante luchadora: ha sabido salir adelante y hacer progresar a su familia aun siendo madre soltera, ella desea seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 42, is separated and has four children who still live with her. She lives with her family in San Martín, a rural area of Tambogrande district, a farming district noted for its abundant fruit production that is usually exported to various countries. It’s part of Piura province located in Piura region over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She sells basic needs items in a grocery store located in her home. She stocks all kinds of daily use articles which they would have to go to the town of Tambogrande to get. This establishment is important for her family because thanks to it they are able to sustain themselves and get ahead. During the time it’s been in operation, Eulalia has worked hard to maintain it and has gradually expanded it. Thanks to the good customer service she provides, she is well received. Eulalia would like to purchase more products so that she can continue to meet customer demand. In order to reach this goal, she needs to request a 2000 sol loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. Eulalia is quite a tenacious woman. She has learned how to get ahead and push her family to succeed even though she’s a single mother. She wants to continue to work to raise her children. In the area where she resides her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mrs. Sampheas Yav Village Bank Group

texts.en: The 14 people included in this village bank loan are villagers in Prey Mul village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sampheas Y. is the village bank president. She is 22 years old and was selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Some Mut, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice to sell to support their family. She also grows mushrooms and her husband owns a plow machine. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to support the field. So to improve production, Mrs. Sampheas Y. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. With these activities, they support a child who is two months old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sorbeh - Ii Group

texts.en:
These women run small-scale businesses in Makama, on the outskirts of Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 500,000 leones each to enable them to expand their businesses. With the loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses and make more sales and profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living and send their children to school and feed and clothe them. 

Adamsay G. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makama village 35 years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary school. Adamsay sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc. She has been running this business for two years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more stock wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina S. D. se dedica a vender artículos de catalogó que vende bajo pedido de acuerdo lo que el cliente necesite. Con este negocio ya lleva 2 años lo cuales le ha ido muy bien, ya que ofrece perfumes, cosméticos, artículos para el hogar y mas. La señora quiere un préstamo para invertir más en el negocio y así seguir generando más ingresos. Aunque Martina tiene su venta de productos, también trabaja en maquiladora.
texts.en:
Martina S. D. works as a catalog salesperson. She orders according to the needs of her customers. She has been doing this for 2 years now and things are going very well. She sells perfumes, cosmetics, household items and more. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, and thereby increase her income. In addition to her catalog sales, she also works in an assembly plant.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
Fazeelat is the resident of Medina town which is a housing colony located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. She lives in a 2 room brick house with her family.

She has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s electronic items selling business. With the loan amount he will buy electronic items such as irons, televisions and ovens to sell through his electronics shop and to make money for his family.

Fazeelat has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a school and get their education except the youngest son who is just 3 years old. She herself is a school teacher and also sews clothes at her home. She knows the importance of education, which is why she wants her children to get the maximum education possible and improve their future.

She has good expectations from her husband that by using his 10 years of experience in his work, he will be able to gain maximum results from the investment. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Fazeelat.

loans.use: To buy electronic items to resell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel wants a loan to buy a piece of land to construct a rental house. He is a 40-year-old single man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Emmanuel is a civil servant and, given the low income he earns, he feels he needs to have a side income. Thus, he dreams of constructing a rental house. He feels that, with the rental house, he will be able to have a better standard of living. He dreams of going for further studies so that he can grow in his career.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for construction of a rental house

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito G. Jr. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 30 years old. Lito is married and has one school-age child. 

Lito owns a business in which the main source of income comes from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Lito has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide his service. Lito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Delia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia Elizabeth; tiene 28 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja en una empresa privada de marketing, la artesanía vende en las ferias que se realiza en la ciudad del Cusco, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de artesanías. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Los Lideres" ["The Leaders"] communal bank, located in Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Delia Elizabeth. She is 28 years old and is single. She alternates her regular daily activities with the sale of handicrafts. She is a street vendor, and also works at a private marketing business. She sells her handicrafts at the markets held in the city of Cusco. She would like to have a store to sell handicrafts. She is requesting a loan to purchase handicrafts wholesale. 

She appreciates the loan she is requesting, and agrees to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates a cattle and goat meat selling business, and sells to the local residents at wholesale. In addition he sells fish which contributes as another source of income. Mohammed faces a major challenge of drought in his business. He hopes to open a butcher shop in the future.

Antony decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to purchase more cows and goats.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and goats.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virgilia B. is from the Barangay (village) of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and a widow. She is blessed with eight children, all of whom are now adults. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She’s been engaged in this business for one year. At this time she is earning an amount of not less than $50 per month. 

In the year 2007, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia, as a member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: José Lizandro

texts.es:
José Lizandro tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a brindar servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos motorizados, en su mayoría motocicletas y mototaxis. El cuenta con un taller situado en una de las calles más céntricas de su distrito. Su negocio cuenta con un buen número de clientes y como en la localidad las motocicletas y mototaxis son el medio de transporte más utilizado, el siempre tiene trabajo que realizar.

José desea adquirir repuestos para poder contar con un inventario estable que le permita mejorar su atención y brindar un servicio más completo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permita lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Lizandro is 51 years old, single, and lives with his family in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with steady commercial activity.  It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last eight years, José has offered an auto repair and maintenance service, primarily for motorcycles and moto-taxis.  He has a workshop located on one of the district's central streets.  His business has a good number of clients because motorcycles and moto-taxis are the most common mode of transportation in the area.  José always has work to do.
 
José would like to acquire spare parts so that he can count on a stable inventory of them, which will allow him to offer better and more complete service to his clients.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will make it possible for him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and moto-taxi repair business

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
