Daylinda E. is from the village of Olingan. She is 62 years old, married, and has four adult children. Daylinda operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Daylinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds for her business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Daylinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Nyamira in Western Kenya for over three years. He employs one farmhand and sells his produce of tea, maize and bananas at the local market. He is married with one child – aged four.

Jared has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this loan will uplift the living standards for his family.  He hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows and expand his farm acreage in the next five years. His greatest challenge is the harsh weather condition, especially on tea.  He is appreciative to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services offered.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Pon S., age 41, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. She is married with three children, all of whom are single. Since 2000, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Her husband works in this farming business. Pon S. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy gasoline and many sacks of fertilizers to help her rice crop grow well.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and many sacks of fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a open retail shop for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Shida faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase four bundles of tea leaves and sacks of sugar to resell in smaller amounts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Jean Pierre S. est un prêtre, éleveur, et agriculteur dans le district du Rubavu, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il est marie, ne a Rwanda, et il a 8 enfants entre 6 ans et 30 ans.  Tous de ses enfants vont a l’école, et Jean Pierre a fini deux ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son 3eme cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de pierres, 10 sacs de ciments, 11 kgs de clous et main d’œuvre pour la construction d’une maison de location.  Il voudrait bâtir beaucoup des grandes, propres maison pour son affaire.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer leur bien-être, bâtir d’autres maisons d’habitation, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre S. is a priest, livestock farmer, and grower in the Rubavu district. He has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is married, was born in Rwanda, and has eight children, aged 6 to 30. All the children go to school, and Jean Pierre has finished two years of secondary school.

This loan is on its third cycle with ACB, and Jean Pierre has a good record in repaying loans. He is going to use his loan to buy 20 sacks of stones, 10 sacks of cement, 11 kg of nails, and the labor for building a house to rent out. He would like to build many large and proper houses for his business.  As for his family members, he would like to ensure their well-being, to build more homes, and to cover his children's schooling costs.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of stones, 10 sacks of cement, 11 kg of nails, and labor for building a house to rent

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne M. K. is a woman of thirty-four years, married to Newton Nyongesa and the mother of three beautiful children. She lives in Kitale town where she runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of about $356.

This will be Everlyne's 1st loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan amount to add stock to her retail shop, like more sugar, rice, baking flour, etc. With the income she will get, she plans to pay school fees for her children. 

In future, Everlyne wants to educate her children to the highest level and also expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: La señora Magali trabaja como empleada domestica en la zona sur de la ciudad pero también ella lava ropa particularmente, su esposo es albañil, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cepillos para lavado de ropa, detergentes y lavandinas. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez  que Magali trabaja con Impro.
texts.en:
Sra. Magali works as a domestic employee in the southern part of the city, but she also has a separate business providing laundry services. Her husband works as a mason. Magali and her husband are able to support themselves with their incomes.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy brushes for scrubbing clothes, detergents, and bleaches. She lives in a rental property located in the District of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz. Magali is married and has five children. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To purchase brushes for scrubbing clothes, detergents, and bleaches.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines. 

Evelyn is borrowing 1,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. 

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. 

Evelyn is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk wholesale

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en: Soeng is a local farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To make a living, she and her husband grow two rice crops a year, one during the rainy season and one during the dry season.  They earn an average of $5 a day. Soeng will use her loan to buy a plot of fertile land from her neighbor in order to enlarge her rice crop planting.  She can also rent the land to other villagers for a fee. Soeng is blessed with four children, three of whom are single and one is married.

loans.use: buy a plot of land

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38 year-old businessman. He is married to Agnes.  John has been in the quarrying business (stones for construction) for the past three years in Murera, in the central part of Kenya. His monthly income is KES. 6,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Ksh.10,000. He will use it to buy quarrying tools.

John plans to use the anticipated profit to sustain his family and to improve their living conditions. His hopes and dreams are to own a mining factory and at the moment he is looking for a Kiva lender to help him realize this dream.

loans.use: to buy quarrying tools

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en: Jaber is a 21-year-old man from Jablia Refugee camp. He inherited his profession from his father. Jaber transports passengers between Jabalia refugee camp and neighboring areas. Jaber took out a loan from FATEN to pay for car maintenance and painting. The car is in a very good shape and needs only painting and a regular check and maintenance. Jaber is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to pay for car painting and maintenance

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en:
Urbana is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Urbana has a shop that sells rice per kilograms. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Urbana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Urbana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married lady with four children. She sells clothes to earn a living for her family.  She has been engaged in this business for seven years.  She works hard in her business to provide a good education for her children. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business and has learned how to save her money.  Jane hopes to open a milk bar in the future. She has requested 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is from the village of Ijareti, Adigeni District. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his wife Marekh, three sons (10 years old, 7 years old and 3 months old) and his 72-year-old mother. Kakhaber and Marekh are running a family agricultural business. They have four milk cows, produce approximately 80 kg of cheese and sell it locally to dairy product retailers. In addition, they own 0.75 hectares land where they grow potatoes, maize and haricot. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to the retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Kakhaber requests a loan for expansion and renovation of the cattle shed building, as he plans to increase the amount of the cows on the farm. The existing building is small and is hardly enough for four cows.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand and renovate the cattle shed

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es: Anatolia, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 41 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 46 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle  un futuro prometedor. Anatolia viene realizando la actividad del agro hace 23 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus cultivos de cacao y café ella adquirió más espacios de terreno para cultivar. Pero en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Por otra parte compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente viven los miembros de su familia. Asimismo cuenta con una hectárea de terreno sin cultivar,  lo cual necesita de capital para plantar cacao, y  por tal acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  a sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP y por ello espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará más semillas de cacao para extender la siembra de éste fruto.
texts.en:
Anatolia is 41 years old and a native of Quimbiri. She is a modest and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Benjamín, age 46, and their three beloved children from whom she wants to provide a promising future. Anatolia has been farming for 23 years. With great care and effort, she grows cacao and coffee. As a result of her production, she was able to acquire more space for growing these crops. Whenever she has to remove weeds or harvest her crops, Anatolia hires laborers to help with these tasks so that the work gets completed faster and she can stay on schedule. She purchased another piece of land where she currently lives with her family.

Anatolia has one hectare of land that has not been cultivated, so she needs capital for planting cacao. For this reason, she has approached MFP since the organization provides loans to people of limited resources who are looking to make progress. For the sake of her work, she hopes to bring the same level of effort and energy that she demonstrates when she is raising her children.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she hopes to receive the necessary assistance so that she can accomplish her goals. Anatolia promises to complete her payments on time, just as she did with her previous loans. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more cacao seeds so that she can increase her plantings.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa cuenta con 34 años de edad ella es casada y tiene una niña de 8 años de edad la cual estudia la primaria. Ella se dedica a vender ropa para dama y niña desde hace 5 años dice que emprendió este tipo de negocio para ayudarle a pagar a su esposo el departamento donde viven para que a su esposo no se le hiciera tan pesados los pagos. Tere como de cariño le dicen esta  pidiendo un crédito para la compra de ropa como trajecitos de pants y chamarra para damas y playeras para niñas y pantalones de mezclilla. Ella ira a surtirse de ropa a la ciudad de México a fabricas donde hacen ese tipo de ropa para que le salga un poco mas económico para que después ella tenga un poco de ganancias. Dice que ella vende su ropa en pagos a sus conocidas y a las personas que tienen un trabajo estable para que no le queden mal en los pagos y así ella poder volver a surtirse. Doña Teresa esta muy contenta por que con este crédito podrá comprar un poco mas de ropa y tendrá mas variedad. El sueño que tiene ella es tener un local propio donde venda su ropa para ya no andar cargando las bolsas que son muy pesadas por la gran variedad que les ofrece a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 34 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old daughter who is an elementary school student. She has been selling clothes for women and girls for five years. Teresa says that she started this type of business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and relieve him of such a heavy burden.

Tere, as she is affectionately called, is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothing such as pants suits and jackets for women, girls’ t-shirts, and jeans. She will restock on clothing by traveling to Mexico City, where the factories that make these garments are located. The clothes that are offered there are more affordable, so she will be able to make a little bit of profit. Tere says that she offers payment installments only to people she knows or those who have stable jobs and good payment records. This allows her to restock on merchandise.

Doña Teresa is very pleased because this loan will allow her to buy a little more clothing so that she can have more variety. Her dream is to have her own shop where she can sells clothes so that she does not have to carry around heavy bags of merchandise. This will also allow her to offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Anais Veronica

texts.es: La Señora Anaís es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 02 años, la señora se dedica hace 02 años en la venta de Caña de Azúcar de forma ambulatoria (en la calle), el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería (caña de azúcar), y en la compra de un triciclo, para así incrementar mejor su negocio y sus ingresos. El gran desafío que presenta la señora es la ausencia del papá ante su menor hijo, una de las principales metas es seguir creciendo con su negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además el gran sueño de la Señora Anaís es mejorar su casa y construir con el tiempo su segunda planta (segundo piso), está muy contenta por la oportunidad que le están dado ya que cumplirá con sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Sra. Anaís is a single mother and has a little boy who is two years old. For the past two years, she has been selling sugar cane as a street vendor. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more sugar cane and a tricycle so that she can increase her business and generate more income.

Her greatest challenge is the absence of her child’s father. One of her main goals is to continue growing in her business and have a grocery store in her home. Her greatest wish is to make improvements to her home and then add a second level later. She is very pleased with the opportunity that has been given to her so that she can accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane and a tricycle for her business.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath, 28, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

Sambath is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and farmer, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sambath is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 50-year-old man. He is married and has one son. He has a taxi and works as a taxi driver with a low income, and it is the only source of income for the family. Jamal wants to improve the taxi conditions by purchasing a new engine so the taxi's work capacity will increase. The amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for a new engine, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Jamal gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase a new engine for his taxi. This will increase the capacity for the taxi to work and enable Jamal to work extra hours to increase his income and provide better living conditions to his family. Jamal is photographed next to his taxi.


About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La señora Amalia trabaja en una tienda donde vende ropa para niños; su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para iniciar un negocio propio de venta de artículos eléctricos para el hogar, como licuadoras, batidoras, planchas, horno s de micro ondas, zumidoras, etc. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de nueva Potosi en la ciudad de La Paz; Amalia es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Amalia works at a shop that sells children’s clothing. Her husband has a job with a private company. The loan she is requesting will be used to start her own business of selling electrical appliances for the home such as blenders, mixers, irons, microwave ovens, calculators, and other items. Amalia lives at the home of her parents in the District of Nueva Potosi in the city of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy household appliances such as blenders, mixers, irons, microwave ovens, calculators, and other items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and is married to Paul. The couple has four children, all of whom attend school. For the past three years, Susan has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this will be her first loan.    

Susan is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray. In the future, she hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Mischeal

texts.en:
Mischeal is a married woman with one child. She is 27 years old and resides in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Mischeal owns and operates a business venture, cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 to pay for the cost paid for coconut harvesting. Mischeal has been a member of GDMPC for almost three years. In the future, she wants to expand the business and for her child's education to be completed.

loans.use: to pay for the cost paid for coconut harvesting

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is from Mantic Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Leonila is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Leonila operates a retail business, selling a variety of personal products in the local community such as shorts, blouses, accessories, etc. Leonila has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Leonila is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Mercedes Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 46 años y es madre soltera de  un hijo, el mismo que ya es mayor de edad y aun vive con ella con su familia. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de recibir la ayuda que le brinda la institución.

Ella para ganarse el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 11h00, se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para luego regresar a su localidad y recorrer este lugar y sitios cercanos en un triciclo ofreciendo sus productos, viene dedicada a esta actividad por más de cinco años y gracias a este negocio puede salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiarse sin tener que pagar altos intereses.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para ir a otros lugares a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos (United Women of Los Bajos Communal Bank) meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known both for its cultural riches and handicrafts such as Panama hats, which are known both inside and outside the country. Here we meet Señora Mercedes, age 46. She is a single mother with one adult son who still lives with her with his family.

Mercedes has been with the communal bank for two cycles. She likes it because of the opportunity of receiving help that the institution offers.

In order to earn a daily living, Mercedes is engaged in the sale of fruits and vegetables. She works every day from 5:00 until 11:00. She leaves very early in the morning for the largest market in order to buy the best products and then return to her location and travel around on a tricycle offering her products for sale. She has been involved in this business for more than five years and thanks to the business is able to get ahead.

This loan is for the purchase of fruits and vegetables. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because with the loans she can finance herself without having to pay high interest. Her dream is to buy a car so that she can go to other places to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor is a 40-year-old, married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has run a clothing business in Bor, South Sudan, for one year.

Ayor has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol, 23, is married, and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband installs and repair speakers, and also rents speakers for wedding ceremonies and funerals. Kol is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to pull the cart which carries the rental speakers. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store, build new wooden house, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to pull the cart that carries rental speakers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 29 years old and is married with one child. She owns a grocery shop and has been in this business for 4 years. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her grocery shop. She hopes to open a big grocery shop and be financially stable in the future. Caroline has applied for a loan of 10,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables to stock in his new grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to stock in her new grocery shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is still running her restaurant, where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner, working from 8 am to 8 pm. Thanks to this business she brings up her children. Her dream is to expand and improve her restaurant. She applies for this loan to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Marielos' Group

texts.es:
Solidaria Mujer las Azucareras

Este grupo se crea en la zona de Atirro de Turrialba, el nombre se debe a que es una zona de producción de caña de azúcar, el grupo está conformado por 3 integrantes, Marielos en  conjunto con las hijas Shirley y Milena realizan esta solicitud para apoyar sus negocios que en  orden son los siguientes: que desarrollan actividades tales como pulpería, peluquería canina y repostería 

Han invertido préstamos anteriores individuales con FM en sus negocios y además han tenido la oportunidad de capacitarse y mejorar sus habilidades y capacidades. En esta oportunidad busca invertir en mejorar sus negocios, que son diferentes, y apoyar así la economía familiar.


Negocios estable, Milena es madre de 1 niño, se dedica a al adiestramiento de animales y peluquería canina, actividad que aprendió en México hace aproximadamente 2 años, visita a sus clientes a domicilio donde entrena mascotas y les da cuidados tales como baño corte de pelo y desparasitación. Su negocio es muy solicitado en la zona y quiere invertir en producto para tratamiento de animales así como artefactos de goma y alimentos especiales para mascotas.

Las integrantes del Solidaria Mujer las azucareras tienen experiencia del trabajo en grupo, eligen su junta directiva y crean su reglamento de trabajo cuentan con  mercado en una zona de poco comercio pero con presencia de industria azucarera, donde realizan sus negocios.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Las Azucareras” [The Sugar Producers]

This group is from Atirro de Turrialba. It has this name because they are located in  a region where sugar cane is grown. The group is comprised of three members. Marielos and her daughters Shirley and Milena are requesting a loan to support their businesses: a grocery store, a dog grooming shop and a bakery.

They have received individual loans before from FM and have had the opportunity to learn and improve their skills. This time, they want to invest in their different businesses and support the family’s economy.

Their businesses are stable. Milena has a son and works training and grooming dogs, something she learned in Mexico approximately two years ago. She visits her clients at their homes and trains, delouses and trims their pets’ coats. Her business is very popular with locals and she needs to buy supplies such as rubber toys and pet food.

The members of this group have experience working together; they elect the board and create their own work rules. They have a store in an area with few commercial activities but with a strong presence of the sugar sector, with which they do business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and different supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Kwanza is a village in the Kitale area of Kenya where people suffer from poverty and lack of capital. Most people who live in this area are smallholder farmers. 

Violet has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past 6 years. She believes in the slogan "Unity is strength", which is why she decided to join Neema kolongolo self-help group. 

For the past 5 years, Violet has been actively involved in mixed farming. She never got the chance to get a white collar job but this has not been a setback. She has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs and implements such as fertilizers, seeds, and tools. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs, such as high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and, hence, increased profit levels. 

Violet is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and produce more than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a smallholder woman farmer with a big passion for farming. She is a woman eager to get ahead and lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with six children. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. 

Beatrice practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs. 

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Beatrice is a mother who wants to see her 6 children become great people, and wants them to have professional careers, that’s why she wants to give them the best education. Help her to accomplish that and more with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita oponed “Bazar Heidy” three years ago and sold cosmetic goods door-to-door. A year ago, she opened a shop out of her home and has been selling successfully ever since. She mainly markets bazaar items, stationary, and cosmetics. Every day from 8am until 11pm this entrepreneur works hard to support her family, and she is intent on expanding her business to provide them with opportunities that she never had. Margarita’s daughter once loaned her $200 to buy two glass cases to show off her products at the store, and her traveling business has grown steadily over the years. She is applying for this credit so that she can purchase toys, clothes, and invest offer seasonal products. 

Margarita is a single mother of four, and although her children are all adults now, two of them still live with her. Her wish is take out this loan in order to bring in other sources of income from her business.

loans.use: She is applying for this credit so that she can purchase toys, clothes, and invest offer seasonal products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys intends to buy 200 bunches of bananas

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has had a small retail business for about 10 years. She sells a variety of general hardware goods such as paint, small electrical appliances, cleaning supplies, planting seeds, and dishes. By offering a range of products she provides a convenient stop for her customers who often buy more than one item from her. Her average monthly profit is between $500 and $800. Galina decided to open two new sales locations and is investing money to get them up and running. Expanding from one to three locations should significantly increase business revenue and her income in the future.

Galina has requested a loan of $1200 to increase her working capital. Opening the new sales locations requires a substantial investment from both her savings and monthly income. This loan will give her added flexibility and help cover some of her growing expenses while she develops a larger business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her hardware business and open two new retail locations

loans.name: Sith

texts.en: Mrs. Sith S. is 37 years old and the mother of 7 children. She sells Khmer traditional cakes such as Num Korm, Num Bot, and Num Krouk to the people in her community and usually earns up to $4 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works in his rice paddy growing crops as well as several kinds of vegetables. Two of her children are employed at a hotel, but the others are students. Currently, this couple is humbly requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to help them purchase a cow, seeds, and a motorcycle to expand their farming venture. She and her family would be grateful and appreciative of your support.

loans.use: Needs a cow, seeds and a motorcycle for their farm

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en: Above is Launiu M., secretary of Samatau Centre. Like other colleagues at this centre, Launiu is selling vegetables and ice cakes for a living. She targets the families at Samatau and she is very happy with the assistance from SPBD as it has given her the resources to start a small business which now helps meet the needs of her family. She is grateful for SPBD’s assistance and she plans to continue to use SPBD’s assistance in future.

loans.use: For supplies for her little store

loans.name: Suminah

texts.id:
Presently, Suminah sells at the market daily. Her stall is approximately 1.5 meter square, paying a rent of Rp 1.000.000,00 (about USD110) for 2 years. The capital is needed to fund the daily turnover between Rp 500.000,00 to Rp 1.000.000,00 (USD55 to USD110) generating a profit of Rp 50.000,00 (about USD5.50). The loan amounting Rp 5.000.000,00 (about USD550) she received will be used business funding and payment of rent of the stall in the market. With this additional funding, she hopes to generate a daily profit of Rp 65.000,00 (USD7). She work on this business herself while her husband lives in Java. He is a farmer. Selling spices and preserved salt fish diligently over the prior 12 months had supported the family.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Suminah saat ini berjualan di pasar Sempidi. Setiap hari dia berjualan di pasar. Tempat usahanya berukuran 1.5 m2 dengan biaya sewa Rp 1.000.000,00/ 2 tahunnya. Modal yang dia butuhkan setiap hari berkisar antara Rp 500.000,00 – Rp 1.000.000,00 dengan keuntungan Rp 50.000,00. Pinjaman sejumlah Rp 5.000.000,00 yang dia peroleh akan digunakan sebagai modal usaha dan untuk membayar sewa tempat di pasar. Dengan tambahan modal in dia berharap mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 65.000,00/harinya. Usaha ini dia kerjakan sendiri, sementara suaminya tinggal di Jawa. Dia bekerja sebagai petani. Usaha jual bumbu dan ikan asin yang sudah ditekuni sejak 12 tahun yang lalu mampu membiayai hidupnya dan anak – anaknya.

loans.use: As funding for business and stall rent (Sebagai modal usaha dan untuk membayar sewa tempat di pasar)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Sra. Maribel M. B. is 37 years old and is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is married to Sr. Alfredo Castillo, and they have two children in primary school. Sra. M. has 8 years of experience as owner of a shop selling cheese and cream. Her clients are heads of families and stores offering services in the home. It is notable that in this city a significant amount of cheese and cream are consumed. For this reason, Sra. M. needs to pruchase 204 pounds of cheese at a cost of $1.00 per pound, and 120 pounds of cream at a cost of $0.80 per pound. This investment should be enough to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maribel M. B. tiene 37 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casada con el Sr. Alfredo Castillo tienen 2 hijos ambos estudian en la primaria. La Sra. M. tiene 8 años de experiencia es propietaria de un tramo donde vende queso y crema, sus clientes son padres de familia y pulperías que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio. Se debe mencionar que en esta ciudad se consume bastante queso y crema por esa razón la Sra. M. necesita comprar 204 libras de queso que cuesta $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 120 libras de crema que cuesta $0.80 centavos dólar la libra, con esta inversión podrá abastecer la demanda de las pulperías.

loans.use: Purchase of Cheese and Cream

loans.name: Pulatova

texts.en: Pulatova A. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She made the decision to become the client of MicroInvest because all her friends and colleagues improved their business situtions thanks to MicroInvest. Mrs.Pulatova became the client of MicroInvest in 2007, and now recommends herself as a reliable and executive client. She works in the food bazaar and she is engaged in business of food products selling. Despite the fact that she started the business from scratch, now Mrs. Pulatova has a very wide assortment of goods and thanks to her politeness and sensitiveness she has the repeat customers for cultured milk products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products, etc. She works with the suppliers, and that gives her opportunity to work with clients of the different income levels. But working in the trade sphere, she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. It allows her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business. Mrs. Pulatova A. requests the loan of $350 for business development and to widen her assortment of goods.

loans.use: for business development, by building the assrtment of goods she offers

loans.name: Mahsat

texts.en: J. Mahsat was born in 1961 in the J.Rasulov region and she is married and has 6 children. Despite the difficult financial terms of the family she tries to do all her best to improve the prevalent situation. She works hardly and trades nearby the flea bazaar by the perfumery (hair dye/tint, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents and etc). Now Mrs. J. Mahsat requests the loan of 1100 STJ for the new good purchasing.

loans.use: for the new good purchasing

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Mrs. Om T., age 44, is a widow who sells groceries from her house, normally earning around $20 in revenue a day. She has 2 children, all of whom help her to sell the products. To improve her income, she would like to borrow from Kiva to purchase products in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase products in bulk.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong C., 45, and her husband married in 1984. They have two children; one son and one daughter. One of her children is employed full time. The family lives along the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Kong has been a weaver for twenty eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who will sell it in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has been a wooden house constructor for ten years. 

She is requesting a loan of $200 to to purchase materials for weaving silk.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving silk

loans.name: Chreob Lim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreob L. is the group leader of six in Sdao Kanleng Village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor and can generate only a small income. She wants to start a new pig breeding business in the village;, and so she has asked for a loan to buy pigs to raise.

Mrs. Chreob L. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are studying in a local school while the other one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Samnamg C., is a garment factory worker. Last year, the youngest child suffered a high fever and Mrs. Chreob L. went to a private hospital. She had unforeseen expenses because of that fever. Now, the family is very healthy and Mrs. Chreob L. needs to start a new business in order to improve her living conditions.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 48 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she has made a living selling firewood since 1984. She learned this trade from her mother. Mary needs a loan of $450 to buy more fire wood to sell. She has been a LAPO client for five years, and wishes to thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fire wood to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She learned this business of selling beef in 6 months. She started her own beef business in 2003. She is a LAPO client. Josephine needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more beef for sale.

loans.use: To buy more beef for sale

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said R. is a 54-year-old married man, father of five children and one of the residents of the Ningarhar province. He has four daughters and a son. His son is about 17 and he is studying in 10th grade. They live in their own home in Shewa district.

Said R. has been teaching in a public school for about 11 years, but his monthly salary is just about US$ 50, and it's difficult to provide for all the expenditures of his family with this small amount. Therefore, in his spare time, he farms besides his teaching. But even still, it's not enough to solve all his finanacial problems. He says that he can't buy fruit or meat every month for his family, and this is the reason why his family have been faced with different illnesses, and he can't cure them easily.

Now, Said R. has decided to buy some livestock and start another business. Also, he says that his son will help him with caring for them, because after school he has time to bring feed for the livestock.

R. thinks that if he sells their milk and yogurt in the bazaar, he may increase his daily income, and after a short time he will make a large husbandry farm. For this purpose, he has applied for 30,000 Afghanis loan from AFSG for a term of 24 months.

Said R. dreams of the day where he can depend on himself alone and of paving the way for his son to continue his higher education and become a great engineer.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es: Ayda Luz tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 16 años de edad. Ella ha logrado superarse en  la vida y tener un trabajo digno para mantener a sus dos hijos. Estudió un curso para maestra, y ahora da clase a los jóvenes de secundaria. Los ingresos que devenga un profesor en Nicaragua son bajos, es por eso que se auxilian de créditos para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, Ayda Luz utilizará el préstamo en la construcción de un servicio higiénico, ya que el que actualmente tiene está en muy mal estado. Espera poder tener siempre su trabajo para terminar de construir su vivienda, y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ayda Luz is 42 years old, she is single, and she lives in the region of Laureles Norte. She has two children aged 10 and 16 years old. She has been able to improve her life circumstances and secure work that is dignified so that she can support her two children. She took a course to be a teacher and she now teaches in secondary school. The income that is earned as a teacher in Nicaragua is small, and that is why she is requesting a loan to renovate her home. Ayda Luz will use this loan to put in a new bathroom because the one they currently use is in a very bad state of disrepair. She hopes to always have her work so that she can finish remodelling her home, and in this way, offer her family a better quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

loans.name: Ruth Veronica

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 26 años. Ella tiene un salón de belleza, además de eso, se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en diversas peluquerías, sin embargo, ella quería tener un negocio propio, fue así que logro abrir su salón de belleza.
El último crédito que ella recibió lo empleo en comprar productos cosméticos para su salón de belleza.
Ahora ella cuenta que necesita renovar los muebles y herramientas que ella utiliza para trabajar, y para eso necesita un pequeño capital que haga posible cumplir sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old. She runs a beauty salon and she also sells cosmetics. Prior to these businesses she used to work in hair styling salons but she always dreamed of having her own business. That's how she managed to open her own beauty salon.

The last loan she received she used to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. She now indicates that she needs to renovate her furniture and she needs new tools that she uses for work. For this reason she requires a small capital fund that will grant her the ability to accomplish her goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate furniture and purchase new tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran baji is a wife of L. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has lived for the past 35 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son makes embroidered clothes. The next eldest son has a grocery shop. The third oldest is in third standard, and her youngest son is just 12 years old. Manzooran baji’s husband has been a fruit seller for the past 5 years.

Manzooran baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group has four other members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a photocopier. Sadia baji wants to buy chicken food for her poultry farm. Sonia baji wants to buy lentils, cooking oil, and spices for her food business. Seema baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Suraiya M.umar Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji, the wife of M., lives in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeat. She owes a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 20 years. She is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder daughter is in 12th standard grade and her younger daughter is in the 10th standard grade. Her elder son is in the 9th standard grade and her younger son is in the 5th standard grade.

Suraiya baji completed her education through the 10th standard grade and earned a diploma (certificate) in nursing. She now works as a nurse in a private hospital for a monthly wage. Her husband has a grocery shop in the community. He has been running this shop for the past 5 years. Suraiya baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Shabana baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle, like a tuk-tuk). Nazir Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy furniture to resell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Te

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Tế  năm nay 36 tuổi. Gia đìnhchị  có 3 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.  Công việc chăn nuôi đang phát triển tốt và là một trong  những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đìnhchị Tế hiện nay. Bên cạnh chăn nuôi hàng năm gia đình chị Tế còn có thêm nguồn thu từ công việc thợ mộc của chồng nên kinh tế đang ngày càng phát triển hơn với mức thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua trâu về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Te is 36 years old. Her family has 3 young children. In 2000 she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to raise pigs. Her animal farming business is expanding quite well, and is one of the sources of her family's income currently. In addition to raising animals, her husband also has a carpentry business so their family's economic situation improves day by day with average income of 208 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 775 USD to buy buffaloes to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy buffaloes to raise

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel B. is 39 years old. He is married and the father of two kids. Currently one is in school whilst the last born is still breastfeeding. Samuel is supportive of his spouse and family through the business he does. He is a car welder in the village where he lives. He sees it as an opportunity to be at home. Samuel went through his apprenticeship 10 years ago in the town of Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. With that period of experience, hard work, humility and time abound.

He decided to move to his home town to establish his welding shop. Through that period it was very difficult for him to start something on his own because he did not have enough money. He went into farming for a while to gather a small amount of money as start-up capital. What the money could do at that time was to buy wood to erect a shop.

Upon advice from friends who are members of Sinapi Aba Trust, he decided to ask for a loan to make business progress. Though at that period he had started working on customers' cars, coal pots, ovens, etc., he was still faced with financial challenges. Samuel is requesting a loan to buy welding machines, steel plates, and silver plates, among others. He believes this would facilitate his work.

Samuel belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’ which means Good Living. He hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress. And he would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: For the purchase of silver plates, steel plates, rods, etc.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en: Hashim (his relative is pictured) was born in 1970. This man is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Abdurrahmanli village. For ten years he has been in the business of selling a variety of products. He is requesting a loan of 950 AZN to buy more stock to sell. In the future, he plans to build a shop from which he can sell wholesale and retail.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Carmen R.

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa vive  en la calle Versalles de la zona Bautista Zaavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
La señora es separada de su esposo vive junto a sus hijos menores.
 
Se dedica a la confección de mantas de lana de vicuña, alpaca y otros, las cuales  comercializa en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de insumos (lana)al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa lives on Versalles Street in the Bautista Zaavedra neighborhood in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She is separated from her husband and still lives with her young children. She works making wool blankets, made from the wool of vicuña, alpaca and other animals, which she sells in various markets in El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase materials (wool) wholesale so she can lower her costs. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca and vicuña wool to manufacture blankets and sell them in the markets

loans.name: Sully

texts.es: Sully tiene 33 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos. Estudió el arte de las manualidades, trabaja elaborando objetos en cerámicas al frío, flores, bijouteria, textiles, carteras, zapatos, etc. Ha hecho de su casa su taller de trabajo y local de capacitación en este arte a las personas interesadas en aprender. Adicionalmente, trabaja para algunas instituciones como capacitadora en manualidades, ya que es toda una experta, tiene 8 años de experiencia con su negocio y le va muy bien. Su meta más cercana es mandar a construir un local para implementar un taller de manualidades con todo lo necesario. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, el dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las diversas manualidades que vende.
texts.en:
Sully is 33 years old and a single mother who lives with her three children. She studied the art of handicraft making, and makes a living producing objects out of modeling clay, flowers, imitation jewelry, textiles, purses, shoes, etc. Sully has made part of her home into a crafts workshop and a place for training people who are interested in learning her art. In addition, Sully works as a handicraft instructor at several institutions; with 8 years of experience in her business she is already an expert, and things are continuing to go well. Right now her goal is to have separate premises constructed where she can set up a crafts workshop that has everything she needs. This is Sully’s second loan with Kiva partner MFP. Sully will use the money she is requesting to invest in purchasing the materials she needs to produce the various handicrafts she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline N. est mariée et a en charge 7 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour promouvoir son activité d’embouche porcine. Elle compte acheter des porcs, les élever et les revendre. Ses revenus vont lui permettre de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline N. is married and responsible for 7 children. She is requesting this loan to expand her pig-raising business. She wants to buy pigs, raise them, and re-sell them. Her income will allow her to contribute to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing, raising and re-selling pigs

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азизахон уже несколько лет занимается предпринимательством. Постоянной торговой точки у нее нету и она ездит по разным базарам и там торгует. Азизахон 32 года, муж в России на заработках, имеет 4 детей. Ассортимент товаров Азизахон включает в себя парфюмерную продукцию и мелкую бижутерию. Капитал бизнеса небольшой но расходы семьи за счет прибыли покрывает. Азизахон планирует немного расширить ассортимент товаров и поэтому решила подать заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Azizahon has been an entrepreneur for several years. She does not have a permanent vending point, which makes her travel to different markets. Azizahon is 32 years old and is a mother of four. Her husband works in Russia. Azizahon sells perfumes and bijou, which helps cover the family's expenditures. Azizahon plans to expand the variety of goods she sells and is applying for a Kiva loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the variety of goods

loans.name: Nizamaddin

texts.en:
Nizamaddin M. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Nizamaddin has been around people raising animals and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Nizamaddin harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. In this way, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved three children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work.

Nizamaddin is requesting a $1,500 loan to purchase two calves. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him continue to bring his family well-being and security.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Sounkar

texts.fr: Sounkar, 60 ans mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre de banc villageois depuis 4ans et demi  Elle  veut renforcer sa boutique en sucre, huile, riz,lait, thé, Omo, cigarette et  pile. L’approvisionnement se fait au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires et à Kolda. Avec l’appui de sa petite fille, la vente se fait au comptant. Elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sounkar, 60, is married and raising 5 children; she has been a member of her village bank for four and a half years. She wants to stock up on sugar, oil, rice, milk, tea, Omo (detergent), cigarettes, and batteries for her little shop. She buys her merchandise at the weekly markets and in Kolda. With the support of her granddaughter, she sells retail. She contributes to improving the living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for her little shop

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn P. is a pig grower. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband, Teofilo P., is also a farmer. While she is busy taking care of the pigs, her husband is busy tilling the rice field. This couple has been working very hard to be able to meet the growing needs of their family.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. The loan will truly help her improve her piggery. She is dreaming of buying five new piglets. She is taking every opportunity to improve her business and send her children to school.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide their clients with training and insurance coverage as well as loans.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina trabaja con su esposo; tienen un taller de carpintería donde elaboran puertas, mesas y sillas de madera que comercializan en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus 6 hijos que están en los últimos años de la secundaria; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona de German Bush 1-1-2 en  la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (madera, cola, clavos, tornillos) para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Marina works with her husband. They have a carpentry workshop, where they produce doors, tables, and chairs from wood, which they sell in the 16 de Julio area in the city of El Alto. This activity provides them with income to provide for their 6 children, who are in their final years of secondary school. She has her own house, located in the German Bush1-1-2 area in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, such as wood, glue, nails, and screws, so that she is able to satisfy the demand that exists in the market. This is her second loan with Impro. She was able to get a second loan because she displayed good behavior in repayments with her first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, glue, nails, etc for her carpentry workshop

loans.name: Hann

texts.en: Mrs. Hann Y. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Men Sophorn, owns an electric cow for plowing, which has been hired out by other farmers. Now Mrs. Hann Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and she will use the rest of money to repair the electric cow. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is present on her right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to repair the electric cow.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria del Rosario se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser , tacos, pan con carne, Hotdog, tortillas con quesillo, yuca y refrescos, comienza a vender a las cinco de la tarde, tiene clientes fijos, que hacen sus pedidos via telefono y tambien vende en su casa ya que prepara ricos bocadillos, es amable y muy conocida en su colonia, lo cual le ayudado a tener buenas ventas
asi mismo con su negocio le ayudado a su esposo a salir adelante y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo quien trbaja en empresa privada, ella solicita el credito para poder invertir en materia prima como ser pollo, quesillo, queso, carnes rojas, aceite y otros, ya que compra a diario sus productos y
desea comprarlos al por mayor y obtener mejores ganancias, su meta a corto plazo es remodelar mas su cocina.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario sells food such as tacos, bread with meat filling, hotdogs, quesadillas, yucca (cassava) and soft drinks. She starts selling at 5:00 p.m. and has established customers who request orders by phone. She also sells from home, as she prepares delicious sandwiches and is friendly and well-known by local residents, who help her have good sales. In addition to her business, she helps her husband and receives support from her son, who works in a private enterprise. Maria del Rosario is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials such as chicken, cheese, red meat, and oil. She buys products daily and hopes to buy in bulk and generate better income. Her short-term goal is to remodel her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, beef, and pork, maize flour, tortillas, sauces, spices, condiments, soft drinks, juices, oil, vegetables, plates, glasses, forks, napkins, cheese, hotdog buns.

loans.name: Cledy Avelina

texts.es:
Cledy  es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Cledy es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Cledy junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal, los ladrillos los vende sin quemarlos, además en algunas épocas Cledy compra y vende tara y cochinilla.
Cledy necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido para labrar los ladrillos.
Los sueños de Cledy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Cledy is a member of the Orcasitas II community bank.

Cledy is 25 years old, married, and she has 2 children. Cledy, together with her husband, makes artisanal bricks. She sells the bricks without firing them. In addition, at times Cledy purchases and sells tara (a native Peruvian plant used to make leather tanning powder) and cochinilla (an insect used to make natural pigments).

Cledy needs a loan of 750 PEN, which will be be invested in making bricks.

Cledy’s dreams are to get ahead and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make bricks

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah T. is 35 years old and a married mother with two children. Her husband, Patrick, is a prison warden. Zipporah runs a retail shop in Shanzu where she sells different household items and foodstuff. She has been in the business for one year. She learned about KADET through a friend and she is now accessing her first loan. She plans to stock more foodstuff and to do some minor renovations to her shop.

In the future, Zipporah hopes to own a bigger, well stocked store. She also hopes to start selling her goods wholesale.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff and do some renovations to her shop

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara Q. is a 45-year-old mother who dreamed nothing more in life but to be able to send her three children whose age range is from 12 to 19 years old to college and be able to give them a degree to hold forever. She envisioned this achievement not without the support of her loving husband who is a farm laborer. Together with him, Clara will surmount mountains to be able to bring their children out of the umbrella of poverty. In a beautiful place of Belison, province of Antique Philippines, Clara lives together with her family. Her husband’s income is the family’s main source of living. However, is not enough to sustain the needs of her children especially in the next years wherein their eldest will be near to graduate from college which will require a lot of school projects and trainings. With that realization, Clara then joined ASHI in their village. She applied for a loan which she will going to use for vegetables buy and sell business. This way, her husband’s income will be augmented and family’s financials will be increased. Profits she will make out of her businesses will be her means for taking steps towards the fulfillment of her dreams.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase various vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Bryant

texts.en:
Bryant M. is from the village of Lumbayao, Valencia City. He is 33 years old. Bryant is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Bryant raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Bryant has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Bryant joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bryant has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Bryant is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Bryant from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding the business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon S., 28, is an internal administrator for an organization. He is married to Soy Sopha, age 28, who earns a living by selling and renting CDs to the villagers from her home. Her business can contribute $4.50 a day to their living expenses. The couple has one teenage child who attends school. Suon S. will use his loan to expand his wife's CD business. 

Note: Mrs. Soy Sopha appears in the photograph, because Mr. Suon S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To expand his wife's CD business

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel M. is 32 years old and married to Veronicah M.; they have three school-aged children.  He has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for one year now.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan after having repaid his first loan. He plans to stock more children's clothing, especially as this is the peak season for sales. 

His future dreams are to open a wholesale shop that will sell household goods and farming products.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B., 56, and her husband Rogelio, 54, have been farmers for ten years. They have two children; one is in college and the other is in high school. The family lives in a farming village in Balubad, Silang, Cavite.

They were lucky to have acquired a farm lot in Silang, Cavite where the soil is very suitable for farming and upon which they grow pineapples and bananas. Teresita says they earn more than Php 8,000.00 a month in net profits, especially when there are few storms.

Teresita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She loves the camaraderie of the women entrepreneurs in her group. Now on her eighth loan cycle, she is applying for a new loan in the amount of Php 9,000.00 which she will use to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and other farming supplies for the next pineapple season.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides and farming supplies.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol B. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el Congo en el departamento D. Santa Ana, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marisol se dedica a la venta ropa, la cual la comercializa D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad, ella va D. casa en casa ofreciendo su producto, siempre con la ilusión D. tener una venta muy buena en el día, ya que su mayor deseo es poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos y ayudarle a su esposo. Marisol solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa y así mismo poder aumentar la variedad D. estilos y colores, ya que ella confía en aumentar sus ventas si posee mayor cantidad D. prendas. Ella es una persona muy dedicada a su familia la cual desea con todo su corazón brindarles todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Marisol B. D. M. is 34 years old and a resident of Congo in the department of Santa Ana. She lives with her husband and two dependent children who are in school. Marisol sells clothing as a traveling vendor through the streets of Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She goes from house to house offering her products always with the hope of having a good sales day. Her greatest desire is to proviD. for all the needs of her children and to help her husband.

Marisol is requesting a loan to purchase a large quantity of clothing so that she can offer a variety of styles and colors, thereby increasing her sales. She is a person who is very dedicated to her family and desires with all her heart to give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

location.town: Congo en el departamento de Santa Ana

loans.name: Vandeth

texts.en:
Mrs Vandeth D. is 39 years old.  She lives in Run village in Takeo province and is married to Mr. Von Thy (right).  Their children who are all too young to work or study. 

Mrs Vandeth D. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband is a bread seller who can make a small income to support the family. Although they work hard, they still need to earn more income to support the family. Thus, Mrs Vandeth D. is asking a loan from AMK to buy cows and pigs, as well as food to support the new bread-selling business.

loans.use: To buy cows and pigs as well as food to support a new bread-selling business.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Bintou Toé  est âgée de 56 ans, mariée  et mère  de 4  enfants.  Elle  vit avec son mari et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle au quartier Sokala de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 10ème  année (du système éducatif Malien) elle mena plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente de jus de fruits, d’eau glacée etc. Finalement elle se lança dans la confection de sacs en nylon et des chaises en nylon après une année d’apprentissage qui  l’amena dans deux pays le Bénin et la Côte d’ivoire. Après cette phase d’apprentissage riche d’enseignements qui a fait d’elle aujourd’hui une femme aux mains de génie, elle jouit d’une grande réputation nationale et internationale. Elle reçoit des commandes de l’extérieur et ses clients sont principalement des touristes  étrangers qui adorent son œuvre.
Pour faire un sac, elle a besoin de 4 rouleaux de fil en nylon multicolore plus du bois rouge (bété). Ensuite elle tricote à l’aide d’un crochet métallique. La fabrication d’un sac peut prendre 2 jours.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de participer aux festivals sur le Niger du mois prochain, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 10 paquets de fil en nylon, 10 barres de fer pour chaises. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Madame   Bintou Toé  vend au comptant  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes (étrangers et nationaux).
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui servira de fonds de roulement et d’appui dans la prise en charges des dépenses du foyer. 
Son ambition est d’agrandir son atelier.
texts.en:
Ms. Bintou Toé is 56 years old, married, and the mother of four.  She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in the Sokala district of Ségou (4th  administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Having dropped out of school in the 10th year (of the education system of Mali), she worked at several revenue-generating businesses, such as selling fruit juices, ice water, etc.  In the end, she embarked on making nylon bags and nylon chairs after a one-year apprenticeship, which had lead her to two countries, Benin and Cote d'Ivoire.  After this apprenticing phase, rich with learning, which has produced in her a genius at handicraft, she enjoys a great reputation nationally and internationally.  She receives orders from abroad.
