And her customers are mainly foreign tourists, who love her work.  To make a bag, Bintou needs four rolls of multi-colored nylon string, plus some red wood (bété).  Then, she knits them using a metallic hook.  Making a bag can take two days.  Planning to increase her business capital, in order to take part in the festivals on the Niger next month, she turned toward micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan.  She intends to use this loan to buy ten packets of nylon string and ten iron bars for chairs.  She supplies herself locally.  She makes her sales in cash to customers composed of women and men (foreigners and nationals).  With this loan, Bintou envisions realizing a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA.  This profit will be used as operating funds and as support in covering household expenses.  Her ambition is to expand her workshop. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying string and iron bars

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.en: Yawaki K. sells beauty products in Lomé, Togo. She is single and does not have children. She began this business in 2004 and is asking for her first loan from WAGES to resupply her stock. Ms. K. will use this loan to purchase a variety of perfumes, shampoos, and hair gels to satisfy her customers’ demands. By helping Ms. K. beautify Togo, you will help her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Gilberto De Jesús

texts.es: Gilberto de Jesús F. de 47 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive únicamente en compañía de su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Gilberto posee un taller de reparación de bicicletas, así mismo vende repuestos y accesorios para estas. Él cuenta con la enorme ventaja de que su negocio esta ubicado sobre la carretera principal que conduce al municipio de Zapotitan, una calle muy transcurrida incluso por bicicletistas, los cuales disfrutan salir en grupo de amigos por las carreteras del país. Esto le trae muchas ventajas a Gilberto ya que se encuentra al paso de las personas, así mismo en su lugar de habitación posee muy buenas referencias por parte de las personas, debido a que cuenta con más de 12 años de dedicarse a este oficio lo cual lo ha hecho muy conocido por las personas, como alguien con mucha experiencia en su trabajo. Gilberto solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando más repuestos para bicicletas, así mismo herramientas para la reparación de estas. El taller de reparación es un negocio el cual le ha permitido a Gilberto seguir adelante ya que le suple todas las necesidades, es por ello desea hacerlo crecer de manera que pueda mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilberto de Jesús F., 47, lives in Ciudad Arce, La Libertad department. He lives just with his wife, who is a housewife. Gilberto has a bicycle repair shop and he also sells bicycle replacement parts and accessories. He has a huge advantage because his business is located along the main highway that leads to the city of Zapotitan, a very busy street even by cyclists, who enjoy going out along the country's roads in groups. This brings many advantages to Gilberto because he is located on their way and his neighbors recommend him because he has over 12 years experience in this type of work so he is very well-known as someone who is highly skilled. Gilberto is asking for funding so that he can have money to invest in his business; he wants to buy bicycle replacement parts and tools needed to repair bicycles. His repair shop has made it possible for Gilberto to move further in life because it has provided for his basic necessities. This is why he wants to help it grow so that he can improve his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycle replacement parts and tools.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha T., 44, and her husband, Mr. Phally Pheng, 45, have been married since 1986 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, one works in garment factory, and the others attend school. The family lives along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Chantha has been a rice farmer for 30 years, and her husband has been an ice-cream seller for seven years. Chantha doesn’t have the capital to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $300 to buy them.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Hellen J

texts.en:
Hellen is a 36-year-old woman, married and blessed with four children aged 15, 12, 9 and 6 years, respectively. She was introduced to KADET by an existing client. With this first loan, she intends to plow more land and plant more than the previous year, hence more yield. She also has a tea farm from which she earns additional income.

Her future plans are to plant more tea and buy dairy cows from which she will get more income to educate all her children and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 32 year old gentleman who is married with three children. He lives in the Kikuyu area in Nairobi which is an area of mixed businesses with a high population, most of whom are low-income earners.

Timothy operates a school which he has done for the last seven years. With this loan, he plans to pay examination fees for his students. His customers are mainly students from low-income-earning families who are within Kikuyu and its environs.

Timothy has never borrowed from other financial institutions before. In the future, he hopes to buy the premises that he currently rents.

loans.use: To pay examination fees for the students in his school

loans.name: Hojita Verde Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento HOJITA VERDE esta compuesta por 10 integrantes 8 mujeres y 2 varones, son personas responsables y trabajadoras que se conocen y s egarantizan entre ellos.

La Sra.MARIA tiene como actividad un agencia de cerveza en  su domiilio ubicado en la zona villa la Merced es un lugar comercial  tiene dos hijos a quienes aún mantiene y estudian en el colegio  de la misma zona, ella tambien vende cerveza en diferentes fiestas de la ciudad como entradas berbenas, campeonatos, etc su esposo es chofer de taxi, tambien presta servicio de amplificación para  diferentes acontecimientos sociales, fue elegida presidenta del banco por su responsabilidad y solidaridad, con el dinero del credito comprara refrescos para distribuir en su agencia.

El Sr. Freddy es contratista de construcción es el tesorero, el hace contratos de contrucción de viviendas en diferentes zonas de la cuidad de La Paz  tiene dos niños pequeños que aún no van a la escuela y los cuida su esposa que se queda en casa, por esta razon solo mantiene el hogar, con el dinero del  cedito comprara material de construccion para ampliar su casita. 

La Sra. Wilma  es la secretaria de actas ella se dedica a la confección de polleras en su domicilio ubicado en la zona de rossasani es un azona alejada de la ciudad donde aun no llega el servicio de transporte público ella tiene un niño de 2 años de edad  todas estas personas son responsables del credito que se da al banco de emprendimineto hojita verde  son personas responsables con deseos de superación en sus diferentes actividades.
texts.en:
The HOJITA VERDE community bank has 10 members, 8 women and 2 men, who are responsible and hard-working. They all know one another and each is willing to act as guarantor for the others. Sra. MARIA sells beer, a business that she operates from her house in a commercial area of the town of Merced. She has two children who live with her, both in local schools. She also sells beer at various events--dances, sports matches, etc.--in the town. Her husband drives a cab and helps her with the business when needed. Sra. Maria was elected to be president of the community bank because she is especially responsible and supportive of the others in the group. She will use the loan to supply her business. Sr. FREDDY is a building contractor and the group's treasurer. He works on house building projects around the city of La Paz. Freddy has two young children, not yet in school. His wife works at home and takes care of the children, so he is the sole provider for the family. He will use the loan to buy construction materials to enlarge his small house. Sra. WILMA is the group secretary. She makes and sells "polleras" (a traditional skirt) at her house in Rossasani, an area far from the city and not yet served by public transportation. Wilma has a 2 year old son. All the members are responsible for the loans extended by the bank to members of the Hojita Verde group and all hope to exceed at their different businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Afiwa A. sells diapers, children’s clothing, and other baby products. She is 39 years old and married to a teacher. They have three children.

Afiwa has been in this particular business selling baby items since 2009. She has requested her first loan from WAGES of 350,000 CFA. She plans to use half to purchase diapers and the other half to purchase children’s outfits.

loans.use: To purchase diapers and children's outfits

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 1  est issu de l’Association  de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, 5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
AWA D. va utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 1 group was created by the Married Women's Association of Toura Nabitokan village, in the San prefecture, Ségou region (fourth largest administrative region in Mali). These women live in traditional families, and on average are 34-year-old, have 5 children and farm peanuts. In the hope of making their farming profitable, the group's members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's lending program 3 years ago. They properly repaid their previous loans and are now requesting a third one. AWA D. will use her part of the loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seeds, small tools and fertilizer in the big Kimparana market. After winter, the crops are stored for some time until they gain value, after which they are sold in the Kimparana market and the surrounding markets, detail or wholesale, for cash, usually to client from the city. The BENKADI 1 group members plan on making a 35 000 FCFA profit each after the sale of their products and to use it to repay interests on the loan and their families usual expenses.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer, small tools and seeds

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa A.  est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, son époux et un agronome, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, son lieu d'approvisionnement est le grand marché de Lomé où ce commerce est très développé. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 3 prêts qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES un autre crédit pour l'achat de 10 pièces de pagnes hi target, 9 pièces de pagnes phoénix, 7 pièces de pagnes GTP, 3 pièces de pagnes holandaise.
texts.en:
Afiwa A. is married and the mother of 2 children. Her spouse is an agronomist. To generate income, she sells pagne (printed cotton) fabric. She has been in this business since 2000. She gets her supplies from Lomé’s general market where this commerce thrives. She has already received 3 loans from WAGES that she has repaid in full. She is requesting another loan from WAGES to purchase 10 units of “hi target” pagne cloth, 9 units of “phoénix” pagne cloth, 7 units of “GTP” pagne cloth and 3 units of “holandaise” pagne cloth.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase loincloths

loans.name: Liana

texts.es:
Liana es una madre de familia 22 de años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén un distrito agrícola de regular movimiento comercial ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, pertenece a la región La Libertad y se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes desde hace mas de un año, ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hacia el centro de la ciudad para adquirirlos, esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia ya que gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo, que es carpintero, con los gastos de la familia.

Liana desea ampliar su bodega comprando mas productos de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liana is a 22-year-old mother who lives with her family in the district of Chepén. It is an agricultural district with a regular flow of trade, located in the province of the same name. It belongs to the La Libertad region and lies one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked selling basic goods and groceries for more than a year. She has a small store located in her house, where she offers her customers all types of staple products. They would otherwise have to travel downtown to buy these items. This business is an important source of income for Liana's family, allowing her to help her husband, a carpenter, with the family's expenses. Liana wants to expand her inventory, buying more products so that she can increase her sales and earn more profits. To achieve this goal, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. She is a responsible and very hard-working woman, and her greatest desire is to get ahead so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to expand the store she operates in her home

loans.name: Mrs. But Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. But C. is the village bank president. She is 53 years old. She was selected by the 14 members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. They are all located in Prey Mul village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is a widow with six children. One of the children is a translator, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others attend school and help do the farming. Her problE. is that her children's work place is far away from her home. So to solve this problE., Mrs. But C. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her children's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en: Khayal I. is married and has a young son. He runs his own business selling food products. The monthly income of his shop is about $315 to $375. Khayal is also working as a school teacher but his salary is only about $100 a month.  This is why he started this business five years ago. Because of his experience he is able to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Khayal needs a loan of 800 AZN. He is going to spend the loan to purchase more dry goods to sell, which will increase his income and enable him to buy a cow.

loans.use: pruchase more goods to sell and buy one cow

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta O. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Julieta is married and has nine school-aged children. Julieta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kishwer's Group

texts.en:
Kishwer lives in the third largest city of Pakistan called Faisalabad. It is also known for its textile industry. She lives with her family in the area of Samanabad which is a housing colony in Faisalabad.  She is 39 years old, married to A. G., and has 4 children: three sons and a daughter.  Three of them are getting their education from a local school.  

In order to financially support the family, Kishwer’s eldest son left his education after completing 12th standard and started working. He has a job in a medicine companyna d is on a monthly wage. 

Her husband has business of selling spices. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and earns a good income. He not only sells spices through his shop but also supplies the spices to different grocery shops as well.   

Kishwer has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy spices such as red chilly powder, turmeric powder, salt etc in bulk quantity for increase his stock of spices for reselling. She is hopeful that her husband will be able to get positive results by investing this loan money into it. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  Note: “In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Kishwer”.

loans.use: To buy spices in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 59 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a preparar platos típicos, siendo su establecimiento en su casa que acondicionó para ser un restaurante. Es así que los fines de semana se intensifican las ventas de sus potajes, por otra parte, Lidia esta contenta por que sus clientes la buscan para que sea la encargada de elaborar bocaditos y demás platos para eventos sociales. Para ella el trabajo es muy gratificante, y más si sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio, ya que necesita de tiempo y dedicación al momento de preparar sus bocaditos. Para Lidia es una gran satisfacción dedicarse a lo que considera es su pasión, además las ganancias que percibe compensan su esfuerzo por lo que se ha propuesto para el futuro mejorar su cocina con mejores instrumentos. Es su noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, por ser una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes que son los ingredientes de sus platos típicos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 59 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  For 11 years she has worked making typical local foods in her home, which she set up as a restaurant.  Sales of her stews increase on the weekends, and Lidia is happy because her customers hire her to make appetizers and other dishes for social events.  The work is very gratifying for her, especially if her children help her, since it takes time and dedication to prepare her appetizers.  It is a great satisfaction for Lidia to work at what she considers her passion.  Her earnings also make it worth her effort, and for this reason her goal for the future is to improve her kitchen with better equipment.

This is Lidia's ninth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she is responsible about her payments.  She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are very close-knit.  She would also like to thank the people who made this loan possible because it will be very helpful to her in the growth of her business.  Lidia will use this loan to buy the ingredients for her meals.

loans.use: Purchase products to continue making stews

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren S., 23, lives with her husband and one child in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband's sibling owns livestock in the countryside. Batsuren and her family used to live a nomadic lifestyle in the countryside herding livestock. Her husband is currently unemployed and uses his own van to move his home from place to place. They currently live in her father's yard. Her three-year-old child is in kindergarten.

Batsuren started her own meat-trading business in 2007 and has gained significant experience. She is now planning to operate a clothing retail business. In the future she hopes to have her own business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a 1500000 MNT loan to import clothing from China in order to start her clothing retail business.

loans.use: To import clothing

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 59 años, es un hombre sabio y maduro. Hace 10 años que falleció su esposa y desde entonces vive con su hijo Moisés de 40 años, quien cuida de él y le ayuda a salir adelante, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Centro Huachirick (selva central peruana). Como buen hombre de campo, Víctor no descansa y, todas las mañanas como hace 30 años, se dirige a sus plantaciones de café, achiote, cacao y plátanos, los que cuida con mucho esmero pues todo este tiempo de sacrificios y esfuerzos le enseñaron que “cuando el alma de un hombre se siente dominado lo mejor es ¡trabajar! “.  Por eso  en todo este tiempo logró obtener 28 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que son el producto de su esfuerzo. En está etapa de su vida se siente satisfecho, ya que pudo sacar adelante a sus 9 hijos, los que ahora están en diferentes partes del país y asegura que no quiere nada más, solo espera seguir teniendo fuerzas para poder sembrar, ya que “eso es el motor de su vida”. Víctor, es el más alegre y entusiasta de su banco comunal y por ello incentiva a los integrantes a ser puntuales y responsables con MFP. Es el tercer crédito que tiene y se siente satisfecho por el éxito logrado. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener más plantas para su vivero de café, con ello podrá renovar muy pronto sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza podrá pagar a los peones para que le ayuden en la siembra.
texts.en:
Víctor is 59 years old.  He is a wise and mature man.  Víctor's wife died 10 years ago and since then he has been living with his 40 year-old son Moisés who looks after him and supports him in his own home which is located in the native community of Centro Huachirick (in the central Peruvian jungle).  As a good country man, Víctor never rests and every morning, as he has done for 30 years, he heads out to his coffee, annattoo, cacao and banana plantations which he tends with great care since all this time of sacrifices and effort has taught him that “when a man's soul feels dominated, the best thing to do is work!”  For this reason, over time he has managed to obtain 28 hectares of farming land which are the product of his efforts.

At this stage of his life, Víctor feels satisfied since he has managed to get his 9 children ahead in life.  Now his children are in different parts of the country and he assures us that he doesn't want anything else.  He only wants to continue having the strength to be able to sow his crops since “this is the engine of my life”.  Víctor is the happiest and most enthusiastic member of his community bank and, for this reason, he encourages the other members to be punctual and responsible with MFP.

This is Víctor's third loan and he feels satisfied with the success he has achieved.  He will use this loan to obtain more plants for his coffee nursery.  This will enable him to renew the crops in his fields very soon and, if the money reaches that far, he will be able to pay laborers to help him sow his crops

loans.use: To buy coffee plants and pay laborers to help him sow his crops

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is the father of three children from 2 to 16 years old. He does mixed farming in his hometown of Nkubu in North Rift, Kenya. He produces sunflowers, wheat, beans, maize, potatoes and peas, which he sells locally. He also plans to expand both his poultry and dairy farming by constructing a modern grazing unit. Unreliable rainfall and animal diseases are his major challenges.

Peter's first first loan of 45000 KES was paid back. For his second loan, he has requested 55000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank  and fertilizer. He hopes the tank will help him install an irrigation system in his farm to counter unreliable weather conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina V. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo, Isabela. She is 43 years-old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Gina joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn L. is from the village of Brgy. Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Annalyn owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Annalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Annalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Annalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia has applied loan for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother in law who will utilize it for buying spare parts and repairing tools for his bicycle repairing shop. 
She is very supportive lady in nature. She lives with her family in the area named Gondalanwala which is located in a city Gujranwala, Pakistan. Her husband’s name is M. M. and he is a blacksmith by profession.  Her father in law is also an earning person in her family. Although, his age is 70 years old but he is still very active. He is also a blacksmith by profession. 
Rafia is a mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Only 2 of them are managed to get education and others are free and don’t do anything.  
Rafia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself as a very responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.  
She is hopeful that her brother in law will make good use of loan money and will increase his income by expanding his business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rafia.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repairing tools for bicycle repairing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new fishing equipment

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old.  She is married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a fishing/fish vending business and a pig fattening business. She lives in Basay, Negros Oriental. 

Gemma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8000. 

Gemma is borrowing PHP 28000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Gemma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a thirty-one-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda with an ambition of educating his children up to university. He has been dealing in phone accessories for three years and the business is still booming. He has challenges of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers. Lawrence needs the loan to buy phones for resale.

loans.use: Buying phones for resale

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is an enterprising single woman with eight children living in her house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For twenty years she has been farming and with the income recieved she has been able to educate her children. She has challenges of labour and her plan is to venture into mechanised agriculture. Teopista needs the loan to grow onions.

loans.use: to grow  onions

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 56 years old and has 4 children who are between the ages of 16-21 years old. She sells goats and she has sold them for 19 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more goats and make more profits. With the profits she plans reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Haydee Suyapa

texts.es:
la sra. Haydee Suyapa C. M. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en barrio el centro de Ojo de Agua El Paraiso y se dedica  a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia PAOLA.
Doña Haydee cuenta con una buena clientela en su negocio ya que trata a sus clientes con amabilidad y los precios son un poco mas bajos que en los otros negocios.
Cabe mencionar que doña Haydee tiene una buena administración de su negocio, ya que de esto a vivido los últimos años.
Doña Haydee esta casada y a dado a luz a dos hermosas niñas, las que en la actualidad están cursando sus estudios primarios, sus hijas son lo que la animan a seguir adelante para poder brindarles un buen futuro.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haydee Suyapa Morazán, 42, lives in the Centro de Ojo de Agua neighborhood in El Paraíso.  She sells daily consumption items in a small grocery store she has installed in her home that’s called “Pulpería PAOLA.”

Haydee has a good clientele in her store because she treats her customers kindly and prices are a bit lower than in other stores.  It’s worth mentioning that Haydee runs her store well and has supported herself this way the last few years.

Haydee is married and has given birth to two beautiful daughters who are currently going to elementary school.  Her daughters motivate her to continue forward in order to give them a good future.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise at wholesale to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy milk, beans, coffee, bread, cookies, lard, sugar, rice, margarine, cereal, snacks, tomato sauce, eggs, wheat and corn flour, condiments, salt, candles, batteries, matches, juices, powdered soft drinks and soups.

loans.name: Ntonwa United And Credit Association Group

texts.en: Assad B. is the leader of Ntonwa United group in Kyenjojo. He is 50 years old and married with 15 children, out of which five are still in school. Assad has a carpentry workshop in the Ntonwa Trading Centre that he has owned for over seven years. He is able to generate 30,000 Ugandan shillings weekly. His customers are mostly home-use customers buying chairs, cupboards and so on that he makes. He is also involved in crop agriculture and cattle-keeping. Assad is hardworking and self-motivated and his dream is to have a financially growing business and a socially stable family. He needs a loan to be able to buy more timber for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es: Luis Felipe de 45 años, habita en el barrio de San Antonio. Él posee una pulpería la cual ha tenido durante mucho tiempo. Es un hombre trabajador que lucha día a día para salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito para tener la capacidad de comprar variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, golosinas, pan dulce, aceite, papel, detergentes y todo lo necesario para mantener surtida su pulpería y lograr incrementar sus ventas y así poder obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis Felipe is a 45-year-old man who lives in the San Antonio neighborhood. He has owned a general store for a long time. He is a hardworking man who struggles every day in order to get ahead and be able to improve his quality of life. This has propelled him to request a loan so that he can purchase a variety of products like rice, sugar, candy, sweet bread, cooking oil, paper, detergent, and everything he needs in order to maintain his store well-stocked and be able to boost sales. This way, he can obtain greater profits, which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, candy, sweet bread, cooking oil, paper, detergent, and other goods.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Durga. She is married and has one child, aged 9.  

In 2001, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Durga plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Djekafoton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFOTON 2 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées du village de DAKOURA de SAN, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargie, ont en moyenne 50 ans et au moins  6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe DJEKAFOTON 2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel de HAWA,  qui est assise en camisole blanche, avec un foulard rouge à la tête, sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de SAN ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe DJEKAFOTON 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 16000 à 67000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djekafoton 2 group consists of ten married women from the village of Dakoura, part of San in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families and are on average 50 years old with at least six children.

They grow peanuts. To make their farming profitable, members of the Djekafoton 2 group decided two years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, they are now on their second agricultural loan.

Hawa, who is sitting and wearing a white top and a red headscarf, will use her portion of the loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanuts for planting, as well as small farming equipment and agricultural inputs at the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in Kimparana and in surrounding markets, retail (often in bulk), in cash to customers usually from large cities.

After selling their agricultural products each member of the Djekafoton 2 group hopes to achieve profits between 16,000 and 67,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a married woman with two children. One of the children attends school and the other one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. Furaha dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lucenda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (convenience) store.  Lucenda is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lucenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Aprovechando la ubicación de su vivienda en el municipio de Concordia al suroeste de Antioquia y con el propósito de ayudarle a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar para ofrecerle una mejora calidad de vida a sus dos hijos, Adriana decidió crear su propio negocio, una tienda en la que además de ofrecer algunos productos de la canasta familiar vende gaseosas snaks y dulces. 

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un local reconocido en el municipio para ofrecerle una buena educación a sus hijos. 

Actualmente esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar un enfriador y algunos productos diferentes para ofrecer mayor variedad.
texts.en:
By taking advantage of her home in Concordia, in the southeast of Antioquia, Adriana decided to create her own business; a store where she sells groceries, snacks, and candy.  She wanted to help her husband pay the household expenses and offer a better quality of life to her children. 

Her dream is to convert her business into a well-known store around town, so that she can provider her children with a good education.

She currently needs a loan to buy a cooler and some different products to be able to offer a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and merchandise.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is 41 years old and married to Mary. They have six school-going children. He has practiced farming for five years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Johnny hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joy Ann

texts.en:
Joy Ann, aged 38, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is the mother of three children, the oldest is already working  while the youngest stays at home. She manages her household while operating the business. She is currently working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joy Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Joy Ann earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual items. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Joy Ann hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to provide the daily needs of her family and give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es casada y tiene 4 niños que dependen de ella, tiene 34 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad rica en historia y de hermosos paisajes. Ella se dedica a vender ropa de segunda mano para damas y niñas desde hace un año, ella vende su ropa fuera de su casa y los días jueves se va al tianguis de su localidad a vender, dice que sus vecinas y conocidas le venden la ropa para después ella venderla a sus clientas, también hace y vende servilletas artesanales bordadas por ella. Dice que desde muy pequeña su mama fue que le enseño hacer esas bonitas costuras y para tener un poco mas de ganancias las vende, ya que a veces no le alcanza con lo que le da su esposo para los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos es por eso que ella decidió ayudarle a través de la venta de ropa y las servilletas bordadas que ella hace. Doña Lupita como le dicen de cariño esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para hacer las servilletas como marquice, hilo, agujas, estambre de diferentes colores y la ropa usada que le venden. Doña Guadalupe esta muy agradecida con la financiera por el crédito que le harán por que así su negocio poco a poco crecerá y les podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guadalupe is married and has 4 dependent children. She is 34 years old and comes from a town that has beautiful scenary and is rich in history. She has been selling second-hand clothes for women and girls for a year. She sells the clothes out of her house and on Thursdays goes to the local flea market to sell. She says that friends and neighbours sell her their clothes which she then sells to her customers. She also makes and sells hand-embroidered napkins. She says that when she was very little her mother taught her how to sew these beautiful napkins. She sells them to make a little more money as sometimes the money her husband gives for the household expenses and the children isn't enough. This is why she decided to help him by selling clothes and the embroidered napkins she makes. Doña Lupita, as people fondly call her, is asking for a loan to buy material to make the napkins such as marquise, thread, needles, yarns of different colours and the used clothing she buys for resale. Doña Guadalupe is very grateful to the microfinance institution for the loan they are going to give her as it will allow her business to grow little by little and she will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell clothes and handcrafted embroidery

loans.name: Kabukokyero Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
An elated and buoyant Rosette has not stuck to any trifles and has played for safety the last two months as she brings diligence to bear in her Pub enterprise in Ntungamo. Her diligence, good rapport building, good service delivery, risk tolerant disposition and good decision-making have all been serving a useful purpose as she goes through the mill of running a business. On display at the happily married mother of four's Pub are a variety of both hard and soft alcoholic beverages. She has been riding high on some early flood of success on the basis of the fact that she has been able to meet the demands of her clients since she took root. From her recollection, she says she does not call to mind a single day when she ran short on drinks. The fact that she is eking out subsidiary income from her other business, for example food sales, has been pivotal. She reckons that she will use her profits to restock her Pub. Week in, week out, her gross sales returns are to the tune of Uganda shillings 100,000. She reckons she will be able to generate more income once she utilizes this Kiva loan efficiently.

Thus far, Rosette has weathered the early storms that have plagued her enterprise, albeit at a cost. The increasing rental charges have, to a big magnitude, played havoc with her business. She set forth in her business with capital from her food sales trade. Rosette intends to use her loan to purchase more alcoholic beverages to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic beverages to resell.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann, a 28-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she has a retail shop that sells clothing from Natasha & Avon. In this this business for six years, she recently became a member of HSPFI and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more clothing products from her suppliers.

In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing products from Natasha & Avon.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has almost 21 years of experience working in car electrical repairs. He works on a freelance basis serving customers whenever they face car damages. Today, he is asking to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new electrical tools and supplies to replace his used ones. He’s sure that with the new equipment he will be able to better serve his clients. In the future, he hopes to open his own car repair shop.

loans.use: to purchase new electrical tools and supplies

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
Nathalie est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de 2 enfants. 
Nathalie travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle prépare et vend des jus de fruit à toutes  les personnes désireuses dans le marché de  Gbossimé. Elle achète les produits de préparation de ses jus à Lomé. Elle travaille avec deux personnes.  
Nathalie a requis son premier  crédit  de WAGES afin d’acheter des aromes, du Bakin Powder, des saches et du bissap pour la préparation des jus. Elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour agrandir son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nathalie voudrait voir son activité prospérer. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit bien  s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nathalie, 44, is single and the mother of two children. She has been working as a small-scale retailer since 2006 preparing fruit juice and selling it to all comers in the market in Gbossimé. She buys the products used to prepare her juice in Lomé. She works with two persons. 

Nathalie has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy flavoring agents, baking powder, small bags, and "bissap" (dried hibiscus flowers) to prepare juices. She wants to use her extra profit to expand her little activity. 

In the coming years, Nathalie would like to see her business prosper. She says that with the profit she expects to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy products for juice-making.

loans.name: Nelvadis

texts.es: Nelvadis de 58 años de edad vive muy cerca al mar, con su cónyuge , discapacitado visual, tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 28 a 36 años y tiene un nieto a su cargo. En Puerto Colombia, municipio donde habita, se dedica a la preparación y venta de frituras; actividad a la que está dedicada desde sus 26 años de edad. En la actualidad sus principales clientes son las tiendas del municipio a quienes distribuye diariamente. Ella en su casa de madera, se levanta a las 2:00 a.m. para empezar su proceso productivo. Sus principales productos son las arepas,, carimañolas, y su especializad es la arepa de huevo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, el cual invertirá en la compra de una olla de aluminio, en la reparación de su molino eléctrico y en la compra de materias primas e insumos para la preparación de sus productos. Su inversión será exitosa porque realizará las compras de insumos en mayor cantidad y de contado, ahorrando por los descuentos que ofrecen por esta forma de comprar. Así mismo con sus herramientas listas sus tiempos de producción son mejores y esto impactará su respuesta a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener una casa en materiales de cemento y por eso se esmera trabajando y con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos logrará salir adelante y cumplir su meta de cambio habitacional.
texts.en:
Nelvadis is 58 years old and lives near the sea with her husband who is visually impaired. They have four children, who are between the ages of 28 and 36, and a grandson who is under their care. In Puerto Colombia, the town where she lives, Nelvadis has a business preparing and selling fried foods. She has been in this business since she was 26. At the moment, her main customers are the stores in town that receive daily deliveries. Nelvadis lives in a wooden house and wakes up at 2am to begin her work. Her main products are “arepas” (corn patties) and “carimañolas” (meat pies), with her specialty being “arepas” with eggs.

Nelvadis is currently applying for her first Kiva loan so that she can invest in the purchase of an aluminum pot, repairs to her electric grinder, and ingredients and supplies for preparing her dishes. This investment will be successful because her purchases will be made in bulk and paid with cash. She will save money because of the discounts offered to her for purchasing in this manner. By having these same supplies, her production time will improve so that she can respond more quickly to customer orders.

Her dream is to have a cement house, so she strives to work toward that goal. With the support of her husband and children, Nelvadis will be able to move forward and accomplish her goal of having a new house.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her electric grinder and to buy an aluminum pot, ingredients, and supplies for making her dishes.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 33 years old. She lives in Phu Man village. She is married and has one child who is going to school. 

She not only grows rice but also sells hats in the market. She has this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more hats to resell.

loans.use: to buy more hats to resell.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 37 years old and is married with two children. He has been energetically farming in the village where they are living for over 15 years. His farm produces almost 25,000 PHP with every cropping. His wife also sells vegetable for their additional income. They both work hard to give their children a good quality of life. 

Now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field. Ariel hopes to grow his business and harvest more rice to sell. He expects major changes in his family’s living standards. He appreciates ASKI and Kiva lenders services and is looking forward to a long-term relationship with them.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
San Isidro se llama el grupo formado por 11 mujeres D. Ciudad del Este, quienes se unieron con el objetivo D. ayudarse mutuamente, ya que ellas ven una gran ayuda en el grupo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, quienes desean poder ayudar a sus familias. 
Una D. ellas es la señora Estelvina, quien gracias a la venta D. joyas D. plata pueD. obtener los medios necesarios para ayudar a su familia y para cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Ella comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que siempre tiene buena variedad. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás joyas con las cuales podrá tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Isidro group was formed by eleven women from Ciudad del Este who met with the objective of helping each other, since they saw how a group could be a great help.  They are hardworking and enterprising women who want to help their families.  

One of them is Estelvina, who helps her family and covers the daily household expenses with her sale of silver jewelry.  She says she has good sales because she always has a good variety.

She is asking for this loan to purchase rings, bracelets, necklaces, and other jewelry so that she will have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase rings, bracelets, necklaces, and other jewelry.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак три года как кредитуется в нашей организацией. Ей 29 лет, она не замужем, живет со своими родителями. Продает на улице продукты питания и другие мелочи. На её прилавке можно найти конфеты, печенье, напитки и фрукты. Торгует она с 6 вечера до 11 ночи, так как она днем работает бухгалтером. Она копит деньги на однокомнатную квартиру и хочет переехать. Кроме ее родителей, с ними живут также ее брат с семьей. Муборак хочет увеличить запас товаров, так как под Новый год у нее намечается хорошая торговля, для чего просит кредит.
texts.en: Muborak has been obtaining financing from our organization for three years.  She is 29 years old, single and lives with her parents.  She sells food products and other small things on the street.  Candies, cookies, beverages and fruits can be found in her food stall.  Muborak sells from six in the evening to eleven at night because she works as an accountant during the day.  She is saving money for a one-room apartment and wants to move.  Besides her parents, Muborak's brother and his family also live with them. Muborak wants to increase her inventory of goods, as she expects to have high sales during the New Year holidays season.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase candies, cookies, beverages and fruits

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut continues to borrow from MUK to increase her pig business. After succeeding with the last loan, she feels confident to run this business. Her husband also fully supports this and he helps her to maintain the pigs. This loan will be used to purchase six new piglets and feed. All the profit from the business will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, él inicio hace dos años con una panadería, su padre le colabora mucho para la elaboración del pan, con este negocio ha ganado clientela y también ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración del pan, harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca, ya que estos materiales los debe mantener a diario para mejorar la producción del pan.
La aspiración de Oscar es atender mejor la demanda, mejorar sus productos y que su familia sienta su apoyo tanto económico como afectivo.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his wife and two children, who are 6 and 3 years of age. Two years ago he started a bakery. His father helps a great deal in bread making. With this business, he has attracted a clientele and earned an income for her family.

Currently Oscar is requesting a loan to buy basic supplies to make bread: flour, sugar, yeast and shortening, since he needs to have these materials on hand every day to improve his bread production.

Oscar’s goal is to better meet his customers’ demands, improve his products and for his family to feel his support, both economically and emotionally.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and shortening.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Mari a Isabel es una emprendedora  que su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es a una pulpería en el cual se le ha brindado financiamiento para invertir en el negocio y ella nos expresa que con financiamiento a aumentado su inventario y sus clientes de igual manera. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir nuevamente en la compra de capital trabajo como granos básicos, golosinas refrescos, pan, detergentes, entre otras productos.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is an entrepreneur.  She has a general store, and she has used a loan to invest in her business.  She tells us that with the loan she has increased her inventory and her customers.

She is currently requesting a loan to once again use it as working capital to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and other products.

loans.name: Las Cinco Rosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eufemia está casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó 3 años la educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos 5 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo como empleada y hasta el momento lleca 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra hilos de varios colores y así poder tener mas producción de tejidos, espera en el futuro tener más capital de trabajo. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la tejeduría, atención a tienda, y crianza de animales.

loans.use: Comprar hilo

loans.name: Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elisabeth âgée de 43 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elisabeth est mariée à un certain Olympe. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge.  Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Elisabeth  et son mari. Pour cette raison, Elisabeth vend du maïs à son domicile et par la technique de distribution depuis une vingtaine d’année. Elisabeth vend également du pain et des boules d’akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté); ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et du pain.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, meet Peter . He is a first born in a family of 5 children. He grew up at Mathare slums, Nairobi. He has 3 brothers and a sister. He was lucky to complete his high school even though his family was still strained. His parents are peasant farmers. His job doesn't fetch enough to support the family according to the current economy, hence makes life quite difficult for this young gentleman.
He joined Digital Divide Data (DDD) about 19 months ago and this has had a positive impact in his life. He is now able to contribute to his younger brother’s high school fees but not his university fee. Being a beneficiary to DDD’s work study program, he is confident that he will earn a University degree. With this, he requests 500 dollars to complete his first year schooling at Kenyatta University beginning his academic year in January 2016, taking a Bachelor  of Security Management & Police Studies.
Based on the lifestyle he grew in, he is very ambitious, optimistic and eager to put his mark in this country by fighting corruption and bridging the gap between the poor once he will have earned his first degree honour. Basically, travelling, doing a lot of reserch and making peace are his hobbies and is always appreciated for his mediation services when required.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR UNIVERSITY TUITION FEES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Anna would like to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, packs of laundry detergents and soft drinks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vic moves from door-to-door and house-to-house selling vegetables. The vegetables are mostly from her husband's farm. She does this to supplement the family income. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been educated in the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $650 buy more vegetables from other farmers in and around her locality for onward sale at the market.

loans.use: Expansion of business.

loans.name: Phanis

texts.en: Phanis has been in business since 2006.  She is a green grocer and gets her stock direct from the local farmers.  She also sells cereals.  She hasn’t undertaken any formal training and learned her business through doing.  She sells the cereals and shifts from one type of cereal to another according to the cereal in season.  Her business is really booming and through it she has been able to purchase a dairy cow.  She has also been able to support her husband in providing for the family’s needs. With a loan from PEMCI, She intents to increase her cereal stock and be able to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita sells children’s and baby clothes at the busy Angolenko market in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She also makes and sells baby bedding and blankets which gives her business a competitive edge over other clothing vendors.

Vita began selling in the mid 90’s when there was a boom in the market and people were earning good money. This enabled her to develop her business and establish a foundation for the future. Vita currently makes around 2500 Ukrainian Hrivna, or about $500, per month in profit. Her income is a big help to her and her husband and their son. She has requested a loan to increase her inventory of seasonal clothing.

loans.use: expand the inventory of her children's and baby clothes

loans.name: Munirahon

texts.ru: Мунирахон и ее муж(на фото её муж) занимаются выпечкой традиционного таджикского национального хлеба – лепешек. Их пекарня расположена в 50 километрах от места проживания. Мунирахон приезжает туда из дому, а ее муж постоянно проживает рядом с пекарней. Их рабочий день начинается рано утром, когда начинается замешивание теста. Уже к восьми часам утра покупатели могут купить у них горячие лепешки. Каждый месяц Мунирахон ездит за покупкой муки и дрожжей на оптовый рынок в областной центр г. Худжанд. Купленного сырья хватает на месяц работы. В Микроинвест она получила займ также для покупки муки. Новый займ она собирается получить, чтобы закупить муку, которая в последнее время очень подорожала в цене.

loans.use: For purchase of a flour

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a young entrepeneur with high hopes of achieving his goals. After finishing his secondary studies he moved out of his home and relocated in his countries´ capital, Lima. There he learned the artisan craft of sweater weaving and after a lot of hard work he saved enough money to purchase weaving machinery to start his own workshop.

Juan returned to his beautiful hometown to open the workshop and hire five collaborators. The workshop has a reputation for producing high quality sweaters and his professional staff has an important client base with many pending orders. He wishes to expand the workshop to improve the working conditions of his team and to be able to employ more collaborators thereby helping his community to reduce unemployment.

Through your generous loan, you can help Juan make an investment in raw materials to allow him to increase the production of sweaters. Once he increases production he will be able to save enough money to purchase an industrial weaving machine.

Let´s help this young entrepeneur turn his wishes into a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Juan es un joven emprendedor con muchos deseos de superación en mente, apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios se independizó y fue en busca de mejores oportunidades a la capital de su país, Lima, ciudad donde aprendió la bella labor artesana del tejido de chompas con el paso del tiempo y mucho esfuerzo ahorró y compró sus máquinas de tejer con el propósito de implementar su pequeño taller; entonces decidió retornar a su bella ciudad para emprender su pequeño viaje comercial, esta faena la desempeña junto a sus cinco trabajadores con sumo profesionalismo y acabados de excelente calidad, gracias a eso sus artículos son muy cotizados y valorados por sus clientes y mes a mes tiene gran cantidad de pedidos.El deseo de Juan es ampliar e implementar aún más su taller para brindarles un mejor espacio de trabajo a sus socios y emplear a más jóvenes con el propósito de colaborar a reducir la tasa de desocupación en su país. El dinero que puedan brindarle a través de su generoso aporte lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la producción de más chompas con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente y lograr adquirir su tan deseada máquina de tejer industrial.“Hagamos que este joven emprendedor cristalice sus deseos”

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food ingredients and further expand her business

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Mrs. Ese O. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City. She specializes in selling  smoked fish, a business she's been in since 2005. Ese is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more fish so she can service more customers. She is a LAPO member and a very hard worker dedicated to improving her children's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
S. Lola is 34 years old. She is the loving mother of 4 adorable girls, the elder is 14 and the younger is only 2 years old.

Lola and her husband live together with her husband’s parents. In order to help her husband support the large family, they started their own business. For the last 8 years, Lola has sold curtains. She has her own trading place in one of the local markets. Being a very friendly and polite person by nature, Lola obtained her clientele very quickly. The business is stable, and generates the main income for the family.

Now, Lola is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business. She needs additional funds to purchase new curtains to sell. With this purpose in mind, Lola is requesting 950.00 US Dollars. She has received loans from IMON several times, and has proved to be a reliable client. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

loans.use: Increase working capital and expand business through purchase of new goods to sell.

loans.name: Thi Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai, 38 years old, sells scrap metal and raises chickens and pigs at home. She has 3 school age children. Her income is 4-4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan with anyone, now she would like to apply for a loan of 150USD with Binh Minh because it required no credit and has a weekly repayment plan. She’d use the funds of the loan to invest in her livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mai, 38 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn và chăn nuôi lợn gà. Chị có ba con đều còn đang đi học. Thu nhập gia đình chị từ 50000-70000đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị thích vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị được vay lâu dài và chỉ phải trả góp hàng tuần với số tiền nhỏ. Vì vậy, chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám cho gà ăn.

loans.use: Buy feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Irene's Starehe Group

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 15,11, and 7 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages15,11 and 7 years old. Irene is a clothes seller (vintage and sheets) and started in 2005. Everyday she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales, cement sales, and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. sells tailoring materials. Her major challenge is the constant change in fashion. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She plans to open another shop close to her distant clients.

She is asking for additional capital to acquire for herself an additional shop for the sale of tailoring materials.

loans.use: This loan will be used for additional capital to acquire an additional shop for the sale of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr:
Mr F. Mawussi was born in 1980 in Lomé. He is married and the father of three children. He sells frozen foods by profession and opened a store for the sale of frozen products in Adétikopé, a village situated 16 Km (10 miles) from Lomé. In this village, the points of sale for this type of product are rare and Mr. F. Mawussi is the first person since 2004 to open this type of store in his village. He has already obtained one loan from the (microcredit group) WAGES and is now asking for his second loan. It will actually allow him to purchase 20 boxes of frozen fish and chickens.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur F. Mawussi est né en 1980 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il est frigoriste de profession et a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits congelés à Adétikopé un village situé à 16 Km de Lomé. Dans ce village les points de vente de ces genres de produits sont rares et monsieur F. Mawussi est la première personne a ouvert ce magasin dans sa localité depuis 2004. Il a une fois obtenu un prêts au près de WAGES et est a son second cycle. Le crédit qu’il sollicite actuellement lui permettra d’acheter 20 cartons de produits congelés (Poissons et poulets).

loans.use: Purchase 20 boxes of frozen foods

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena A. is married. She lives in Belaya Tserkov where she sells office supplies in a favourable downtown location. Yelena has been in business for 6 years, and she offers quality service that attracts many customers. Her current monthly income is about $1000. 

Yelena is looking for an express loan that will be paid back in two months. Additional merchandise purchased with this loan along with Yelena's good character and strong business skills will allow her to expand and strengthen her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies

loans.name: Mirzosho

texts.ru:
Mirzosho R. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 61 years old, married, and has 7 children. He has secondary education and is a truck driver by training. Mirzosho would like to purchase a milk cow for his family. Since milk and dairy products are costly, his family cannot afford to buy them. Nevertheless Mirzosho has small grandchildren that need milk products for their growth. For these reasons, he decided to obtain a loan for 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Мирзошо житель района Шахринав. Возраст 61 год, женат , имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее , по специальности шофер. Мирзошо хочет купить для семьи дойную корову .Так как покупать на рынке молоко и кисло-молочную продукцию его семья не может себе позволить. А у клиента есть маленькие внуки ,которым необходимо употреблять молоко.Поэтому Мирзошо решил взять кредит, сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow for a family

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda has been selling food in her cart for 9 years. Every night, starting at 7:30 p.m. until 11:30 p.m. she goes out to sell soups and meals outside of a mall.

The loans she has received have been invested in buying ingredients necessary to prepare the food she sells.

Bernarda and some friends would like to buy a commercial space to make a mini-market and offer their products. In addition, Bernarda would like to have a restaurant in a profitable area.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Bernarda vende comida en su carreta desde hace 9 años. Todas las noches, desde las 7.30 p.m. hasta las 11.30 p.m ella sale a vender sopas y comida afuera de un centro comercial.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en la compra de ingredientes que necesita para preparar la comida que vende.

Bernarda y unos amigos quisieran comprarse un local para hacer un mini-mercado y ofrecer sus productos. Asimismo, a Bernarda le gustaría tener un restaurante en una zona rentable.
