loans.use: buying ingredients necessary to prepare the food she offers  (Para la compra de ingredientes que necesita en la preparacion de la comida que ofrece.)

loans.name: Toeaso

texts.en:
Toeaso R. is 37 years old and married with three children. She has many years of experience selling pancakes, pork pies, ice cakes (sweet frozen treats) and other food items. She sells her products in her village and to the public six days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala (~$270 USD).

Toeaso has benefited from three previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. SPBD loans are Toeaso’s only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her foodstall and to help financially support her family. Her husband also helps out with her business.

loans.use: To improve her business status and to help financially support her family.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria tiene 32 años, es soltera, madre de Iris, una pequeñita de un añito de edad. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, trabajando en un primer momento para alguien más, hasta que desde hace un año, con todos sus ahorros logró poner su propia tiendita, alquilando un  pequeño local. Desde que comenzó con su propio negocio Candelaria ha trabajado desde muy tempranas horas para lograr los ingresos necesarios, cerrando a veces muy tarde, por la cantidad de clientela que se ha hecho frecuente a su negocio, es por eso que le gusta su trabajo, porque le permite crecer y tener esperanzas de un futuro mejor. La motivación de Candelaria es que su hija Iris tenga un futuro feliz. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su negocio con más productos y quiere hacerlo crecer mucho más, para en el futuro poder abrir una sucursal.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 32 years old. She is a single mother to Iris, a little baby girl of one year. For the past 6 yeasrs she has been running a convenience store, working at first for someone, but then last year thanks to all of the savings she was able to set up her own little store, renting a small space. Since she set up her own business, Candelaria works since the very early hours of the day to earn the income she needs. She closes down sometimes very late. She loves her work beause of the great number of returning clients and because it permits her to have and to form hope for a better future. Candelaria's motivation is to provide her daughter Iris with a happy future. With the loan that she is requesting she will invest the funds in her business to purchase more products. She wants to expand the business much more, so that in the future she might be able to start in a second location.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: Benigna tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Benigna trabaja desD. hace 29 años en la agricultura y la ganadería, es natural D. Huancayo y siempre ha estado en constante actividad, cultiva productos nativos D. su tierra, en cuanto a tubérculos y granos, D. los cuales ve las ganancias cuando es el tiempo D. la cosecha, ella sabe que se corre muchos riesgos, como por ejemplo la caída D. la helada que muchas veces ha cobrado perdidas en sus cosechas, por ello Benigna también se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, por lo que obtiene ganancias adicionales, tiene principalmente ovejas, es lo que más venD., para ello las cuida con mucho ahínco para que sus ventas sean  buenas, su principal punto D. venta es la feria ganadera D. Huancayo. Es la segunda vez que Benigna solicita un préstamo con MFP, es una D. las clientas que D. su grupo cumple puntualmente con sus pagos, por lo cual se la ha considerado ser parte D. la renovación D. crédito. Solicita este préstamo con el cual podrá adquirir ovejas y también sacos D. abono para sembrar papa en una D. sus tierras D. cultivo (serán 2 sacos D. abono y una oveja aproximadamente).
texts.en:
Benigna is 57 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. Benigna has worked in agriculture and livestock farming since the age of 29. She is a native of Huancayo and has always been working. She cultivates products that are native to the land, including tubers and grains, from which she earns a lot at harvest time. She knows that she is taking many risks; for example, frost has led to losses in her harvest many times. Because of this, Benigna also buys and sells animals, for which she gets additional earnings. She mostly has sheep because they sell well. As a result, she takes care of them enthusiastically so that her sales will be good. She mostly sells her goods at the cattle fair in Huancayo. This is the second time that Benigna is asking for a loan from MFP. She is one of the clients from her group that complied punctually with her payments. Because of this, she was considered for another loan. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy sheep and sacks of fertilizer to plant potatoes on one of her plots of land (there will be approximately 2 sacks of fertilizer and one sheep).

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and to increase her quantity of sheep

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Near the seashore of Becor Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Mrs. Flora A. resides. She is 61 years old, a widow, and blessed with 7 children. Six are already married and one is still single. Her husband died last December 9, 2005, and she is now living as a single parent.
 
After the tragedy, Flora never stopped finding ways to inspire herself and find to generate a daily income by managing her little Sari-sari Store.      

She applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative 5 years ago, and she admires the programs and services being offered and other benefits like continuous education, insurance and dividends to the members.

Paglaum MPC is her partner in business. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00, as additional capital to her business to purchase additional grocery stock to sell in her Sari-sari store.

What she plans now is to renovate her little Sari-sari store and leave a comfortable life through God’s will.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery stock to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhon Khourn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people in Knong Preaek village in Kandal province form this village bank and Mrs. Sokhon K. is the village bank president. She buys vegetable to re-sell in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the famiL.'s living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Ruos Kuoch, is a healer in the local village. Mrs. Sokhon K. is 32 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A. sells cakes and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Marcelina is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. They have one child who attends school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es: La señora Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, además de ser madre soltera de un joven ,que día a día le demuestra que hay que luchar y esforzarse para salir adelante. Ella labora para una institución de seguridad social con una antigüedad de 20 años. Poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, pero ahora tiene el proyecto de construir una barda para mayor protección de su hijo y de su hogar es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman and the single mother of one son for whom, day by day, she demonstrates that one must fight and make an effort to get ahead. She has worked for a social security institution for 20 years. Little by little, she has made improvements to her home. Currently, she has a project to build a wall to better protect her son and her house. It is for this reason that she requests this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es: Katerin es una joven alegre y muy querida por sus vecinos, a sus 20 años vive sola en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Tiene una pequeña librería en el centro de la ciudad de Juliaca, vende cuadernos, lapiceros, plumones, y todo tipo de útiles de escritorio. Ahora se encuentra vendiendo lo último en útiles escolares, ya que quiere aprovechar el inicio de clases en los distintos centros educativos de la ciudad. Para Katerin lo más difícil de su trabajo, es saber qué producto se venderá más para comprar de ese, pero aun así disfruta mucho de ofrecer a sus clientes las cosas que tiene en su librería. Tiene ya 4 años en esta actividad y anhela ver crecer su librería y que se vuelva la principal de su barrio, ya que así podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cambiar su vida para bien. Es el tercer préstamo de Katerin con MFP, ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita planea implementar mejor su librería, para así tener más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Katerin is a cheerful girl, very well liked by all those who know her. She is 20 years old and lives alone in a house that she inherited from her parents. She is a very active participant in her Communal Bank and has a great desire to succeed in life. She owns a small stationers in the center of Juliaca city, selling notebooks, pens, markers, and all kinds of stationary. Currently, she is taking advantage of the fact that the beginning of the school year is approaching for most of the city's schools, and selling all the best kinds of school supplies. For Katerin, the hardest part about her work is always having to know what products will be the most popular so that she can stock them in her store; but she does not truly mind because she really enjoys pleasing her clients. She has been running the store for 4 years now and dreams of seeing it grow until it becomes the best in the neighbourhood - it would increase her income and change her life for the better. This is Katerin's third loan from MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments and expects to be just as punctual this time. With the 2,000 soles that she will receive, she plans to improve her store's set up, so that she can increase the range of goods that she can offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Jessrell

texts.en:
Jessrell R. is a native of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, and a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.  Jessrell is happily married to Rolando who also hails from Calamba.  They were blessed with two children, both of whom are still in elementary school.

Jessrell is now on her second loan cycle, using the PHP5,000 loaned to her to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other related materials for her piggery/hog fattening project.  Her goal is to increase her income so she can buy 10 hogs. Jessrell hopes to maintain or improve her project so she will have enough income to support her family and ultimately help all her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim V., 39, has been a local farmer for years. Besides his farm work, he catches fishes in and around Tunle Sap Lake for his wife to sell at the market. V. is married with six children, one of whom is married and lives separately. To help meet with the family's daily expenses, one of V.'s sons works as a construction worker.

Mr. V. is looking for a loan to buy a pump to irrigate his crops and proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a boat machine for his fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate his crops

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is already 48 years old and married to Florante M., a construction worker in INC Construction Company in Tuguegarao City. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest is Lacer, who is 29 years old, and operates a passenger tricycle in Cauayan City. Next is Roan who is 24 years old and finished a two-year computer course; she is now employed as a clerk in INC Company. Third is Nova, who is 20 years old and a graduate of BS Entrepreneur; she is currently looking for a job because she is just a fresh graduate. Harriet, the youngest, is 18 years old and just graduated from high school. Two of them are already married and have their own family. Annie hopes to see her youngest child finish a four year course someday. 

Annie has been selling frozen meat products and preserved foods since 1996. This has been one of their main sources of income since she bought her refrigerator. She wants to take a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to have additional working capital to buy more products like longganisa, hotdog, tocino, etc. She retails her meat products house to house in their village. Annie dreams of increasing her savings to be able to purchase a tricycle that will be used in selling her meat products and in roaming into other villages to make more income. She also hopes that her youngest child will be able to pursue his studies in college this coming enrollment. Annie believes that through her sacrifice and patience in working and with strong faith with God, all her goals will be attained someday.

loans.use: To buy more meat products

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA M. est une jeune femme née en 1977 à thies;elle est mariée et vit avec son époux au quartier som ,après les travaux ménagers elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers qu'elle a démarré depuis 2005 sur fonds propres,elle s'approvisionne en gambie presque tous les deux mois en fonction de la commande de ses clients
texts.en:
Coumba M. is a young woman who was born in 1977 in Thies. She is married and lives with her husband in the Som neighborhood. When she has finished her household duties, she works as a petty trader selling diverse merchandise, a business she began in 2005 using her own funds. She goes to Gambia every two months or so to stock up, according to the orders of her clients.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her working capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị N. is a 35 year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source comes from making and selling iron products to local businesses and community members. Nguyễn Thị has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 2005, Nguyễn Thị joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Nguyễn Thị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND to expand her business. The loan will be her fifth from TYM Fund. Nguyễn Thị plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  sept femmes du groupe Benkadi  2 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Bèssana un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  une moyenne d’age de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Ces femmes ont travaillé avec Soro Yiriwaso  l’institution de microfinance dans le prêt  solidaire commerçant dont elles ont fait plusieurs cycles et tous ont été bien remboursés. Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité car paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne dont les  deux précédents ont été bien  remboursés.
Ce prêt servira à assurer, les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles cultivent  une surface de 6 hectares  avec comme spéculations l’arachide et de riz.
Ces femmes espèrent avoir une  production moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit 18 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée et l’autre stockée puis vendue dans les différentes foires des villages de Fakola et environs, au comptant et surtout aux revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Le bénéfice  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du  prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux  de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Benkadi 2 group are all married and live in Bèssana, a village in the Fakola subprefecture, part of the Kolondièba prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They average 38 years of age and 5 children, and live in polygamous families. They got acquainted through bonds of kinship and neighborhood. These women benefited from several business loans from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, and all loans were repaid without problems. They are now seeking their third farming loan, a category matching their businesses, and the previous two loans were repaid without problems.

This loan will be used to pay for the cost of tillage, hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. They cultivate an area of 6 hectares, and grow peanuts and rice. These women hope to achieve an average yield of 3 tons per hectare, for a total of 18 tons. Part of the harvest will be eaten, and the remainder will be firstly stored, and then resold for cash at the fairs in Fakola and in the surrounding villages, mostly to resellers coming from the larger cities. The profits will be used to repay the loan, to pay for the school and health expenses of the children, and to buy trousseaus for the daughters.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the cost of tillage, hoeing, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He makes a living selling flowers. Mazen has applied for a loan of 2,100 USD, which he will use to grow more flowers to sell to his customers. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To grow more flowers to sell

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La señora Benigna es cliente antigua. La actividad economica que realiza es la atencion diaria de la tienda de barrio que esta ubicada casi al frente de su domicilio en la cual expende viveres, conservas, golosinas, lacteos y fruta.  Los dias viernes y sabados vende fruta de temporada en el Mercado Rodriguez.  Ella vive en la casa de su suegra con sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la atencion de la tienda. La señora Benigna invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de viveres(arroz, fideo y azucar) por mayor ademas tambien comprara fruta para surtir el puesto que tienen elmmercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Benigna is a longtime client. Every day, she runs a neighborhood store located in front of her home where she sells groceries, preserves, candy, dairy products and fruit. On Fridays and Saturdays, she sells seasonal fruit at the Rodriguez Market. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her children, who also help tend the store.

Sra. Benigna will use her loan to buy groceries (rice, noodles and sugar) wholesale. At the same time, she will also acquire fruit so that she can restock her stand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & inventory for her fruit stand

loans.name: Vasya

texts.en:
Vasya is married. He is a small entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, where he owns a business selling fishing supplies in the local wholesale market. He started this business because he loves fishing and is an experienced fisherman himself. Vasya’s merchandise is unique in the marketplace where he works, which draws many customers to his vending kiosk. Low competition and lending assistance have helped Vasya’s business develop and keep a stable standing. In the last four years his enterprise grew to 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory, 15,000 Grivnyas in gross income and 6,000 Grivnyas in net profit each month.  

Vasya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital and sales as a result. One of the most outstanding characteristics of his venture is its stability and consistent growth. We believe this current loan will help Vasya keep his business running and extend it even further. One of Vasya’s future goals is to open one more vending kiosk.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: God With Group

texts.en:
God With Them is a group of 5 borrowers led by Bandu K., 32 years old, married, with 4 children aged 8-14 years old; their educational levels 1st-7th grade. Bandu is a high school graduate but because of lack of support, she couldn’t go to university. She lives in the Saye town community. It is north of Monrovia, Liberia, and it is a very crowded and poor community that got shattered by the civil war.

Bandu’s business is to sell prepared food. She buys food items like rice, oil, seasoning, pepper, and other ingredients, cook and sells per plate to the residents of Saye town.

She started this business with funds she borrowed and been running this business for 1 year. Bandu prepares her food nicely in order to maintain her clientele and get more customers. She wants the loan to purchase more food ingredients and items to serve her customers and acquire more profit.

Bandu wants to grow her food preparation business to owning a big restaurant in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Bandu dreams of herself and her entire family living in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients and items to serve her customers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a vegetable vendor in her village and her weekly net income is PHP 450. She decided to obtain a loan from Kiva lenders that will be used as business capital with the hope that her income will increase. She plans to expand her business at Alicia public market, to earn more income and to purchase many vegetables that she can sell.

Cristina is 37 years old and married to Jose, a councilor in their village and also working as a farmer and a tricycle driver. They are blessed with five children: Lorie Grace - 14 years old, in 1st year high school; Wilce Joy - 13 years old, in grade 5; Melvin - 10 years old, in grade 4; Severino - 9 years old, in grade 2; and Cee Jay - 6 years old, in grade 1. They live at Salay, Angadanan, Isabela. Cristina said: “We should keep the faith from God above.”

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Shonhor

texts.en: E. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. Her daughter and son both attend a local high school while E. and her husband operate a shoe business. She began her business in 1994 after purchasing a sewing machine from her former employer. Today, she makes between 30 and 100 pairs of shoes per month, depending on the season. E.’s working capital is now between 2,000,000 and 3,000,000 tugrugs per month with a net profit between 400,000 and 500,000 tugrugs per month. She attributes her business success to both her excellent sewing and accounting skills. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue for her business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue for her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., age 29, is single and lives with her sister. To make a living, she designs and sews clothes. She earns US $10.00 per day. Her income is the primary source of funds for her family. The family is also assisted by her sister, a hairdresser who earns US $4.00 per day. S. and her sister are seeking to improve their businesses and standard of living. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase fabric to design more clothes to sell to her new and existing customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her clothing design business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She works long hours to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family. She has been in this business since 2003. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun K., age 40, has been married to Mr. Khoeun Khen, age 42, since 1990. They have six children, four sons and two daughters. Two of the children are married and live in their own homes, three children attend school, and the youngest one is still stays at home. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Thoeun has borrowed from Kiva through MAXIMA once before. 

Mrs. Thoeun and her husband are farmers. They grow rice and lotus fruit on their farm and sell them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her two married children are garment factory workers. Every day they must travel to and from work, which is expensive, because they do not have their own transportation. Therefore, Thoeun is requesting her second loan of $800 to help her children buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to ride to work.

loans.name: Roger Alejandro

texts.es:
A sus 45 años de edad el Sr. Roger Alejandro D.  es una persona responsable que junto con su esposa han sacado adelante a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Se dedica al negocio de venta de leche agria con tortilla desde hace 8 años  en el barrio Tierra prometida ubicado en la ciudad de Managua.
Desde que inicio el negocio se a caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y muy esforzada ya que inicio vendiendo ambulante en la terminal de buses del mercado Israel lewite, una de las necesidades que atraviesa el Sr. Roger es la urgencia de obtener dinero para la compra de leche de vaca y termos para el negocio y es por eso que acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita comprar productos para el negocio todo esto para comercializarlo  con el fin de obtener utilidades para mantener su hogar .
Es necesario mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha brindado créditos ha venido mejorando su situación económica ya que al incrementar el producto han incrementado sus ventas por lo que ahora cuenta con 20 vendedores  que sacan a vender el producto.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Alejandro D. is a very responsible person. He, together with his wife, has provided for their two school-aged children. He has been selling milk and tortillas for the past 8 years in the Tierre Prometida district in the city of Managua.

Since he started his business he has been known for his very responsible ways and for his hard work. He started out selling in the bus terminal of the Israle Iewite market. One of the needs that Mr. D. current sees is a supply of funds to purchase milk and thermos containers for his business. For this reason he has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan. It will permit him to purchase products for his business and to sell in order to support his household.

It is important to mention that since Ceprodel has been granting him loans, he indicates, his sales have improved his financial siutation and he has been able to increase the volume of his sales. Currently he employs 20 individuals that help him sell the product.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk and thermos containers.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth E. is 45. She is a widow with two children; one is a student and one is 3 years old. They live in Soumbour village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot where she cultivates rice. With her rice yield, she sells some for an income. Aside from this farming, she is a laborer who sells for a pig seller. In her rice farming, she now faces a problE. because her field has infertile soil, which affects  her crop. To solve this problE., she needs a loan to buy fertilizers and she will use some of the loan to buy fuel and rice seeds, and  the rest to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fuel and rice seeds

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en: Muharram is a lovely 27-year-old woman who lives with her three children. She runs a small fabrics-selling business where she offers at the market a variety of types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Muharram is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits. Muharram’s dreams are to have her own large store one day but most importantly, to enable her children to have a better future, once they start to study at school, then university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Muharram and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support! More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth Okumu M. is 24 years old and comes from Nyalenda in Kisumu city. He is married to Josephine Okidi and they have one daughter who is six years old. He is currently running a butchery business which is located in a village shopping centre. His clients mainly consist of neighboring hotel owners and local tenders from the schools around.

Kenneth is not new to Kadet though he has managed to service his previous loan well and has a good credit history. He hopes to get a lender to fund his second loan through Kadet Limited which will enable him to purchase some bulls which he intends to rear. This is so that he can avoid purchasing bulls for slaughter and already slaughtered meat to sell. This will increase his meat supply and profit.

His dream is to become the leading supplier of meat in Nyalenda town where his butchery is located. He also hopes to educate his daughter in a high-performing school as well as improve the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Buying some bulls to rear for slaughter

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab learned her hairdressing and beauty salon skills in a beauty academy. Upon graduation, she opened a small beauty salon to begin her new career and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She started with a small business operation, concerned that she was new in the market. Today, Zainab is asking to borrow $1,000 to modify and enlarge her shop to receive more clients because she's planning to have a bigger and improved salon and to be known in this field in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To modify and enlarge her shop

loans.name: Panca Kerti 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan W. is a 55 year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Jembrana, Bali. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Panca Kerti 2 (MUK-0009).

Ni Wayan is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business selling religious items, primarily selling flowers and other votive offerings to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Wayan joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials. The loan will be her 1st from MUK.

Ni Wayan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


Note to Kiva Lenders:  
This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender.

This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.
 
To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.


***************************************************** 
NI WAYAN W. (0) merupakan 55 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA-JEMBRANA-BALI. NI WAYAN adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 3 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah PANCA KERTI 2 (MUK-0009).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual bunga & persembahan nazar lainnya kepada wisatawan dan anggota masyarakat setempat. NI WAYAN sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI WAYAN menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR. Dalam 2007, NI WAYAN bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI WAYAN meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials

loans.name: Shavkatdjon

texts.ru: Джураев Шавкатджон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование средне- специальное "Бухгалтер". По специальности работал 5 лет. Кроме того занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Shavkatdjon D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a secondary-specialized education as an accountant. Shavkatdjon spent 5 years working in that field. He is also involved in retail sales. He has a store, where he sells food products. Shavkatdjon has been involved in this business for 3 years. He is requesting the loan in order to expand the merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding merchandise selection

loans.name: Alice Auma

texts.en:
Alice O. is 42 years old and married to Elly O., a businessman. They live in Kisumu town and have five children, three boys and two girls.

Alice runs a wholesale trade in accessories and electronics at a bus terminus in Kisumu town. This is the first loan she has accessed through KADET to which she was introduced by a friend who is an existing KADET client. She wants to use the loan to buy more accessories and electronic parts to add to her stock. Her clients mainly consist of hawkers at the bus terminus (who sell items as they move from one place to another) and retail shops around Kisumu town.

She hopes to expand her business and open other shops and thus create job opportunities for the unemployed.

loans.use: To increase her stock of electronic parts and accessories

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, is forty-eight years old and married. He lives in Kangemi area, a Nairobi suburb. It is an area of mixed businesses with a high population; most of the residents are low-income earners. He owns rental houses and also does water supplies in the area. He has done this for the last five years. With this loan, he plans to finish constructing his rental houses. His customers for water supplies are Kangemi residents and offices in the area. He has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, he hopes to diversify his business and build more rental houses.

loans.use: Stephen wants the loan to complete construction of rental houses

loans.name: Blanca Marleny

texts.es: Blanca Marleny V. R. de 34 años de edad, reside en Ilopango junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 8 años de edad. Blanca trabaja vendiendo diversidad de ropa para hombres, niños, y mujeres, la cual la comercializa por las calles, en donde se turna para poder ir a diferentes lugares como: Cojutepeque, Ilopango y Soyapango, lugares en los cuales el comercio es muy bueno, así mismo lugares en los cuales sabe que puede vender más ya que estos tipos de ventas  son muy pocas en estos sectores como pueblos y cantones lo que le permite vender más. Pero para poder seguir trabajando de esta manera, ella necesita poder contar con capital de trabajo para incrementar la cantidad de ropa que posee, comprando por mayor para obtenerla a precios más bajos y de esta manera vender más barato. Blanca solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda llevar a cabo lo antes mencionado y de esta manera abarcar más sectores en los cuales puedan vender más. De esta manera ella espera poder aportar más para el hogar y obtener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Marleny V. R. is 34 years old and resides in Ilopango with her family, which consists of her husband and two children (ages 9 and 8). She sells a variety of clothing for men, children, and women as a street vendor. She also travels to different places such as Cojutepeque, Ilopango, and Soyapango where business is very good. Blanca goes to these places because she generates fewer sales whenever she travels to villages and cantons.

In order to continue working, she needs additional operating capital to increase the amount of clothing she has on hand. She wants to buy in bulk so that she can obtain lower prices and sell her products cheaper. Blanca is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can carry out her plan and travel to more areas to generate higher sales. In this manner, she hopes to earn more income for her household and have better financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Teresa V. quien desde hace cuatro años vende refrescos, gaseosa y helados actualmente desea incursionar en la venta de comida con el fin de diversificar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Arelis de los Ángeles G. Martínez   quien vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace cuatro años y María Esperanza C. quien realiza enchiladas y tajaditas. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para que este crezca.
texts.en:
The Esther group is made up of three hard-working women. One of these women is Teresa V., who has sold soft drinks, lemonade and ice cream for four years. Now, she wants to enter into food sales, with the goal of diversifying and expanding her business. Her fellow group members are Arelis G. Martinez, who has sold cosmetics and clothing for four years, and Maria Esperanza Serrato, who makes enchiladas and tajaditas (fried plantain slices) They will invest this loan in their businesses so that they will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic items: meat, ingredients

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a dairy farmer in Nyamira town in Western Kenya. She is 46 years old and married with five children between the ages of 14 and 27. Two of her children are still attending school.

Norah has been practicing mixed farming for twenty-one years with only one employee. Her main products are milk and tea which she sells to the local market. She is also running a business in the same area. Her biggest challenges in farming are animal diseases which affect her dairy cows.

Norah has requested this Kes 45,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's living standard.

In future, Norah would like to purchase more dairy cows to increase her productivity. She is happy with the services rendered and would like to continue being a member.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius S. M. is a married man with three children. One attends school, while the others  are still too young for school. Julius owns a house with no electricity or piped water. He has been operating his carpentry business for the last six years and sells in a shop to social services workers and teachers. He operates a motorcycle business as his other source of livelihood.

Julius is asking for a loan of Kshs 40,000  to purchase twenty pieces of timber.  He faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation and seasonality. Julius hopes that someday he will have an electric planing machine.

loans.use: To purchase twenty pieces of timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get the plowing done and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma G. is from the town of Leon B. Postigo. She is 52 years old and is married with six children. Three of them are already married while the other three are still in school. Norma works in someone else's business operating a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Elenly

texts.en:
Ms. Elenly B. is from the village of Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years of age and still single. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a mini-grocery store business, RTW (GTY) ready-to-wear sales, and a rice retailing business. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 5 months already and earns approximately Php 7,000 a month from this business activity.

Just this year, Elenly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program Elenly is requesting a loan amount of Php 10,000 as her 1st loan to be used as additional capital for her existing mini-grocery store, and her RTW and rice retailing activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion. 
	
About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mini-groceriy store, etc.

loans.name: Tibui

texts.en:
R. was married to a polygamist and has four children. Due to matrimonial problems, she is now separated from her husband. She decided to join GHAPE in 2007 because she was unable to provide food and medication to the family. Also, she was unable to have enough capital to continue her seamstress work. She took her first loan and invested it in her tailoring workshop and also did some farming which raised her income and helped her to provide for her family.

R. has successfully managed and repaid two loans. She plans on using her third loan to invest in the buying of cloth to make dresses, pig feed, and to buy fertilizer for the farming of vegetables.

She believes that her loan will help her succeed because she has obtained knowledge from GHAPE on business management. Also, vegetables are highly consumed by many people in her community, especially during ceremonies.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of cloth, fertilizer for the farming of vegetables

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa B. is single and lives the town of Prk. Malipayon, Brgy. Binicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store.  

Adelfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of sixteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelfa has been achieving her goal of lifting her family out of poverty, and doing it by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 25,000, which meant major improvements in her family's lifestyle.  

Adelfa has applied for her 17th loan, for PHP 22,500, which she intends to use to buy more items to sell to her customers. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional electronic cellular phone loads for e-loading station and new mobile phone units and accessories to use

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 31 años, tiene una ferretería, , vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para ayuda con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a gastar sus ahorros en herramientas y venderlos a los vecinos del sector donde vive, poco a poco  con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo tener su propia “ferretería” lugar donde hay toda clase de herramientas y materiales de construcción. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 04h00pm de lunes a sábado. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y tubos para su ferretería y así tener mas variedad para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener otra ferretería y asi tener varias tienda de herramientas.
texts.en:
Flor is 31 years old. She has a hardware store. She lives in Primavera de Duran (a zone on the outskirts of Guayaquil, where the ecology is in dissolution).

To help with family expenses, she began to spend her savings on tools and sell them to neighbors in the sector where she lives. Little by little, with effort and dedication, she managed to have her own hardware store, a place where there is every kind of tool and construction material. She now works from 8 am to 4 pm from Monday to Saturday.

With the loan, she wants to buy tools and pipes for her hardware store and thus have greater variety for her customers. In the future, she wants to have another hardware store and thus have a variety of stores.

loans.use: Buy tools and pipes for her hardware store.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela S. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Marcela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marcela owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables like string beans and others for sale. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marcela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Marcela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is in the flower business. She raises flowers in a greenhouse and then sells them at the market. She has been in this business for ten years. She enjoys her flower business very much. The many repeat clients who buy flowers from Lubov every year are the key to her successful business.

Lubov is a hard working person. She would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to increase her assortment of flowers. She hopes to increase her profit and improve her living conditions. Lubov lives with her husband in a private house.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of flowers

loans.name: Russell

texts.en: Russell is 40 years-old and married. He has been in business for three years. His business "Green Rainbow Investments" is a printing business where he prints cards, papers, T-shirts and other items. He also supplies papers. He is requesting 60,000 Kes to buy embroidered patches and T-shirt labels for printing T-shirts. He employs two people in his busy business where he serves small and middle income earners. He describes himself as self-motivated and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy embroidered patches and T-shirt labels.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita D. is from the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 48 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor M.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Dist.4, San Manuel, Isabela. Amor has been in his business for over 19 years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2010, Amor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Amor is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Robert Kitti

texts.en:
Robert Kitti N. is a 26-year-old man from Mariakani. He is married to Betty and together they have one child. Robert owns a beauty shop and has been in this business for the past two years. 


This is his first loan from KADET,and he plans to use it to purchase hair products for his business. Robert plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profits.  His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Nosendewi Ene

texts.en:
Nosendewi Ene M.  is 23 years old.  She is married and supports ten people.  Nosendewi is a farmer and has been farming on her own piece of land for the last eight years.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women who are registered with KADET. This will be her second loan, which she will use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and to hire manpower for planting. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to advance her farming activity and educate her siblings.

Nosendewi's dream is to own a large piece of land for farming. She is a assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds & fertilizers and hire labor for planting

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
54-year-old Eleanor lives in the town of Surallah with her family. She is engaged in rice farming, hog-raising and retail selling. She and her husband maintain a rice farm. They sell their harvest to rice traders. She also raises pigs in their backyard and runs a small sari-sari store. Eleanor does all these activities to provide the increasing needs in their household.

Eleanor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleanor has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eleanor is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu M. R., 33 years old, is married to Mwinyi and they have six children. Mwanatumu has been running a food kiosk for the last two years. This marks her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, a sack of sugar, fruits and vegetables. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business premise. Her dream is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a farmer and a resident of  Kitale, a town in Western Kenya. He is 37 and married with three children who are all in school. He has been in mixed farming for around 10 years, selling maize and vegetables locally as his sole  source of income. 

Ronald has requested a loan of 35,000 KES  from Juhudi Kilimo to start poultry farming. The proceeds of this new income will go to feeding and educating his family. In five years' time, he hopes to have established  a profitable poultry breeding farm 

His greatest concern is competition levels and low prices, but he believes that the Juhudi Kilimo loan will help him to overcome these challenges and make a better life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 56 years old. She has two children with ages 22 and 24 years. She sells charcoal on a wholesale scale. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and pay her house rent. With the profits she plans to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale and pay her house rent.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella es casada y tiene 43 años y 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos entre otras verduras, la socia vende en el mercado de Huancaro y los días sábados y domingos vende en el mercado de San Sebastián desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar toda variedad de verduras.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de frutas, venta de artesanía, salón de belleza, venta de comida y servicio de transporte.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The "Juntos Podemos" community bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco, Peru. One of the members is Jesusa, a 43-year-old mother of four children. She makes a living selling vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and peppers, among other items. She sells at the Huancaro market, and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells at the San Sebastián market from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. Jesusa wants to improve and expand her business, and is requesting the loan to purchase all kinds of vegetables. The other members make a living selling fruits, selling handicrafts, running a beauty salon, selling food, and providing transportation services. The members are grateful to those who have made this possible and promise to make their payments in the established time.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of vegetables

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma belongs to a small city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house for the past 10 years. She is married to A. G. and has three children. All of them are very young and studying in a local school. Salma is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  

Her husband has an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy some goats & sheep to further improve his animal-sales business. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Salma is confident that her husband will be able to improve the financial condition of his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Salma.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Mahoule Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOULE est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier à Fifadji à Cotonou. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Elisée, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Née en Juin 1982 à Comè au Bénin, Elisée s’est installée au quartier Fifadji, il y a seulement un an. Elisée a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Elisée ne vit plus avec son mari. Afin de se prendre en charge et d’assurer un mieux être à son enfant, Elisée vend de la bouillie de maïs à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Elisée vend des produits de quincaillerie et de la boisson locale. Elisée  s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elisée exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Elisée désire obtenir un financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
MAHOULE group is composed of three women who live in the same neighborhood at Fifadji in Cotonou. The representative of the group, whose name is Elisée, is the one raising her hand in the photo. This group is asking for financial aid from ALIDé so that they can grow their businesses. Born in June 1982 in Comè, Bénin, Elisée settled in the Fifadji neighborhood just a year ago. Elisée has one child who is enrolled in school. She no longer lives with her husband.

 In order to support herself and ensure a better future for her child, Elisée sells maize porridge out of her home. Secondarily, she sells hardware items and local brew. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. 

Elisée has been in this business for about 10 years, and it allows her to support herself. Wishing to bolster her business and better respond to the demand of her clientele, she wants to obtain a loan, together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy maize, local drink, and hardware.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Betty. She is married and has two children aged five and three. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because he is her brother's child. 

In 2009, Betty established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to get more income to support her family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 900,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Betty requires a loan in order to buy additional clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Betty plans to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Tieng

texts.en: Tieng resides in Kompong Cham Province. To earn a living, she plants rice crops on her farmland. On average, she could make about $1.50 profit a day to use for financial expenses. She shares some responsibilities with Tieng, her husband, who is a tobacconist in the mobile place and he earns around US $2 each day. They have been married for many years and they are blessed with a kid who is attending primary school and lives under their income. To expand her husband's business, Tieng would like to borrow funds provided by leaders on Kiva to assist her husband torward buying more tobacco to store for future sale.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to store for future sale.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Наргиз проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ей 42 гда. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама Наргиз имеет средне - специальное образование, портниха. На сегодняшний день она не занимается по специальности. Она занимается торговлей на рынке центральном рынке города. В основном она продает золотые украшения. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов золотых украшений, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Nargiz lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 42 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is in the Russian Federation. Nargiz has a vocational education as a dressmaker. She does not work in her profession. She trades in the city's central market. Basically she sells gold jewelry. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of gold jewelry to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of gold jewelry

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 27 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Richelle runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Richelle has been in this business for two years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Richelle would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Honovi Amavi

texts.fr: Mère d’01 enfant, Honovi  est revendeuse de produits alimentaires (riz, sucre, huile végétale…) et des mèches. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2007 en achetant à Lomé. Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle vend à domicile.
texts.en: A mother of one child, Honovi is a retailer of groceries (rice, sugar, vegetable oil…) and hair extensions. She started this business in 2007 and makes her purchases in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This initial loan will enable her to buy more merchandise in order to respond to the demands of her customers. She sells out of her house.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Paata

texts.en: Paata is from the village of Dzlevijvari, Kareli District. He is 43 years old and lives with his wife Mzia. Paata and Mzia are farmers. They have 2.5 hectares of land, where they grow tomatoes (1.5 hectare), cabbage (0.5 hectare) and garlic (0.2 hectare).  Paata and Mzia spend the whole day in their plot. They work hard to get a good harvest in the season. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. Paata requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and drugs for plant treatment for parasites. Part of the loan will be used to pay the workforce who will help the family members. After fertilization and treatment, the family will get a good quality harvest and sell it for a good price. In the future, Paata and Mzia plan to make some savings from their income in order to renovate the house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat plants for parasites

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Anita works hard to support her family.  She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. 

Anita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her business.  Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana nació en la ciudad de Taray de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 50 años de edad, ella está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  vender gelatinas y tortas de forma ambulatoria subiendo a los buses que se dirigen a la ciudades de Cusco y Calca. 

Luciana requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, leche, huevo, mantequilla, naranjas, vainilla y otras cosas más que se necesitan para preparar más tortas. 

El Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Luciana was born in the city of Taray in the Calca province (Cusco, Peru). She is 50, married, and has six children. She currently lives in Pisaq city, where  she works. She sells Jell-O and pies on the street, going to the stops for the buses going to the cities of Cusco and Calca.

Luciana needs this loan to purchase supplies such as flour, milk, eggs, butter, oranges, vanilla, and other items that she needs for making more pies.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq district of Calca province (Cusco, Perú). Cusco is known to be a very touristic and commercial zone, and it is known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival. It is also known for being home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as flour, milk, eggs, butter, oranges, vanilla, and other items that are needed to make more pies.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel tiene 30 años dedicándose a la reparación y ventas de aparatos eléctricos que son Televisiones, modulares y dividís. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar herramienta más moderna y material que es cables especiales y piezas de eléctricas, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esta necesidad que su negocio.
Don Manuel planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su taller de reparación de aparatos electrónicos, ya que su esposa la señora Silvia se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus tres hijos que tiene. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de los trabajos que realizar para que sus clientes lo recomienden con otras personas.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel is 30 years old and works repairing and selling electrical devices such as TVs, modular systems, and DVD players.

He is requesting the loan to buy more up-do-date tools and materials, especially cables and electrical parts, as right now he doesn't have the necessary money to get what he needs for his business.

Don Manuel plans to pay back the loan with part of the earnings he gets from his electrical device repair workshop, as his wife, Señora Silvia, works looking after their three children.

He wants to improve the quality of his work so his customers recommend him to other people.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Lyn has a retail shop that sells dried fish, beauty products and homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Lyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saúl es soltero y tiene 27 años de edad. Ésta es la 3° vez que que solicita un préstamo  con fundación realidad y es para invertirlo en la compra  de frutas y verdura como son: tomate, cebolla, coliflor, pepinos, chayotes, entre otros para venderlo en  la misma localidad y lleva practicando esta actividad mas o menos un año y once meses.

     En esta actividad se  por si solo ya que vive a un con sus padres y también quiere aportar   con al de ingresos y se sientan cómodos en la economía  ya que sus papas están  grandecitos de edad  y desea  darle lo más necesario.
 
    Lo que  él desea es que con el préstamo y   su actividad el pueda salir adelante como  también tener un poco mas de ahorros para comenzar a comprar  materiales y construir una casa para vivir un poco mas cómodo
texts.en:
