Saúl is 27 years old and single.
This is the third time he requests a loan with Fundación Realidad. He will use it to purchase fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, cauliflowers, cucumbers and chayotes, among others, in order to sell them in the same town.
He has been in this business for one year and eleven months and he does it all by himself. He still lives with his parents and wants to contribute with his profits so that they feel comfortable with their savings. His parents are elderly and he wishes to give them what they need most. 
He wishes that, with this loan and his business, he is able to get ahead. He also wishes to get some more savings so that he can start to buy materials and build a house in order to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase local fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco tiene 53 años, el se dedica a la venta de pan. Desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, pues el arduo trabajo que realiza es muy reconfortante para él. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de plan simple, semitas, picos, empanadas entre otros. Posee mucha clientela ya que él se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy honesto, responsable y dedicado a su trabajo. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio de tal manera que sus ingresos se vean aumentados y logre mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Es por esta razón que tomo la decisión de solicitar este crédito para la compra de una variedad de pan.
texts.en:
José Francisco is 53 years old and has been selling bread for more than six years. Working hard at his business is very comforting for him.

The reason for this loan is to buy plain bread, sweet rolls, pastries, turnovers, and other products. José Francisco has many customers since he is known for being an honest and responsible man who is dedicated to his work. His dream is to see his business flourish so that his income will increase and he can improve the quality of life for his family. For this reason, he decided to request a loan in order to buy a variety of bread.

loans.use: to buy plain bread, sweet rolls, pastries, turnovers, and other baked goods.

loans.name: Francisco Agustin

texts.es:
Francisco Agustín tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de siete y cinco meses de edad  en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los insumos y semillas sin ningún problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir otro préstamo pero ya el monto más alto para comprar más terreno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Francisco Agustín is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children (ages 7 and 5 months) in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Feeling) is located in the Caimito II neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of farmers who grow short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Francisco engages in farming by growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. His purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer so that he can keep his crops in good condition. This loan will be of great help because he can buy supplies and seeds without any problem.

The challenges he must face on a frequent basis include the competition and the pests. His dream is to continue working so that he can acquire another loan that is a larger amount in order to buy more land.

In his free time Francisco enjoys practicing sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and lives in Ibabao Aloran,Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.
 
Letecia has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 400 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store.
 
Letecia has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Gansukh, 44, is a taxi driver around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his 3 kids on the boundary side of the city. He has been running his business since 1999, but not earning enough to provide for all of his family expenses.
 
His family owns an old house which was built in the early 1990s. Since it was built, no repairs or renovations have been made to it. Lately his house has became very old and damaged in many places. Especially, all of the windows have broken in the last several years. Therefore, it loses the heat to the outside through the windows. Due to this, his home becomes very cold during the winter time.   

Gansukh is taking a loan to purchase new windows to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.use: To purchase new windows to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей женат, у него 8-летний сын и 12-летняя дочка. Вся семья живет в Каменке. Уже на протяжении 6 последних лет Сергей занимается выращиванием ранних помидоров и огурцов. Он имеет 6 больших теплиц. Ежегодно на семена и полиэтиленовую пленку тратит около 45 000 гривен. В хозяйство вложено в целом около 100 000 гривен. 

Сергей планирует использовать кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы установить отопление в теплицах. Более того, Сергей натягивает второй слой пленки, чтобы качественнее утеплить теплицы и иметь возможность вовремя высадить овощи в необходимом количестве и получить соответствующую прибыль. Сергей очень надеется получить дополнительную прибыль со своего сельскохозяйственного бизнеса, чтобы в следующем году вложить ее в ремонт своего дома, который уже давно нуждается в капитальном ремонте.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Sergei is married with an 8-year-old son and 12-year-old daughter. The whole family lives in Kamenka. For the last six years, Sergei has been engaged in the growing of early tomatoes and cucumbers. He has six large greenhouses. Annually, he spends about 45,000 hryvnia on seeds and plastic sheeting. There is around 100,000 hryvnia invested in the enterprise as a whole.

Sergei plans to use the loan of 20,000 hryvnia to install heating in the greenhouses. Moreover, Sergei is fastening a second layer of film to warm the greenhouses in a better manner to have the possibility in time to plant vegetables in sufficient quantities and to obtain corresponding profits. 

Sergei very much hopes to gain additional profit from his farming business in order next year to finish repairs on his home, which has long been in need of repair.

loans.use: install heating in greenhouses

loans.name: Yar

texts.en: Yar is a 32 year old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. For the past three years she has had a business selling bread in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more bread to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina lives in a community where the people work together to better their livelihoods and develop their village. She is 60 years old and already a widow. She is responsible for raising her five children by herself. She supports her five children through her farm. Saturnina is thankful to God that she was able to raise her children to grow up with good attitudes, even though she didn't have enough money to provide them with a high level of education.

Currently, Saturnina hopes to create better opportunities in her farming and hog-raising business. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 so she can buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. 

She is glad that they have their own hand tractor because it makes farm cultivation easy. The family also owns a tricycle, which serves as another source of income. Saturnina believes that praying to God is the best way to become successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow for her farm

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cornelio de 46 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila, ya que a su edad ya se dio el gusto de formar y sacar adelante a sus 03 queridos hijos. Marcelina, desde muy joven empezó a ganarse la vida trabajando de distintas formas,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y su puesto esta situado en el mercado de Kimbiri, donde Marcelina tiene su puesto de venta. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes la visitan continuamente, debido a los lindos y novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente desde la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor les quede, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuando hay días en que la venta es baja. 
Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda más grande, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo por parte de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa de Lima, de preferencia ropa liviana, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en esta parte de la selva peruana
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 50, is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Cornelio, age 46. What she wants most is to live peacefully in her retirement. Because of her age, Marcelina had the pleasure of training and bringing up her three beloved children. From a very early age, she began working in different ways. Marcelina sells clothes and has a stand at the market in Kimbiri where she conducts business. All of her customers come to this place and continue to do business with her because they are treated with great friendliness and courtesy. Marcelina offers beautiful and stylish clothing that she brings in personally from the city of Lima. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers which clothes look best on them. This also provides her with a little bit of a distraction. Marcelina has been in business for five years and considers the most difficult part to be dealing with days when her sales are low.

Over time, she wants to have a larger shop so that she can provide better service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she is pleased to know that she has the support of the Kiva lenders. Since her ability to make purchases with this request has been secured, Marcelina is willing to submit her payments promptly and on schedule. This loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy clothing from Lima, preferably lightweight garments. This type of clothing sells more frequently in this part of the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: to buy lightweight clothing to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Wilfredo tiene 33 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, él nació en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal de Wilfredo es la construcción civil y también tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Wilfredo requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. (El socio en la fotografia esta acompañado de su esposa).
texts.en:
The “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” communal bank’s members are responsible, hardworking people who support their families.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco where they also carry out their economic activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

Wilfredo is 33 years old and lives in a common law relationship.  He was born in Cusco District in Cusco Province and Cusco Department and still lives in the beautiful city of his birth.  Wilfredo’s main economic activity is civil construction but also has a small family business selling small farm animals.  He’s been in business for several years now and does very well.  On this occasion Wilfredo needs the loan to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  

(In the photo, he’s accompanied by his wife.)

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 37 years old and lives in Kipkelyon village in the ever green Kericho area of Kenya. She practices horticultural and dairy farming for a living. For the last two years, she has made a living selling crops and engaging in seasonal businesses. 

Sara is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. In order to scale up this business, she needs more land. With this loan, Sara will use part of the money to rent land and the rest to pay for farm inputs and labour. 

This expansion will guarantee a better harvest for the young diligent farmer. Income from this investment will offset other farm-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Sara replied, "Even though I am a smallholder farmer, the investment will put food on the table at least daily."
Be inspired and support a smallholder farmer from Kenya!

loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Working in the fields is one of the hardest jobs nowadays due to the great effort that must be made to get ahead in it, but Fridah is a smallholder farmer who has never given up regardless of bad weather or unfortunate circumstances. She is always willing to get the resources her family needs. 

Fridah, 44, loves dairy farming! A very large portion of her farm is allocated for dairy only. Besides her attachment to cows, what makes dairy farming attractive to Fridah is the thriving milk market in Chuka where she hails from. To grow the dairy business, Fridah is seeking support from individual international lenders. 

With the contribution from Kiva lenders, Fridah is going to construct proper housing for her dairy animals. The housing will provide shelter, protection, and a hygienic environment conducive to her animals' well-being. The housing also paves way for the introduction of a zero-grazing model which has proved successful and profitable in multiple dairy farms. 

Invest in Fridah and empower a progressive farmer, a wife, and a mother from Chuka, Kenya.

loans.use: To construct a cowshade

loans.name: Jeiner

texts.es:
Jeiner con 24 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa alquilada, junto a su cónyuge,en el distrito de El Milagro,provincia de Utcubamba,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en si mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general,con una experiencia en negocio desde hace mas de 2 años, sus compras las realiza semanalmente en la ciudad de Bagua, contando con proveedores reconocidos,sus días de mayor venta son los domingos donde bajan moradores de los diversos caseríos aledaños.El crédito otorgado será destinado para la compra de abarrotes para surtir tienda y con ello obtener visión de sus clientes para esta campaña navideña, con ello tendrá como impacto más ingresos a la bolsa familiar. ya que estamos a pocos meses de las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.

Jeiner es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge y sus avales.

loans.use: para la compra de abarrotes para surtir tienda y con ello obtener visión de sus clientes para esta campaña navideña

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy a high breed dairy cow

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina O., who is a 43 years old and married with four (4) children, lives in a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Tina is a dedicated client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of plywood. She wishes to use her loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more plywood for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more soap detergent to expand her current business.

loans.name: Alice Angelo

texts.pt:
Alice Angelo Covela was born on the 26th of February, 1959. She is a native of Maputo and a daughter of a police officer and a homemaker. She attended school until the 8th grade. She started working at the age of 27. Although due to sickness, she had to abandon her job. Later, her godfather offered her a kiosk, which she left to construct a small commercial establishment near the Ferroviario club in 1986. In 2003, the municipal council destroyed the building. That same year she rented a stand at the People's Market.

Through a cousin, Alice came to know Hluvuku-Adsema and asked for a loan of 1,000 dollars to invest in her business. With a previous loan, she was able to improve the conditions of her business, increasing qualitatively and quantitavely the meals she prepares. She has 2 establishments, the second localized in the Maxaquene district. This establishment allows her to work later hours. The establishment located in the People's Market must close by 7pm, the time when she has the most customers. The community is greatly impacted by this business; beyond providing food to local workers, her income allows her to support 5 people and employ two kitchen workers.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Alice Ângelo Covela, nascida em 26 de Fevereiro de 1959, natural de Maputo, filha de Pai Policia e mãe domestica, estudou ate oitava classe. Começou a trabalhar aos 27 anos, onde por motivo de doença teve que abandonar o emprego. Mais tarde o seu padrinho ofereceu lhe um quiosque onde começou a praticar a actividade que até agora desenvolve, alienou esse estabelecimento e foi construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no recinto do clube Ferroviário em 1986 onde veio a sair em 2003 com a destruição das mesmas pelo conselho Municipal. No mesmo ano ela foi alugar uma banca No Mercado do Povo onde até então desenvolve a sua actividade.

Por intermédio de uma prima sua e que é cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema informou se sobre os requisitos e recorrendo a um empréstimo de 15 000,00mt para reforçar deste modo o seu negocio. Com o empréstimo de 25.000,00mt melhorou cada vez mais as condições de atraçao de clientes no seu estabelecimento tendo aumentado qualitativamente e quantitativamente as refeições que confeciona. Conta actulamente com 2 estabelecimentos e que o segundo está localizado no bairro de Maxaquene. Este, permite-lhe trabalhar até mais tarde já que no Mercado do Povo onde está localizado o 1º estabelecimento, não é permitido trabalhar acima das 19 horas e sendo este, o momento em que regista maior afluxo de clientes. A actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para além de fornecer refeições aos funcionários que trabalham a redor do mercado, com os rendimentos consegue sustentar 5 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade e dar emprego a duas serventes de cozinha com quem trabalha.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material to make uniforms

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita M. is 31 years old and lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives  with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Manish M., is a plumber. Her older son is in grade 8 and  her younger son is in grade 1.
Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. Due to lack of money she cannot expand her business. So she is seeking a Rs25000 (US$400) loan to buy necessary goods like rice, bitten rice, noodles, biscuits, etc. to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Aah

texts.en: Aah is 40 years old and has a 16 year old child. She runs a small food stall where she sells regular snacks and fried snacks.  She usually earns US $5 per day. She also sells meatballs and earns US $5 per day from this business. Her husband, K., is a driver who earns US $20 per week.  She is requesting a IDR 500,000 loan to buy the supplies she needs to make the food that she sells.  She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy groceries to produce her foods

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25 year old young man who owns a DVD store. Mohamad is a self-made man, an ambitious and determined young entrepreneur. Mohamad needs a loan to be able to widen the variety of the movies he can offer his clients. Boosting sales is important for him so that his store can generate enough revenue to pay for his father's medicA. bills.

loans.use: To widen the variety of movies sold in his DVD store

loans.name: Kavule C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Robinah N.. She has a restaurant business and is requesting a loan to expand it. Robinah is 43 years old and married. She has 2 children, ages 18 and 22, and her children go to school. Each week, Robinah makes approximately UGX 60000 (~ $35 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct her own business premises.

Robinah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 300000 (~ $175 USD), to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Robinah is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Nulu Nabukenya, Angella B., and Florence N.. Prossy N. has a business selling vegetables and wants to add to her business with the loan. Nulu Nabukenya is currently operating a business selling cold drinks and wants a loan to buy another refrigerator. Angella B. sells clothing and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Florence N. has a restaurant business and is requesting a loan to buy more furniture and raw food.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan D., age 48, works sells a variety of a grocery products, normally making an average of $15 in revenue. Her husband supplements the household income as a policeman and earns about $2.50 a day. This couple has one child.

To expand her business, Mrs. D. would like to loan from Kiva to purchase a grocery products in bulk to save money and to meet her customers’ demand. This is the second loan for this family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Daung

texts.en: Daung Y. is a 22 year old mother with one little child. She owns a plot of farmland and has been growing rice since 2000.  She currently earns about $1 a day.  Her husband is named Sem Sren and he is a 27 year old construction worker who builds houses. Normally he makes about $5 a day. Their child is just two years old. They would like to borrow $125 through Kiva  to purchase cow to assist with their farm work and thereby increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase cow to help with farm work.

loans.name: Stephen Kwesi

texts.en:
Stephen Kwesi P. is an electrician, who is married with two children. His business is doing well, but he wishes to improve the quality of his service conditions.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more electrical materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy more electrical materials

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
For 3 years, Mercedes has worked as a street vendor selling snacks in central Lima. She used to make a living making macrame bracelets at home, but she began working as a street vendor because it provided her with a daily income. She works from 9 in the morning to 9 at night. Even so, she still makes her bracelets late at night or on days that she doesn't go out to work as a street vendor. She makes 50 bracelets a day.

The loans that she has requested have gone to buying the snacks that she resells or for thread that she uses to make the bracelets. Mercedes would like to set up a snackbar in her house but she wants to continue making bracelets, as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 3 años, Mercedes vende golosinas en el centro de Lima de forma ambulatoria. Antes de dedicaba íntegramente al tejido de pulseras de macramé en su casa, sin embargo, empezó a vender en las calles, ya que esta actividad le da ganancias diarias. Trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. No obstante, Mercedes aún continúa tejiendo sus pulseras por las noches, o los días que no sale a vender. Diariamente teje 50 pulseras.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar más golosinas e hilo para tejer las pulseras. A Mercedes le gustaría poner una bodega en su casa, pero sin descuidar el tejido de pulseras.

loans.use: Buy snacks for resale and materials for making products for resale.
